Title: Take action against engineers: HC
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kochi: State government should take action against the engineers responsible for the maintenance of the road stretch at Palariavttom where a youth died in December, the high court directed on Wednesday.

Justice Devan Ramachandran issued the directive while considering a petition (WP-C No. 32680/2008) filed by C P Ajithkumar through advocate Tom K Thomas highlighting the bad condition of roads in Kochi. Yadu Lal, who was riding a motorcycle, had died when he was run over by a truck after falling off the bike when it fell into a pit.

In the interim order issued on Wednesday, the court said, “As regards the accident at Palarivattom on 12.12.2019 is concerned, this court certainly requires the government to place on record the nature of action that they propose, particularly with respect to the personal responsibility to be fixed on the concerned engineers and officials, who are in charge of the road concerned, since it is without doubt that, going by the judgment of this court in this writ petition, such action is imperative, which will act as a deterrent in future to any casual or lackadaisical conduct by such authorities.” tnn

Title: Surat likely to get air link to Nanded, Jalgaon and Indore
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Surat airport is connected with major cities in the country including Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Delhi, Mumbai, Jai... Read More

Surat: If all goes as planned , the Diamond City will soon have air connectivity with tier-II cities like Indore, Nanded and Jalgaon.

A private airline company, TrueJet is planning to connect Surat with the tier-II cities following representation from Navsari MP C R Paatil. The company is likely to start the flight services by the end of February.

Paatil told TOI: “I had a meeting with the top management of TrueJet company for connecting Surat with Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh. The company has shown its willingness to connect Surat with Indore, Nanded and Jalgaon.”

According to Paatil, the company has started survey of potential traffic to these three cities and is very positive on the success of the operation. The company will be offering attractive travel fares to tap the passengers wanting to travel to these locations.

Sources said that TrueJet is already providing regional air connectivity to the cities like Ahmedabad, Goa, Mysore, Vijaywada, Salem, Hyderabad, Tirupati, Aurangabad, Bengaluru, Chennai and Kandla. Surat has been selected for the routes including Nanded, Jalgaon and Indore.

At present, the Surat airport is connected with major cities in the country including Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Delhi, Mumbai, Jaipur, Goa and Kolkata. There are around 20 flight operations in a day, catering to more than 3,500 passengers.

Atul Gupta, owner of Shri Rani Sati Travels, said, “There is a huge potential of air travel from Surat to Nanded, Jalgaon and Indore. There is a large chunk of passengers who would prefer travelling by air to these locations than going by the train. The major benefit will come from the textile sector and other industries located in and around Surat and south Gujarat.”

Gupta added, “We are helping the airline company in the survey of the passenger traffic and they are quite happy. Nanded and Jalgaon are very important destinations for Surat for business, religious tourism and otherwise. Also, there is very less train connectivity in all these destinations and that the airline company will be able to tap the business.”

Title: Government officials keep distance from Jeff Bezos
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos (File photo)

NEW DELHI/BENGALURU: Mounting concerns of small traders prompted government officials to give visiting Amazon boss Jeff Bezos a miss.

Although Bezos, who is among the richest men, landed in the capital on Tuesday and spent the better part of Wednesday in Delhi, he limited the scope of his second trip to India after over five years to meeting businessmen, merchants, and the film industry.

Government sources said that ministers in the Narendra Modi Cabinet did not show much inclination in meeting Bezos given the recent anti-trust probe announced into Amazon India as well as allegations of the company not complying with foreign investment rules in letter and spirit.

With Delhi elections less than a month away, the BJP government may have opted to avoid the retail giant, which is often accused of destroying small businesses.

While an Amazon spokesperson did not respond to TOI’s queries, sources close to Amazon India played down the issue, saying Bezos did not ask for meetings with government officials even though various reports earlier this month said he may meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit. Bezos had met Modi during his last official visit in October 2014 and then in June 2016 when Modi visited the US, when Amazon announced plans to increase India investments from $2 billion to $5 billion.

His visit comes as the Competition Commission of India (CCI) is probing Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart over exclusive arrangements, giving preference to a few sellers, promoting private labels and deep discounts.

During the Delhi leg of his trip, Bezos addressed small businesses, flew a kite with kids to celebrate Makar Sankranti and then also chaired a review of the India business.

On Thursday, he is expected to be in Mumbai, where he will attend a Prime Video event with Bollywood celebrities like Shah Rukh Khan and A R Rahman, besides visiting some Amazon sellers and partners in the city.

On Friday, he is expected to meet corporate leaders including Mukesh Ambani of Reliance Industries, which has recently launched a competing marketplace JioMart, besides Future Group’s Kishore Biyani and others.

Title: Yes Bank names IDFC Securities for fund-raising
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: Troubled lender Yes Bank has appointed IDFC Securities as an adviser for raising funds and also to bring in a strategic investor.

On Tuesday, the bank had informed the bourses that it has called for an extraordinary meeting of its shareholders to approve fund-raising of up to Rs 10,000 crore through one or more ways, including institutional placements, rights offer, preferential allotment, offer of convertible bonds and debentures.

IDFC Securities, which was recently purchased by Dharmesh Mehta — who was formerly with Enam Group and Axis Bank, has, along with some other reputed investors, bagged the mandate to advise the bank during its fund-raising process. It will also look at bringing in strategic advisers, sources said.

Lately, names of a host of individual and institutional investors, some even with dubious reputations, were floating around for rescuing the troubled lender. However, none of them finally came ahead to infuse any serious money in the bank.

Uncertainty about Yes Bank’s fund raising, crucial for it to meet regulatory requirements, has taken a toll on its stock price in the past few days. The bank on Wednesday said there were baseless rumours on it not meeting capital adequacy ratio and it was on course to raise funds.From a high of Rs 48 on January 9, the stock on Tuesday had fallen to Rs 37 level only to rise 3% on Wednesday to close at Rs 40. The clarification by the bank came after the close of trading.

Title: Aurangabad: Forest officials fiddle as nylon manja continues to harm birds
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

The forest department is doing nothing to curb the illegal sale of nylon and glass-coated manja in the city

AURANGABAD: Even with more powers than police, the forest department is doing nothing to curb the illegal sale of nylon and glass-coated manja in the city and state while birds continue to suffer from injuries.

Traditionally, only the police have been carrying out crackdowns on such vendors, who are often invoked with various sections of Indian Penal Code and CrPc. The forest department, on the other hand, can book an offender through various section of the Environment Protection Act 1986, Prevention of Cruelty of Animal Act 1960 and Wildlife (Protection) Act 1972. Notably, the responsibility of ensuring necessary compliance with all these legislations falls on the shoulder of the Forest department.

For records, the Maharashtra government introduced the ban on such threads in June 2015 while the National Green Tribunal had declared a country-wide ban on these manjas almost two-years later in July 2017. The Maharashtra government had also invoked section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act 1986 to introduce the ban in question and the forest department has a key role to play in the implementation of the said legislation in a letter and spirit.

Several birds have been found injured due to the banned nylon manja and synthetic manjas being used for kite flyers during the ongoing Makara Sankranti festival.

Bird-expert Kishor Pathak said every year at least 200 birds receive injuries due to banned threads used for the kite flying in the city of Aurangabad , which is known for having more penchant for the kites. “Even if the festival of Sankranti is observed on only one day, revelers indulge in the kite flying for at least a total couple of months. These dangerous threads remain tangled on branches of different trees which serve as the dwelling for the feathery-creatures. Many birds get trapped and injured by banned manjas throughout the year and some of them die eventually,” he said.

Pathak said that the Forest department must deal with the banned manja vendors with stringent norms. “Going by the ruling of the NGT, the Forest department has more onus that the police to curb the sale of banned threads. The police have a limited legal framework, but the Forest authorities have multiple laws at their dispense to deal with the issue effectively,” he said.

Besides birds, the banned manjas are also posing a huge potential to humans. It may be recalled that a 26-year-old woman Ayurvedic doctor Krupali Nikam was killed after her throat was slit by manja at Kasarwadi area of Pune during October 2018.

Chief Conservator of Forest P K Mahajan said he would go into the details of NGT order concerned. “We have legal limitations in carrying out the stock verification and the same can be done by the police or revenue officials effectively. Still, we will study the NGT order carefully and decide the future course of action,” he said.

Title: PPU senate passes Rs486cr annual budget for 2020-21
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

PATNA: The Patliputra University (PPU) senate unanimously passed the estimated annual budget of Rs485.80 crore for the 2020-21 financial year at its meeting held under the chairmanship of vice-chancellor (VC) Prof Gulab Chand Ram Jaiswal here on Tuesday.

According to Prof Jaiswal, the senate members approved all the proposals which were approved earlier by the PPU academic council and syndicate on Monday. Senate member Alok Tiwary raised the issue of FIRs lodged by the university in the past against agitating students and demanded withdrawal of the cases against them. The VC asked the PPU proctor to look into the matter sympathetically.

Senate member Munna Siddiqui raised the issue of increasing seats in postgraduate (PG) departments of all major subjects being taught in Nalanda district. He also demanded deployment of women security at each women’s college in Nalanda and stressed on the need of implementing the state government’s ‘Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali’ programme in each college. State higher education director Rekha Kumari asked the VC to send a proposal to state government for implementation of ‘Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali’ programme in all PPU colleges.

Senate member Bijendra Kumar raised the issue of faculty crunch in Bikram college. The VC said guest teachers selected by the university would be sent to all colleges facing faculty shortage. Senate member Shyam Patel demanded PPU students’ union election at the earliest. The VC said the university would seek a directive from Raj Bhavan in this connection.

While senate member Radhe Syham raised the issues related to registration of PhD scholars for the session 2017-19 and availability of adequate number of books in the university library, PPU teachers’ association president Prof A K Singh Thakur welcomed the VC’s announcement to ensure payment of three months’ salaries to teaching and non-teaching staff in the revised payscales by the end of this month.

Among others who were present at the senate meeting were PPU pro-VC Prof G K Choudhary, deans Prof Vijyalaxmi, Prof R K Sharma and Prof M P Singh, registrar Prof K K Singh, College of Commerce, Arts and Science principal Prof Tapan Kumar Sandaliya, R K D College principal Prof Indrajit Rai, state government representative Narendra Kumar Singh, members Pratibha Singh, Prof Rajendra Prasad Gupta, Shyam Krishna and Ajay Yadav.

According to PPU media incharge Prof B K Manglam, the syndicate meeting on Monday approved all the proposals of the 4th academic council. The syndicate meeting approved the proposal to exempt all those candidates who have recently cleared UGC NET examinations, from appearing at the pre PhD test of the university. Besides, the meeting also approved the proposal of the members to set up a grievance cell and anti-ragging committee at the university level to address students’ grievances, he said.

Title: Molest charge against ‘BJP men’ who attacked JU student, friend
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kolkata: Cops probing a complaint lodged by a Jadavpur University student and her friend, who were allegedly beaten up by BJP supporters during the party’s street-corner meeting in Bikramgarh on Tuesday night, have registered two separate FIRs against the accused and booked them under multiple IPC sections, including non-bailable ones dealing with molestation.

“We have started a probe into the complaint. We recorded statements of the victims and took them to the incident spot on Tuesday night itself in order to identify the accused. However, none was found there. The complainants, too, haven’t mentioned any particular person. However, we are speaking to local residents and other witnesses to establish the offenders’ identities,” said an officer.

According to the complaint, around 9pm on Tuesday, the two friends — a second-year sociology student of Jadavpur University and a 26-year-old professional musician — were allegedly walking past a BJP street-corner meeting near Bikramgarh market when an altercation broke out between the two and the party workers.

“We were walking past the meeting when we heard the man on the dais speak foul against Jadavpur University students and the entire movement against CAA and NRC led by the students. We were angered by the comments but we didn’t say anything to them. We spoke among ourselves and criticised the speech. However, some in the crowd overheard us and after we had crossed the meeting venue, a group of 40-odd men came running from the meeting and blocked us,” said the musician, adding that he could identify some of the attackers by their faces, but didn’t know their names.

The couple allegedly tried to reason with the men, but they allegedly called the duo “naxals” and began assaulting them. “They hit my friend and, when I tried to stop them, they also assaulted me. They cornered us and began calling more people till a local shopkeeper came to our rescue and moved us out of the area. The entire situation was scary and I am suffering from a sense of insecurity and want the men to be arrested,” said the woman.

A day after the incident, students of Jadavpur University organized a protest rally from the University’s Gate 4 till the Bikramgarh market. “Both of us have been regular faces in all the anti-NRC and anti-CAA rallies in the recent past and we believe it was an organized attack because of that,” said the musician.

Meanwhile, senior BJP leaders said they will cooperate with the investigating agency in the particular case, but none of the local leaders who had organized the meeting responded to repeated calls made by the newspaper. “There are a few people who are trying to instigate BJP workers. But we do not support any violence. Let law take its course and our leaders will cooperate with the investigating authority,” said BJP state general secretary Sayantan Basu.

Title: MSEDCL residents tariff may be steepest after 5-8% hike
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: MSEDCL , which supplies power to Bhandup, Mulund, Thane, Navi Mumbai and the rest of the state, has proposed a 5-8% tariff hike for up to 300 units of consumption. This would be the costliest power tariff in the state. There will be no hike in tariff for high-end domestic users of above 300 units, but it will still be the highest among all power utilities in the state.Last week, BEST proposed the cheapest power tariff for its domestic consumers despite a hike, followed by Tata Power while Adani Electricity proposed a dip in its.The latest MSEDCL petition has offered sops to industry as it proposed just 1% hike in electricity every year for the next five years while commercial establishments, including shops and traders, will face no tariff hikes. This is being done in a bid to woo industries and ensure they do not migrate out of Maharashtra.For residential consumers with a monthly consumption of less than 100 units, 8% hike in tariff was proposed from Rs 3.05 per unit to Rs 3.30. For those in the 101-300 unit consumption category, a 5% hike was proposed from Rs 6.95 to Rs 7.30. For high-end residential users, there was a “zero” hike for 301-500 units for five years at a stretch and for above 500 units consumption, none for three financial years and a marginal hike of 1% for the next two years.“We have to pay huge electricity bills despite the fact that the power utility firm is being run by the state whereas private operators offer cheaper rates in Mumbai,” said Sharmistha Mitra, a Vashi resident. “The sad part is we do not have any alternative to switch over to another supplier unlike in the island city where there is Tata Power and BEST and in the suburbs where there is a healthy competition between Adani Electricity and Tata,” she said.A few activists had warned if MSEDCL continued to hike tariffs , it may compel industries to shift out of Maharashtra. A senior government official has rubbished this saying as per the latest tariff petition, the overall hike in the industry tariff was proposed from Rs 7.07 to Rs 7.11 per unit — or just 0.5% for 2020-21. The hike was not more than 1% for the next four years.In an unprecedented move, there was “zero hike” for rates of high tension commercial users, which include shops, traders, business houses and others for the next five financial years. In fact, there is a marginal, 3 paise drop in tariff for these users from Rs 11.73 per unit to Rs 11.70 in April after which rates will be unchanged till March 2025.Electric vehicle charging station (high tension) rate is proposed to escalate by 3-6%.

Title: One-stop service centre in Bhagalpur by March 31
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

BHAGALPUR: With an aim to facilitate all necessary services apart from normal postal and banking services to common people in Bhagalpur and Banka districts, the department of post has decided to introduce one-stop ‘Common Services Centre’ (CSC) at its head post offices in Bhagalpur division as part of its makeover plan.

Officials said the motive is to provide services, including application for issuing documents related to residence, caste, old age pension, widow pension among others, apart from routine works such as delivering letters, mails, accepting deposits under small savings schemes, providing life insurance cover under Postal Life Insurance (PLI) and Rural Postal Life Insurance (RPLI).

Arvind Kumar Singh, postal superintendent of Bhagalpur division, said the one-stop CSC would start functioning by March 31. “People in rural areas at times feel harassed, while running from office to office to seek various certificates and avail services. Our endeavour is to provide various possible services under one roof to the customers,” he said.

Singh said the postal officers and staff would be trained to understand the procedures and work assigned to CSC. “A nodal officer in the rank of associate postal director will be made overall incharge of the CSC, whereas master trainer will look after the working of the CSC,” he said.

He said the CSC would not only cater to customers but also unburden government departments from the additional works. “The post offices have already started banking services, besides providing ATMs, credit and debit card facilities,” he said.

Title: Mercury may fall after January 16 in Patna, says Met
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Earlier, the weatherman had predicted rainfall in Patna on Thursday and Friday (File photo)

PATNA: Cold day condition prevailed in the state on Wednesday as India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast scattered rainfall in Patna as well as central, south and north regions of Bihar on January 18 and 19.

“After January 16, the minimum and maximum temperatures would gradually fall by 2 and 5 degree Celsius respectively in Patna,” the weatherman said.

Earlier, the weatherman had predicted rainfall in Patna on Thursday and Friday. But Patna Meteorological Centre bulletin on Wednesday stated that there would be no rainfall in state capital on January 16 and 17. “The minimum temperature may fall 1- 2 degree Celsius during the next 2-3 days,” it said.

Its daily bulletin stated that weather remained dry across the state during the last 24 hours, while dense fog was observed in West Champaran, East Champaran, Gopalganj, Siwan and Saran areas. “Cold day condition was observed at few places over Bihar during the last 24 hours. The minimum temperature in Patna was recorded at 9.4 degree Celsius and maximum was 20.7 degree C on Wednesday,”” the bulletin said.

Sabour had the maximum and minimum temperatures at 22.4 and 6.6 degree Celsius on Wednesday.

The cyclonic circulation, which brought snow and rainfall in northern plains are now positioned near Madhya Pradesh and adjoining east Uttar Pradesh. It would affect several parts of Bihar between January 16 and 19. Its eastward movement will bring northwesterly wind and extend the fog cover over Bihar.

Title: Min pulls up rly staff over defunct detector
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

hjljlkjlkjhlkjhkjhkjhkjhkjhkjhkjmjhkkgjhgjhgfjffhgfh

Hyderabad: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy on Thursday pulled up railway officials and Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel after he found the door frame metal detector at Secunderabad railway station to be defunct.

Kishan Reddy was at the Secunderabad station to catch a train to a municipality as part of BJP municipal elections campaign.

Kishan Reddy was on his way to Bellampalli, Narsapur, Godavarikhani and Ramagundam municipalities.

SCR principal chief security commissioner GM Eswara Rao told TOI, “The door frame metal detector is supposed to beep when a passenger walks in with a metal item. It was not working when minister Kishan Reddy came to the station due to a technical issue. We have replaced it. We have also asked for more door frame metal detectors.”

Secunderabad railway station handles around 1.25 lakh passengers during festive season.

“We will be deploying additional forces from Railway Protection Special Force (RPSF). Currently, the RPF is short-staffed. We have sought 780 new personnel for RPF and they are undergoing training. There will soon be greater security at the railway stations and platforms. To temporarily sort out the problem, we are roping in special forces,” said Eswara Rao.

A member of an anti-terror cop squad said, “Secunderabad was on Lashkar-e-Toiba’s hit list. During Sankranti, there is huge rush of passengers. RPF and Government Railway Police (GRP) personnel shall ensure the safety and security of passengers.”

Title: National faces at short-notice rallies make cops’ job tougher
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

KOLKATA: The city turning into the epicentre of protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), besides Delhi, has posed a new challenge for Kolkata Police . With multiple protests being lined up at a very short notice across multiple locations every day, the cops are getting just a few hours to prepare themselves. What’s worse, some of the prominent anti-establishment faces in the country, like former JNU leader Umar Khalid, psephologist and Swaraj Abhiyan founder Yogendra Yadav, Jamia student Ayesha Renna and ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan, are regularly coming to Kolkata, keeping cops on their toes.

The cops are now walking the extra mile to collect information — consulting the protesters themselves, keeping tabs on social media and connecting with campus representatives. “The calls for permission are coming in really late. On certain occasions, they are merely being mailed to divisional DCPs or Lalbazar with intimation that the protest would be organized later in the day,” said an officer.

Cops said that with several protests lined up from Thursday — including a gathering of Jamia and Aligarh University students at JU and central Kolkata — Lalbazar has decided to set up an SOP to be followed for all short-notice protests.

All divisions have been provided with extra forces, a few police stations close to the protest sites have been asked to pitch in whenever required and OCs and additional OCs have been asked to help neighbouring police stations whenever required. For example, at the Bikramgarh Market protests organized on Wednesday by JU students, at least four different police stations were asked to pitch in. The police have advised people to follow the last-minute changes in traffic flow. “We have adopted a practical model. We want to stop traffic only when a rally reaches close to that spot. There is also an effort to keep at least one flank open,” an officer said.

Reserved battalions have been posted at sensitive areas and there is special vigil at certain spots. Senior IPS officers are also slated to meet religious heads on Friday.

Title: Burglars steal Rs 10L cash from doctor’s clinic
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Surat: A doctor in Sarthana lost Rs 10 lakh cash , which he had arranged to pay for his daughter’s fees in a Canada university, when two burglars targeted his clinic on January 14.

Dr Kirti Patel, 42, who runs a clinic in Swaminarayan Nagar Society, had put in Rs five lakh from his own savings and borrowed an equal amount to pay for the fees. On January 12 evening, he kept Rs five lakh of his savings in the drawer in the clinic, thinking that it would be safe. The next day, he borrowed Rs five lakh from his father-in-law and kept the cash in the same drawer.

He was planning to take take the whole amount and sent it for fee payment on January 14. However, when he reached there from his house in Utran and opened the drawer, Dr Patel was shocked to find the entire cash missing.

CCTV footages showed two persons coming near the clinic on a motorcycle. “We tracked their movement through CCTV, but the bike’s number was not seen due to poor resolution and absence of proper night vision camera. We are searching for more clues,” said Sarthana police station officials.

The thieves entered after breaking the lock of the shutter. The doctor told police that no one else except him knew about the cash kept in the drawer. “It seems to a handiwork of some professional thieves. They have not left any any marks in the clinic.”

Title: Bihar: Attempt to grab Magadh University land foiled
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Magadh University

GAYA: Attempt to grab nearly three acres of land belonging to the Magadh University was foiled on Wednesday as VC Prof Rajendra Prasad, registrar Sidnath Prasad Deen along with other university officials and local police reached the site where land grabbers were engaged in the construction of a boundary wall.

Confirming the incident, the registrar said that it was a serious matter and the state government as well the Chancellor’s office is being informed about the incident. “An FIR has also been lodged against the land grabber,” said the registrar. The land is located at Sripur Tand village of Mocharim panchayat to the south of MU campus.

As per available information about 100 acres off campus land donated to the university by philanthropists is currently under adverse possession. The university pays land rent to the government and the land produce including fruit and grains are usurped by land-grabbers. Successive VCs have requested the state government to evict the land usurpers but the complaints have largely gone unheeded. About 71 acres of the land is located at Zindapur village.

According to university insiders, the estate department staff of the university entrusted with the upkeep of the varsity assets has been hand in glove with the land-grabbers for obvious reasons.

Meanwhile, the university syndicate on Tuesday decided to convene the annual meeting of the senate. Senate is the apex body of the university and it functions through the syndicate. The senate meet has been scheduled for 16 February. The annual budget of the university for the financial year 2020-21 will be presented for approval. Once approved by the senate, the budget proposals will be forwarded to the state government.

The most important budgetary provision pertains to the salary of nearly 1700 teaching and non-teaching staff working in the university headquarters, 19 constituent and one government-funded minority college. Besides the emoluments of teaching and non-teaching staff, provision is also made for nearly 4500 pensioners including family pensioners.

The pension liabilities of the staff of 17 constituent colleges of Veer Kuer Singh University (VKSU), Ara, who retired before October 1992 and 25 constituent and three government-funded minority colleges of Pataliputra University reaching the superannuation age before March’2018 rests with the MU.

Both Veer Kunwar Singh University and Pataliputra University have been carved out of undivided MU. VKS University was established in October 1992 and Pataliputra University was established in March 2018.

The MU headquarters, as of now is over staffed as division of non-teaching employees between the parent MU and its off shoot, the PPU has yet not been finalised on account of differences between the senior functionaries of the two universities.

Earlier, the then MU VC Prof Qamar Hasan complained that the Pataliputra University wants to cherry pick from the list of MU employees, while he favoured staff division under some structured formula as was done in the case of VKS University.
