Title: Tamil Nadu cop’s murder: Kerala police maintaining vigil
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Though the main accused in the murder case of policeman Y Wilson were caught by the Tamil Nadu police, Kerala Police , who were assisting them in search operations , have not let their guard down.

State police are continuing their probe to find whether the accused had received help from anyone within Kerala. However, top cops here remained tightlipped as the probe is being done by Tamil Nadu police.

State police have already questioned several persons as part of the probe. This includes relatives of Thoufeek who reside in Parassala region and the staff of a mosque at Neyyatinkara, where the two accused stayed hours before they allegedly committed the murder.

The Q branch officials of Tamil Nadu Police too had taken two men, who are known to Thoufeek and Abdul Shameem from the capital and Palakkad as part of the probe. Hence, police suspect that the accused might have received help from elements within the state and hence they are continuing the vigil.

Title: Proposed Swargate-Katraj Metro route to cost Rs 4,203 crore
Content:
Representative image

The proposed underground Metro extension from Swargate to Katraj — a 5.5km stretch — will cost Rs 4,203 crore

PUNE: The proposed underground Metro extension from Swargate to Katraj — a 5.5km stretch — will cost Rs 4,203 crore.This was revealed in the detailed project report (DPR) for the route extension, a presentation of which was made by Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation (MahaMetro) officials at the Pune Municipal Corporation on Wednesday.The DPR has suggested various options for the route extension, including completely underground and combination of elevated and underground. “The most effective option appears to be completely underground. The details of underground alignment have been presented accordingly,” a senior MahaMetro official said.The proposed locations of the three stations are Gultekdi Market Yard, Saibabanagar and Katraj. The route would have a daily ridership of 6.68 lakh by 2027, which would go up to 10.72 lakh in 2057, he said.The study of Swargate-Katraj metro extension was under way for the last couple of years. The DPR has suggested formation of a special purpose vehicle for the execution of the route extension.According to the presentation, the PMC is contemplating to use municipal land for revenue generation. Additionally, there is a monetary grant from PMC generated by granting a 50-year capital lease on civic-owned land. The debt is estimated at 55% of total cost at Rs 2,381 crore. The contribution of the state government/PMC and Union government (equity) has been estimated at 27%, Rs 596 crore each.“The DPR will now be sent to the standing committee and general body of the PMC for approval, before sending it for the final nod of the state government,” mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

Title: Rudrapur likely to get 'transport nagar'
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

RUDRAPUR: The district headquarters of Udham Singh Nagar at Rudrapur may soon have its own transport nagar .

The district magistrate (DM) has set up a committee of officials from various departments, along with the local legislator, to find and survey a piece of land that is at least 50 acre.

Two areas identified are ‘nazul’ lands near AN Jha Inter College at Rampur road and one near the FCI warehouse at Kichha road.

According to DM Neeraj Kharwal , the transport nagar project seeks to streamline movement of commercial vehicles in the city. “Once the survey report is submitted, we’ll review it and chalk a plan for the project,” he said.

Kharwal further added that the transport nagar will have 60ft-wide roads and shops for maintenance of vehicles. “It will also increase the income of Rudrapur Municipal Corporation , which will look after it,” Kharwal said.

“First, the committee, which includes SDM, ARTO, ASP, SLAO and the local MLA, will have to complete the survey within a given time. Then we’ll come into the picture. We’ll take around a week to chalk out our plan,” the district magistrate said.

Title: 2 held breaking into ATM at Ambawadi
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: Advanced systems installed at an ATM and alertness by a bank helped cops reach the ATM near Polytechnic in Ambawadi while two burglars were still busy cutting it in the wee hours of Wednesday.

At around 2.18am, the manager of State Bank of India (SBI) Polytechnic branch, Kuldeep Garg, 43, received a call from their Mumbai-based E-surveillance team informing him that two burglars had entered the ATM.

The surveillance team detected the men as burglars, as they were wearing helmets inside the ATM and covered the CCTV cameras with a cloth. Further, when they tried to tamper with sensors installed in the ATM the sensors sent a message to the e-surveillance team. The e-surveillance team also spotted gas-cutters in the hands of the two burglars and informed Garg.

On being warned of the crime in progress, Garg called up police control room and rushed there. When Garg reached there, he found the shutters of the ATM were closed. After a while, a police team also reached and opened the shutters. As the burglars heard the shutters being opened, they tried to flee but the police caught them, states the FIR.

The accused were identified as Aloksingh Rajput, 25, and Uttam Savalia, 32, who live in Punyakoti Apartment in Vejalpur area. Rajput and Savalia are partners in construction business, said an officer of Ellisbridge police.

They had tried to cut the machine with a gas-cutter due to which the ATM machine was filled with smoke. They damaged the ATM machine but failed to get any money from it. The two were also equipped with a screwdriver, a small gas cylinder and pliers.

Title: Evolving emotions behind use of emojis
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Is it possible now to type ‘Thank you’ without that tiny symbol of folded hands or proclaiming love without a string of yellow faces winking or blowing kisses or simply smiling while chatting with our near and dear ones?The ubiquitous emojis have taken the form of an independent language for the youth of today, claims a paper titled ‘Mapping Emoji Usage Amongst Youth’ by Dr Reena Shah, assistant professor with Indus University and Dr Ruchi Tewari, associate professor, MICA, at MICA ICMC 2020 recently.The study, which encompassed a focused group discussion (FDG) and subsequent survey, found that the emotive faces and pictorial representation of various objects are used extensively across the platforms for multiple purposes — ranging from conveying an emotion or mood to supplement, complement or substitute the central message in texts.“There were several revelations of the exercise — for a start, elderly were found to be using emojis in equal proportions, if not more. The primary reason for it is believed to be keeping up with the native users,” said professor Tewari.“What appears to be a casual pictorial addition to textual messages holds the power to be developed as a standalone language with its unique set of norms which could impact the usage of language-dependent communication,” states the paper.It’s no more a light-hearted exchange of symbols, claim researchers. In one of the instances, it cost a youth a relationship as he apparently did not use any appropriate emojis with a ‘Happy Birthday’ message. The recipient claimed that the message was just a formality for the sender, they added.“It is sometimes used as a replacement for language. It’s widely perceived that if a person is chatting just using emojis, he or she wishes to close a conversation. There are also etiquettes involved — if it’s a formal (social or professional) relationship, use of emojis is less and limited. But as the relationship gets matured, the usage gets extremely informal,” added Tewari. “Each individual has a unique pattern of using emojis including before, after or in between the text.”

Title: Gujarat: Police sub-inspector flees after accepting bribe, LRD held
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

PALANPUR: A police sub-inspector (PSI) attached to Unava police station of Unjha taluka in Mehsana district fled taking Rs 50,000 as bribe on Monday.

According to JP Solanki, Patan anti-corruption bureau (ACB) inspector, accused PSI Chetan Kumar Barot had seized liquor with a two-wheeler a few days ago. However, the cop allegedly demanded Rs 1.3 lakh from the accused with the promise of not recording a case then. They gave him Rs 50,000, while the remaining amount of Rs 80,000 was to be handed over on Monday.

Meanwhile, the accused bootlegger approached the ACB police station with the bribe plaint, while the PSI had gone to Gandhinagar for training.

On the appointed day, Barot deputed a Lok Rakshak Dal jawan, Nitesh Kumar Thakor, to accept the Rs 80,000 on his behalf. But when he came to know that ACB sleuths caught the LRD jawan after a bribe plaint was lodged against him by the accused, Barot fled from Gandhinagar.

A team of ACB officials from Palanpur, headed by AK Chaudhary, is hunting for the absconding official at his residence in Kalol and other places.

Title: BJP spent over Rs 1,200 cr on polls to Lok Sabha, four state assemblies last year
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

NEW DELHI: BJP spent over Rs 1,264 crore on general party propaganda during elections to the Lok Sabha and four state assemblies in April-May last year, a jump of 77% over the Rs 714 expenditure it had incurred on the 2014 general election.

As per the election expenditure statement submitted to the Election Commission by BJP, it spent around Rs 1,078 crore on general party propaganda and Rs 186.5 crore for candidates. The expenditure on candidates includes Rs 6.33 lakh spent on media payments, Rs 46 lakh on publicity material, Rs 9.91 crore on public meetings and processions, Rs 2.52 crore on other expenses and Rs 48.96 lakh on publicity of criminal antecedents of candidates.

In contrast, the Congress had spent Rs 820 crore on general election expenditure in 2019 and Rs 516 crore in 2014.

The total expenditure incurred by the BJP’s central headquarters on general propaganda for polls to Lok Sabha and state assemblies of Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Sikkim and Arunachal Pradesh totalled Rs 755 crore, of which Rs 175.68 crore was spent on star campaigners, Rs 325 crore on media advertisements (print, electronic, bulk SMS, cable, websites, TV channels), Rs 25.40 crore on publicity material including posters, cutouts and banners, Rs 15.91 crore on public meetings and Rs 212.72 crore on ‘other’ expenses.

The central party headquarters also paid lump-sum amount totalling Rs 651 crore to state units for poll expenses.

BJP had declared total income of over Rs 2,410 crore for the year 2018-19, a rise of 134% over its Rs 1,027 crore income shown in 2017-18. Of the Rs 2,410 crore income declared by the party in its annual audit report for 2018-19 filed with the EC, over Rs 1,450 crore came from electoral bonds alone.

In 2017-18, BJP had declared an income of Rs 210 crore from the electoral bonds route.

The total expenditure declared by BJP for 2018-19 was over Rs 1,005 crore, a 32% rise over its Rs 758 crore expenditure during 2017-18.

Read this report in Marathi

Title: Tempers soar with kites during Uttarayan festivities
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Grab of a video showing groups clash during festivities on Tuesday

Rajkot: The kite festival of Makar Sankranti was marked by three incidents of group clashes in Rajkot and Jamnagar on Tuesday. Also, 60 people were injured after banned manja strings came in contact with commuters’ throats in Rajkot city and district.

While in most of the injury cases, the patients were discharged from hospitals after preliminary treatment, three persons who received grievous injuries from manja and three others who fell off terraces while flying kites, had to be admitted to Rajkot Civil Hospital.

Four other persons were injured in a group clash that broke out between two communities in Shramjivi Society of Bedipara locality in Rajkot. Police said the clash was triggered by a petty matter of a member of the one group asking member of another not to talk loudly over phone.

“Ramzan Sheikh (22), Taufiq Sanghar (22), Imran Baloch (26), Bilal Mehtar (26) and Shahrukh Junaj (24) were arrested for allegedly leading a group of nine people to attack Mansukh Kolia, Hitesh Kolia, Mayur Kolia and Jayashree Kolia who were injured in the incident,” said G M Hadia, inspector with Thorala police station.

The second clash was reported from Shantinagar in Raiyadhar locality of Rajkot where one person was injured. “A group of eight people led by Dharmesh Rathod attacked Firoz Kherani (42) with knives after the latter objected to Rathod hurling abuses near his house. Irked at being reprimanded, Rathod stabbed Kherani in his back and stomach. He has been admitted to Rajkot Civil Hospital in a seriously injured condition,” said an official from University police station.

Police arrested Rathod, Sunil Rathod, Sanjay Parmar and Jai Makwana for the crime.

Another man was injured in Dared village on the outskirts of Jamnagar, when he was attacked with bats. Bhailal Solanki (58) was injured when Jairaj Darbar, Imtiyaz Lakha and Deepak Gohil attacked him when he sought payment for the purchases they made. “Darbar had gone to Solanki’s shop to buy kites and threads. When Solanki asked for money, Darbar called Lakha and Gohil and launched an attack on Solanki,” said an official from Jamnagar Panchkoshi A division police station.

Title: Aromal aims for a Guinness record in Kalaripayattu
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kannur: Aromal Ramachandran is just 22 and has already earned plaudits for wielding ‘ urumi ’ ( sword with flexible blade ) for five hours and four minutes. This earned him a place in the High Range Book of World Records on November 21, 2019 in the presence of officials from the organization based in Hyderabad with offices outside the country. Though the certificate was issued on December 24, it was formally handed over to him by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan on January 13 at Thalassery.

Aromal, who learned Kalaripayattu from his father Ramachandran gurukkal at the age of three, decided to pursue his passion after completing his graduation in computer science. “I come from a family of Kalaripayattu practitioners; my father, mother (Shailaja), sister (Amrutha) and brother-in-law (Sanal) are professionally active in this field and hence it was natural for me to follow their path,” said the youth, who runs a kalari in Alappuzha.

Aromal’s mother, who also runs a kalari, was the first woman gurukkal to get recognition from the Sports Council in Kerala. “If Kalaripayattu is made a part of sporting activities and introduced in National Games, it would attract more people,” he said, adding that his family has training facilities in 17 states.

Aromal has now set his sight on a bigger prize. “My aim is to win a Guinness world record by performing for eight hours. For this, I should have a record first and there is no entry in the name of Kalaripayattu in the Guinness Book. Hence, I tried for High Range Book of World Records first,” said Aromal, for whom Kalaripayattu is a passion.

Title: Man beats wife’s paramour to death
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 35-year-old man from the Saraspur area of the city allegedly murdered his wife’s paramour and dumped his body near Sterling City in Bopal on the outskirts of Ahmedabad in the wee hours of Wednesday.

The deceased was identified as Mayankgiri Goswami, 22, a resident of Ghuma, who worked at a private hospital in Bopal.

According to the complaint lodged by Bopal police, the accused, Alpesh Patel, threatened Mayankgiri a year ago.

On Tuesday evening, Mayankgiri received a call from some person and left home. When he got near Sterling City, Patel and four of his aides had abducted him and taken him to an unknown place.

As Mayankgiri was unreachable for the entire night, his cousin Kaushikgiri, a temple priest, went looking for him. At around 7am on Wednesday, Kaushikgiri saw people gathered around a body and found that the deceased was his cousin.

Mayankgiri had injuries on all over his body and had a deep wound on his head. On checking CCTV footage, police found that he had been abducted by Patel and his aide.

A police official said Patel may have killed Mayankgiri at some other place and dumped his body near his house. “Two days ago, Patel’s aide had warned Mayankgiri that he would be killed if he did not stop meeting Patel’s wife. Patel had learned about his wife’s relationship with Mayankgiri a year ago and had threatened to kill him,” said a police official.

At present, Bopal police registered a case of murder against Patel and began an investigation.

Title: Anti-CAA kites take cops into Bapu’s Vidyapith
Content: Ahmedabad: Police came knocking at the doors of Gujarat Vidyapith, founded by Mahatma Gandhi in 1920, after it got an “input that students will fly kites with messages against CAA (Citizenship Amendment Act) and NRC (National Register of Citizens).”This is reportedly the first time in 100 years that police entered the Gujarat Vidyapith to break up protests.Inspector J A Rathwa of Vadaj police said his team acted after a WhatsApp message went viral in which a journalism department student of Gujarat Vidyapith, Bhavesh Bariya, urged fellow students to gather in large numbers and fly the kites in question. Police also claimed that they had inputs that ABVP members were also set to go to Vidyapith to oppose the anti-CAA protests.A Vadaj police team entered the Gujarat Vidyapith campus on Ashram Road and questioned students. Cops justified their action saying it was to avert clashes between the pro and anti-CAA factions.“We got a message from social media and a telephone call that Gujarat Vidyapith journalism students were going to fly kites with anti-CAA and anti-NRC messages on them. We also got a message that the RSS’s student wing, the ABVP (Akhil Bhartiya Vidyarthi Parishad), was also going to protest at Gujarat Vidyapith. In such a situation, we rushed to the varsity to maintain law and order,” said Rathwa.Students and alumni of the varsity objected to police action, terming it arbitrary. A student of Gujarat Vidyapith said that nine or ten cops came to the ground on the campus and began asking students for their identity cards. “The tone of the cops was also intimidating for the students. They spoke to us as if we were criminals even though we did not break any law,” said a student.A police official said, “We rushed there after seeing a message that some 30,000 such kites were going to be flown. The message was circulated by a city-based activist. When we arrived there, there were just some 15 activists with a few such kites.”

Title: PM Narendra Modi’s office and residence within walking distance?
Content:
As per the plan, the Prime Minister’s Office and residence will be located next to each other on Dalhousie Roa... Read More

NEW DELHI: The government’s Central Vista revamp project may see shifting of Indira Gandhi National Centre of Arts (IGNCA) from its present location on Janpath to Jamnagar House , where around 15-acre land is currently occupied by hutments housing various government offices.As per the plan, the Prime Minister’s Office and residence will be located next to each other on Dalhousie Road, just behind South Block .While officials refused to comment on PM’s residence at 7, Lok Kalyan Marg after the revamp of Central Vista, sources said the government may continue to keep both the residential complexes earmarked for the PM. They added that the design of the project is still in the works and nothing has been finalised. TOI had on November 3 reported on the plan to bring PM’s residence closer to South Block.Sources said as per the plan, IGNCA will come up on around 15 acre land near Jamnagar House and the government has told the architect and design planner to ensure state-of-the-art facilities at the new IGNCA which will also have a National Centre for Performing Arts.The present IGNCA complex will pave way for new office blocks. The government has planned to build 10 new office blocks on both sides of Rajpath. “The new buildings will come up where the current buildings exist. We will not cut a single tree for this project,” an official said.The revamp plan also includes construction of a new triangular Parliament building next to the existing one, common central secretariat and the revamping of the 3-km-long Rajpath, from Rashtrapati Bhavan to India Gate. “The plan includes building several subways for safe movement of pedestrians and for office-goers there will be a transit system to transport them from Metro stations to each office building,” he said.Officials also said the new Parliament with seating capacity of around 1,000 MPs in Lok Sabha and 500 in Rajya Sabha will have more space for comfort of the law makers. The new Parliament will have seating in pairs instead of the current plan of a continuous row. “Each bench will have two MPs, though three members can also be accommodated. That will be enough to meet the requirement when a joint session is held in Lok Sabha,” said an official. The new Parliament won’t have a Central Hall.“Currently, you have over half a dozen MPs seating together and all members find it uncomfortable when a single MP goes out. The whole idea is to have a better functional complex that meets all requirement,” said an official.The official said the Central Vista revamp plan also includes extension of the Vista up to Yamuna, which was the original plan. “We will develop pedestrian walkways and cycle paths so that people can go up to the river and there will be a New India Garden on the river bank. The design of which would be finalised through a competitive process. Yamuna will also get cleaner by then,” he added.The ministry officials said there will be no dearth of fund for this project, which is being built for the next couple of centuries. “Obviously, this will be completely funded by the government since it will be the biggest beneficiary of the project,” a source said.North and South Blocks are likely to be converted into museums— one to capture history of India till 1857 and the other since the First war of Independence.

Title: Ahmedabad: Man stabs younger brother in the gut
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A man stabbed his younger brother in Ramol on Sunday night. Police sources said the victim was moved to a hospital in the area and is said to be critical, as he had been nearly disembowelled.

According to Ramol police inspector, K S Dave, the older brother, Vinod Kushwah, has fled.

“We are hunting for him and will even send a team to UP, his native place, if needed,” Dave said.

According to the FIR lodged by Usha Kushwah , the wife of the victim Ravindra, Vinod had called her husband on Saturday night and asked him to come down.

“His wife stated that as her husband and Vinod were not on talking terms for about a year because of a financial dispute, she was afraid and as her husband went down by the lift, she went down by the stairs,” a police official said.

She stated that Vinod pulled out a knife and stabbed her husband in the stomach. “When she screamed, Vinod just flung the knife on the road and left,” said a police official.

Police said local residents called an ambulance and took him to a private hospital nearby.

Title: Odhav boy missing after going to buy kites, string
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 15-year-old boy went missing in the Odhav area on Monday evening. The boy is a class XI student at a local school doesn’t have a mobile. While leaving home, he told his family that he was going to buy kites and string .

Inspector R G Jadeja of Odhav police station said that on combing through CCTV footage they found out that he had gone to CTM Crossroads. “We got to know that he was planning to Mumbai and then Goa. We are sending a team to these places to trace the boy,” he added.

According to the FIR which alleges abduction, the boy’s father works for a private company and has set up a kite stall on the road with his brother.

On January 13, when the boy’s father returned from work, he went to the kite stall. He did not find his son there and asked his brother about it. His brother said that the boy was tired and had gone home.

His father went home but did not find his son there either. “He asked his wife who said that at about 6pm the boy had taken his school bag and left home saying that he was going to buy kites and string.

On Wednesday, the boy’s father approached Odhav police and lodged an abduction complaint. Police sources said the boy had row at home and left for Mumbai, according to intelligence they had received.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: MLAs denied AAP ticket to get key roles
Content:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal welcomes former congress MLA Ram Singh Netaji after he joined the AAP party (ANI phot... Read More

NEW DELHI: A day after AAP denied poll tickets to 15 sitting MLAs, the party sought to keep its house in order by reaching out to the disappointed legislators.While 46 of the 61 sitting MLAs were given another chance, the remaining were dropped after a series of qualitative and quantitative surveys conducted by the party and private agencies to assess their performance and winnability. Most of the dropped MLAs have maintained a stoic silence, but some have made no effort to hide their disappointment. Badarpur MLA Narayan Dutt Sharma and Seelampur MLA Ishraq Khan , who has made way for councillor Abdul Rehman, have openly revolted against the party. In a late-night development, Khan said that he had resigned from the party.Among the rest, three MLAs, Ram Chander from Bawana, Sukhbir Singh Dalal from Mundka and Surinder Singh from Delhi Cantonment, made an appearance at the party office on Wednesday. Dalal and Singh, in fact, joined MP Sanjay Singh at a press conference to attack BJP over the latter’s stand on the schemes being offered by AAP government. Though Ram Chander didn’t join the press conference, he could be seen on the lawns of the party office.“It’s quite natural for them to feel sad. We are trying to win over these MLAs. We will not allow anybody to go away because AAP is like a family,” Sanjay Singh said. He said the dropped MLAs would be given positions in the party and, after the election, in the government.He added that the MLAs were dropped after several surveys. Seeking re-election in Delhi, AAP is pitching the performance of its government and its achievements to outmanoeuvre rivals BJP and Congress in a three-cornered contest. The elections are critical for AAP because it does not have a significant presence outside Delhi, except in Punjab. It has devised a catchy slogan — ‘Achhe beete panch saal, lage raho Kejriwal’ — and a report card to woo voters.The three MLAs later attended the inauguration of the election office of Rajendra Nagar assembly candidate Raghav Chadha. Vijender Garg, who has been ignored at Chadha’s expense, said: “The last date of nomination is January 21. Going by the advice of the people, I will take a decision (on fighting the election as an Independent) before that,” Garg said.Earlier, Ishraq Khan organised a press conference outside his office at Seelampur. He said the party had breached his trust. In the middle of the press conference, former Congress MLA from Seelampur, Mateen Ahmad, dropped in. Backing Khan, he appreciated the work done by him and said that AAP had done injustice to the MLA.

Title: Childline prevents minor’s marriage in Tirurangadi
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Malappuram: While child welfare authorities in Malappuram are engaged in a rigorous campaign to prevent child marriages across Malappuram, the ChildLine authorities have blocked the underage marriage of a 17-year-old girl in Tirurangadi.

The girl, who is a higher-secondary student , was produced before child welfare committee (CWC) and has been shifted to Snehitha shelter home in Malappuram. The ChildLine Malappuram has forwarded the case to police for further actions.

The action was initiated after the ChildLine received a complaint regarding the marriage through its toll-free helpline number. When ChildLine volunteers conducted an investigation based on the complaint, the girl revealed that her Nikah which was with a 30-year old-man was held recently and the marriage function is scheduled to be held after March. She had also revealed that the marriage was fixed without her consent. He had been married once before. Following this the ChildLine summoned parents of the girl and they were produced before CWC.

Child marriage prohibition office (CMPO) of Tirurangadi, P Prasanna said that the Nikah was conducted neglecting the warning issued by child welfare authorities and the case was handed over to Tirurangadi police for further action.

As per the statistics of Childline a total of 34 cases of child marriages were reported in Malappuram during the period of January to December, 2019. Recently the district child protection unit (DCPU) in association with women and child welfare department had launched a campaign with an aim to make Malappuram a child marriage-free district.

Shajesh Bhaskar, chairman of child welfare committee (CWC), said that the poor economic background of families is one of the major reasons for the child marriages in Malappuram. “Lack of awareness of parents especially those who are living in rural villages is also a reason for under-aged marriages”, he said. The district child protection unit (DCPU) has already appointed 30 child marriage prohibition officers and 90 supervising volunteers in various parts of the district, to report child marriages. The child marriage prohibition officers have the power to prevent any incident of under-aged marriage, register cases based on a complaint and to seek support of police to prevent the marriage function.

Title: Rajkot: Man arrested for blackmailing factory owner with RTI reply
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: A man was arrested for allegedly blackmailing a factory owner with an RTI reply in Bhuj of Kutch district.

Police said the accused, identified as Mayur Maheshweri (32), allegedly demanded Rs 50,000 from Lakshmichand Karani, threatening to make RTI response about pollution caused by Karani's factory public, if the latter did not cough up the amount.

Karani approached Bhuj B division police station whose officials laid a trap and caught Maheshweri red handed while he was receiving the cash from Karani.

“Mahashweri had demanded Rs 3 lakh, and had asked him to hand him over the first instalment of Rs 50,000. Maheshweri in his RTI had found that Karani's factory was spreading pollution. He had allegedly threatened to expose Karani in the media also,” said an official from Bhuj B division police station.

Title: ‘State govt deceiving people on NH-766 issue’
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kozhikode: The Nilgiris-Wayanad NH and Railway Action Committee , which has been spearheading the campaign to revoke the decade-old night traffic ban on the forest stretch of NH-766 passing through the Bandipur National Park , has said there were gross mistakes in the draft of the additional affidavit prepared by the state government to be filed in the Supreme Court demanding lifting of the ban.

The committee alleged that the state government was trying to once again deceive the people of Wayanad and was pitching for making the alternative Mananthavady-Kutta-Gonikuppa-Mysuru road as a permanent alternative to the NH-766. They said that while the draft of the affidavit says that the alternative road does not pass through any reserve forest or wildlife sanctuary, the fact is that it passes through two major wildlife sanctuaries in the states. The draft was recently circulated among the people’s representatives from Wayanad.

Committee convenor T M Rasheed said that the state government has also tried to present another road –– Panamaram-Payyambilli-Kutta-Gonikuppa –– as an alternative road in the draft of the additional affidavit. But it is clear that this road cannot be an alternative to NH-766 and it also passes through forests, he said.

“A lobby which has influence in the state government is trying to establish the Kutta-Gonikkupa road as a permanent alternative to the NH-766 so that it would result in better road connectivity from the Kannur airport to Kodagu and Mysuru even if it is at the cost of the permanent closure of NH-766,” he added.

The earlier affidavit submitted by the Kerala government in December had sparked a controversy after it emerged that the affidavit was submitted a day before the ministerial level meeting was a held in Thiruvananthapuram to finalise the points to be included in the affidavit.

After the legislators from Wayanad raised the issue, it was decided that an additional affidavit will be filed after consulting them.

The MLAs from Wayanad are expected to point out the mistakes in the draft of the revised affidavit before it is filed before the apex court.

The Supreme Court is set to consider the case next week. The affidavit of the state is crucial in the case as Supreme Court had in August asked the MoEF to submit a report on upgrading NH-275 and SH-90 (alternative route from Wayanad to Mysuru through Kutta and Gonikuppa) so that the NH-766 can be closed down in the long run.

Title: AAP-BJP spat over freebies gets shriller
Content:
Sanjay Singh

NEW DELHI: AAP MP Sanjay Singh on Wednesday got into a confrontation with BJP parliamentarian Gautam Gambhir alleging that the saffron party would stop free essential services, like electricity, water and bus rides for women, if it came to power in the capital.Hitting out at chief minster Arvind Kejriwal , Gambhir said that he was not against free services for poor, but those who could afford them should pay nominal charges. Singh alleged that BJP leaders were continuously opposing the free welfare schemes of the AAP government.Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari joined in by saying that no existing subsidy started by the AAP government would be altered. He alleged that AAP leaders were “habitual liars” and “misrepresented the facts” to suit their political interests.“I have repeatedly said that we will give five times the benefits given by the AAP government. Several central schemes like Ayushman Bharat and Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna, which were stopped by the AAP government, would benefit people five lakh times, if implemented,” Tiwari said. Calling the AAP government’s free electricity and water scheme an election gimmick, Tiwari said the Kejriwal dispensation didn’t have any plans to give the facilities after March 31 as no such notification had been issued in this regard. “The order issued by the power department says consumers will get free electricity only till March 31. What we will give to people will be for 60 months,” he added.Singh challenged Gambhir to give up all the free facilities he received as an MP before opposing the benefits being provided to Delhiites. “Several BJP leaders have time and again conveyed their anti-development and regressive stance, including opposition to free basic services. It is good that their true intentions have been revealed before the election,” he added.The AAP leader stated that BJP MP Vijay Goel had recently announced that all free schemes would be stopped if his party comes to power. This was reiterated by Union minister Prakash Javadekar. “BJP leader Anil Jain stated that his party is against any kind of free services to people. Now, Gambhir has contradicted the claims made by Manoj Tiwari,” Singh said.“After coming to power again, the AAP government will continue the free services for the next five years. The inflation rate has been consistently rising due to the unfavourable policies of the central government. Instead of focusing on resolving inflation, they have been criticising the AAP government. In the current economic scenario, the free welfare schemes have provided a huge relief to people,” Singh stressed.New Delhi MP Meenakshi Lekhi said BJP will spell out all benefit schemes it intends to launch in its election manifesto. “BJP will bring better schemes,” she added. A BJP source said, “The party’s Sankalpa Patra (election manifesto) will prove to be a game changer.”

Title: Delhi: Woman held along with lover for killing her husband
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: On December 28, police found an unidentified body in Dwarka . The next day, a woman approached the northeast Delhi police saying that her husband was missing. Apparently, the two incidents had no connection as reported from two distant corners of the city.

However, Delhi Police’s Crime Branch has claimed that the man found dead in Dwarka was Mohammed Dilshad — murdered by his wife and her lover. DCP (crime) Rajesh Deo said the woman, identified as Bilkis Begam and her lover, Sabir Ali, have been arrested. Ali’s friend Rohit, who helped them in the crime, has also been arrested. Dilshad and Ali were cousins.

Deo said that the breakthrough was achieved after head constables Sudhir and Parveen received a tip-off from an informer that a person reported missing from Nand Nagri was murdered and his wife may be involved in the crime. A probe was initiated and cops got to know that Bilkis was involved in a relationship with Ali.

Officers detained Ali and questioned him. He gave conflicting answers in the beginning but later confessed to the crime. Cops then arrested Bilkis and Rohit. Cross examination revealed that Ali and Blikis hatched a plot to eliminate Dilshad and roped in Rohit by promising him Rs 1 lakh for helping in the murder.

On December 27, Rohit called Dilshad, a caterer by profession, to a vacant plot in Dwarka on the pretext of giving him a contract for a wedding. Ali was already hiding at the spot. While Rohit tied a wire around Dilshad’s neck, Ali attacked him with an awl. Later, they dumped the body in the bushes.

Title: Kolkata: Conductor pushes woman off bus after fight over Rs 2
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: A private bus conductor , Sajal Halder (36), was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly pushing a woman off the bus after the two had an altercation over Rs 2 .

The incident occurred near B C Roy Children’s Hospital on Wednesday afternoon, when the victim had boarded the Route 44 bus, plying between Baguiati and Howrah.

The woman, a resident of Lake Town, lodged a complaint at the Beliaghata police station that the conductor had demanded Rs 9 from her when the fare was Rs 7. She reportedly refused to pay the extra Rs 2 and this led to an altercation between the two. The conductor allegedly outraged her modesty and pushed her off the bus, her complaint stated.

Halder, a resident of Rajarhat’s New Colony area, was later arrested and the police seized the journey sheet of the bus. He has been charged under IPC Section 354 and different sections of the West Bengal Motor Vehicles Act.

Joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma said the woman’s statement would be recorded before a magistrate at the earliest. “We are looking into all aspects, including the fact that the accused might have had committed such a crime earlier,” he said.

Such incidents prompted the police to ask private bus owners to install CCTV cameras like on WBTC buses. “If we have video evidence, we can probe such cases better,” said the officer.

Title: Nainital: Viral explicit pics behind girl’s suicide
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

NAINITAL: A police probe into the recent suicide of a girl in Champawat has revealed that she took the drastic step after four men circulated her “explicit” pictures on the internet. The 21-year-old girl’s body was found hanging from a tree adjacent to an abandoned building near Tanakpur’s Government Inter College in the last week of December last year. Police officials claim that the accused men circulated the girl’s pictures online and were blackmailing her that they will show pictures to her parents.

"During interrogation, the accused admitted that they posted the girl's pictures on the internet and were threatening her that they will share those pictures with her parents as well," said Tanakpur’s circle officer Vipin Chandra Pant. The official added that all the accused have been arrested. “While one accused is a Nepali citizen, the other three hail from Champawat. Further probe is underway into the matter,” informed Pant. TOI had earlier reported that the girl committed suicide during a visit to her maternal grandparents’ house.

Title: GujCTOC used first time to rein in a gang
Content:
Goswami's four henchmen in police custody.

AHMEDABAD: The depredations of the gang led from inside jail by dreaded extortionist Vishal Goswami has led city crime branch to book seven of the gang’s members under the new anti-terrorism law, The Gujarat Control Of Terrorism and Organised Crime (GujCTOC) Act. This is the first recorded use of GujCTOC , since it was passed in 2015 and brought into effect from December 1, 2019. Four members of the gang arrested on Tuesday, and three others currently lodged in Ahmedabad central jail, including Vishal, were booked.Senior superintendent of police, crime branch, Deepan Bhadran said a comprehensive report was sent to the city police commissioner and GujCTOC was invoked after his approval .Before 2015, GujCTOC was called the Gujarat Control of Organised Crime Act. Until now, three Presidents have rejected different versions of the act until President Ram Nath Kovind gave his assent.Those booked under the act in this case include Vishal Goswami, his elder brother Ajay Goswami, Rinku Goswami, Jaypuri Goswami, Bijendra Goswami, Anurag Verma of UP, and Vishal’s nephew, a minor.“Bijendra, Jaypuri, Anurag and Vishal’s nephew were arrested from Meghaninagar on Tuesday with a pistol, 40 cartridges a stolen motorcycle and a car. They have been remanded to police custody till January 24,” said special commissioner of police, crime branch, Ajay Tomar. He added that Vishal and his brother Ajay and brother-in-law Rinku are already in Sabarmati Central Jail .Bhadran said that based on a complaint of extortion from a city-based jeweller, it was detected that Vishal Goswami was actively running his extortion racket from jail.Inspector K G Chaudhary probed the case.Crime branch sources said that Vishal also threatened witnesses in his old cases to turn hostile, all from behind bars.

Title: Man poisons brother-in-law to death in Rajkot
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Rajkot: A man poisoned his brother-in-law to death in order to usurp his property in Bhawaninagar locality in Rajkot. Though the incident occurred on August 24 last year, the complaint in this connection was lodged on Monday night after receiving the viscera report.

Police said the accused, identified as Ashwin Dodia along with his friends Naresh Sarvaiya and Amit Chauhan, offered poisonous alcohol to Devubha Sakaria (26).

“According to the complaint lodged by Sakaria's father Ramesh Sakaria (65), Dodia intended to usurp the property of Sakaria, hence he plotted his murder,” said N K Jadeja, inspector with Rajkot A division police station.

Ramesh is a multi-millionaire owning land, plots, a restaurant and a bungalow. Sakaria was his only son after eight daughters, who was likely to inherit his property.

Ramesh alleged that Dodia was eyeing his property and had hatched the conspiracy to kill Sakaria.

“On the night of the crime, after Sakaria consumes liquor laced with poison, the accused brought him to Ramesh’s restaurant and told him that Sakaria was heavily drunk. They arranged a folding bed for Sakaria in the restaurant where they had dinner and left the place. However, when Ramesh tried to wake Sakaria up, he found him dead,” added Jadeja.

Meanwhile, viscera reports confirmed presence of poisonous substance in the alcohol. On the basis of the viscera reports, murder complaints have been registered and the police have launched a manhunt for the accused.

Man kills his father

Angry with his father for returning early from his work at his farm, a man killed his father by bludgeoning him to death in Kanad village of Sihor taluka in Bhavnagar district on Tuesday. Police arrested Yuvrajsinh Gohil for allegedly killing Bhapuba Gohil. Bhapuba was taken to Sir T Hospital in Bhavnagar where he succumbed to his injuries.

Title: Advance security team from US visits Taj Mahal
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

An advance team from US inspects the historic Taj Mahal

AGRA: About 30 security personnel from the United States , along with their 25 Indian counterparts, visited the Taj Mahal on Wednesday for a security review ahead of the proposed visit of US President Donald Trump to Agra in February.

The advance team arrived in Agra on a special flight and went back in the evening after visiting the Taj Mahal. They inquired in detail about the venue, security forces deployment, cameras placement, public movement and details of the last visit of VVIPs to the monument. They also checked various routes and golf cart facility on the monument’s campus.

According to sources, once the visit of the US President is finalized, the security arrangement will involve an intense ground-to-air paraphernalia to ensure that there is no untoward incident during the visit of the world's most guarded leader.

ASI’s superintending archeologist (Agra circle) Vasant Swarankar said that no one from the US team contacted him officially, but confirmed that some persons from the American embassy inquired about the monument from the ASI staff.

A security personnel team from US will be camping here for almost two weeks before the VVIP visit, said a senior official. He, however, did not confirm who would be visiting the monument.

According to reports, the US and India are in touch to work out mutually convenient dates for the visit of US president Donald Trump. India had invited Trump to grace the Republic Day parade as the chief guest last year but the US President could not come due to scheduling issues.

"Both sides are in discussions to finalise the dates," said a source. During his visit to the US in September last year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had reminded Trump of his invitation to him to visit India along with his family.

Title: Aligarh MP accuses AMU authorities of misleading investigators by lodging police complaint against security personnel
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Aligarh: Aligarh MP Satish Gautam has said that the AMU VC’s and Registrar’s futile bid to file an FIR against security forces was an afterthought and aimed at misleading the investigating agencies.

He said that while the university authorities on one hand had allowed police inside the campus, on the other hand they are filing complaints against them for what they legitimately did inside to disperse the violent mob. He said that VC and the registrar have woken up after a month to register a complaint, which itself is questionable.

He said on the ill-fated day, DIG Preetinder Singh and security personnel were also injured during the violence and they had resorted to use of force in self defence.

Praising the district police action, the MP said that if police had not controlled the situation on December 15, anything could have happened. He said educational institutions are for imparting education not for protests and “gundagardi”. He said that police doesn’t need any permission for maintaining law and order situation in the town.

The MP said that he has urged the government to check the university’s hostels completely and allow entry from one gate only in order to block illegal access of people inside the campus. He warned the VC that if he registers an FIR against security personnel then another FIR will be registered against him for allow students to shout anti-national slogans in the campus.

Title: Ahmedabad: Eatery fined Rs 50,000 for dumping teacups on road
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The solid waste department of the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has collected fines amounting to Rs 2.46 lakh from 218 units which disposed of their garbage in public spaces such as roads. Iscon Gathiya of Ghodasar was fined Rs 50,000 after AMC officials found cups bearing the establishment’s brand name in a pile of garbage.The AMC will intensify the drive against littering from Thursday. The director of the solid waste department, Harshad Solanki, said that the drive commenced on Wednesday to send a message that the AMC will not tolerate littering on roads.The AMC had on Monday decided that industries and business organizations that litter on roads will be penalized with fines ranging from Rs 5000 to Rs 5 lakh. The fine varies depending on the nature of business and the area. If an individual is caught littering, spitting on the road, or easing himself in the open the fine will be in the range of Rs 100 to Rs 500.Mangalmurti Society in Ghodasar was fined Rs 2,000 for disposing of dry garbage outside the society. The notice given to the society states that waste has to be segregated and has to be deposited in the waste-collection vehicle. The society has been ordered to create its own infrastructure for waste collection.Solanki said Kataria Heights Residential colony was fined Rs 10,000 for disposing of garbage on the road. The average fine collected on Monday was Rs 1,168, which was not even the minimum fine fixed by the AMC on Monday. The drive was concentrated in areas of Sardarnagar, Krishanagar, Saijpur, Naroda, Kubernagar, Navrangpura, Paldi, Naranpura, Vadaj, and Sabarmati.Nirav Patel of Isckon Gathiya said: “The AMC staff found our cups in garbage in the vicinity and fined us. We did not argue. We will ask our customers to dispose of cups in dustbins.”A worker at Honest restaurant said that at night the leftover food was spilled on the road by the vehicle which was collecting waste. “We forgot to clean it and were fined Rs 5,000 on Wednesday morning.”

Title: Proper skilling of youth important for India’s $5 tn economy target: Shah
Content:
Caption

Gandhinagar: Laying the foundation stone of the Indian Institute of Skills in Gandhinagar, Union home minister Amit Shah said equipping youth with proper skills is important towards meeting the target of making India a five trillion dollar economy by 2024. The first Indian Institute of Skills (IIS) will be set up jointly by the Gujarat government and Tata Group, at Nasmed village near Gandhinagar.Shah said it is time the country considered a population of 130 crore people an asset instead of a liability. “Of the total population, 70 crore is the youth and this number will reach 90 crore by 2030. We are the world’s biggest market, but the earlier government talked of unemployment without working to resolve the challenge. With the skill development mission, PM Modi has opened up new avenues for the youth,” Shah said. The Union home minister said that as a result of various initiatives, including skill development, the Indian economy had grown from two trillion dollars to three trillion dollars in just five years.Others present at the function included CM Vijay Rupani, deputy CM Nitin Patel, Union minister for skill development and entrepreneurship Mahendranath Pandey, Union minister of state for new and renewable energy R K Singh, Tata Sons’ chairman emeritus Ratan Tata, L&T chairman A M Naik and representatives of various industries.The Indian Institute of Skills is being developed on a not-for-profit public-private partnership model by the Tata Group along with the state’s labour and employment department. While the state government has provided land for the institute, the Tata Education Development Trust is contributing the capital investment. The state government has allotted a 20-acre plot at Nasmed for the institute. A minimum of 5,000 students will pass out every year after the institute begins operations.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Manish Sisodia to file his papers today, Arvind Kejriwal on January 20
Content:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, and deputy CM Manish Sisodia at a party office, in New Delhi on Monday (ANI photo)

New Delhi: With AAP taking a lead over other key players, announcing its full list of 70 candidates for the assembly polls on Wednesday, the party has started expanding its campaign on the ground. Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal is likely to file his nomination from New Delhi assembly constituency on January 20. His deputy, Manish Sisodia , will file his papers from Patparganj on Thursday itself, followed by transport minister Kailash Gahlot (Najafgarh) a day later.Both Kejriwal and Sisodia are eying a hat-trick from their respective assembly segments. AAP has repeated all the ministers from their respective seats.Young gun Raghav Chadha launched his campaign in Rajendra Nagar even as MP Sanjay Singh inaugurated an election office at Naraina Vihar. Party supporters were joined in by hordes of locals as they danced to the tunes of AAP’s campaign song, “lage raho Kejriwal”. Chadha told the gathering: “I won’t become an MLA alone. We will all become MLAs. I was born in Rajendra Nagar and not only my parents but also my entire family lives here. My mother’s family is also from Naraina Vihar and the whole of the area is like a family to me.” A local Congress worker joined AAP at the event, saying she was impressed by Kejriwal’s work.Chadha is now planning a door-to-door campaign and ‘padyatras’ to seek votes. Party functionary Atishi, fielded from Kalkaji, meanwhile, began her campaign by seeking blessings at Kalkaji Mandir.The confirmation of a party ticket has reinvigorated Model Town candidate Akhilesh Pati Tripathi, who had faced some protests recently. “All sections of people have come out in my support and they are campaigning for me,” Tripathi said. Matiala candidate Gulab Singh said he was undertaking door-to-door campaigns every day, covering more than 20 kilometres. Okhla candidate Amanatullah Khan will have a “silent” nomination. “In the wake of the Shaheen Bagh protest, I have decided not to carry out any procession or bike rally. I will go from door to door to seek votes,” Khan said.With AAP making development its main poll plank, the candidates are focusing on their campaigns accordingly. Volunteers have been asked to take AAP government’s report card of five years to the doorsteps of the people.

Title: Delhi: After Gautam Gambhir intervenes, coach held for molestation
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Title: AMU postpones exam for second time
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Aligarh Muslim University

ALIGARH: The Aligarh Muslim University ( AMU ) administration on Wednesday indefinitely postponed all examinations in the varsity. The examinations were scheduled after the reopening of the university following the extended winter vacations.

The notice issued by AMU on Wednesday reads, “All university examinations scheduled in the light of reopening of the university after winter vacations in January 2020 stand postponed due to unavoidable circumstances. Fresh schedule of the leftover examinations will be prepared by the respective deans/principals and will be notified separately.”

The decision to postponement all university examinations was taken after a meeting of the deans of faculties, principals of colleges and polytechnics and other functionaries under the chairmanship of vice-chancellor Tariq Mansoor .

Title: Agra University: 42,000 students unable to apply for main exams
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Agra University

AGRA: The administration of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University has uploaded a list of self-financed colleges which have not deposited examination fees collected from students . University administration had stopped online login ID of these colleges.

Now, the university’s administration has sent a reminder to the management of these 83 listed colleges to deposit the examination fee by January 20.

Around 42,000 students enrolled in these colleges are unable to fill examination forms. University administration has declared that students of defaulter colleges will not be allowed to appear in the exam if colleges fail to deposit the examination fees.

Agra University has around 1,100 self-financed colleges affiliated with it. Around 5.5 lakh students are enrolled in these courses offered at these colleges. University administration has started the process for submission of the examination forms for session 2019-20.

The 83 colleges, which have not paid examination fees of students to the university administration, have been kept out of the application process. According to the varsity records, around 42,000 students are enrolled in the undergraduate, post graduate and other courses offered by these colleges.

University public relation officer, GS Sharma, said on Wednesday, “The defaulter colleges have been formally asked to provide the examination fee many times. Now, final notice has been issued to them. The examination application forms will be accepted till January 20. After this, a late fee of Rs 500 per student will be charged from the colleges which fail to deposit the examination fee on time.”

Title: UP: Crop damaged by stray animals, debt-ridden farmer commits suicide
Content:
32-year-old Kheeragarh farmer

Farmer leaders handed over a letter written with blood to the district administration

AGRA: A 32-year-old farmer of Kheragarh sub-division committed suicide by hanging himself after stray animals caused damage to his mustard crop grown on rented land. The farmer, who was the father of two minors, had a pending bank loan of around Rs 1 lakh.Meanwhile, farmer leaders on Wednesday handed over a letter written with blood to the district administration. The letter, addressed to CM Yogi Adityanath, sought relieve from stray animal menace.Pravin Kumar, son of Satya Prakash, was a resident of Nagla Vishnu village. He used to live in a joint family. Pravin had rented some land to grow crops. On Monday evening, he went to guard his crop from stray animals but did not return. On Tuesday morning, he was found hanging from a tree in the field.Dheerendra, Pravin’s cousin, said, “Pravin was upset since the past few days. Last week, his mustard crop was damaged by a herd of stray animals. He also had a bank loan of Rs 1 lakh pending. We want the government to provide suitable compensation to his family.”Another relative, Sandeep Sikarwar, said, “Last year, Pravin had suffered losses in potato crop. He had planned to pay the pending loan from the earnings of the mustard crop this year. Damages caused to the crop by the stray animals made him lose hope. Inefficiency of the authorities to check stray animal menace resulted in Pravin’s death.”Sarvesh Kumar, Tehsildar of Kheragarh sub-division, said, “The matter is being investigated. In case details provided by the relatives of the farmers are found true, compensation will be provided to the family.”On Wednesday, Farmer leaders boycotted the ‘Kisan Diwas’ meeting as a majority of officials of 18 departments, who were supposed to attend the meeting, were absent. Farmers had come prepared to raise the issue of stray animal menace in the meeting. Later farmers, went to the collectorate and handed over a letter highlighting the issue to additional district magistrate Prabhakant Awasti.Farmer leader, Shyam Singh Chahar, said, “Farmers are already suffering financial crisis as they are not able to get suitable prices for their crops. Following negligence of the authorities, now they are left to suffer from crop loss by stray cattle. It is the responsibility of local administration and the animal husbandry department to make suitable arrangement for stray animals. But, so far, no major action has been taken. We want the chief minister to ensure relief to farmers from stray animals menace.”

Title: Cops say no application received from AMU for registration of case against security personnel
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

ALIGARH: A day after the Aligarh Muslim University ( AMU ) authorities claimed that the Aligarh police had refused to accept their complaint for registration of an FIR against security forces for their highhandedness at Morrison court Hostel on December 15, DIG Aligarh on Wednesday said that no such complaint had been received from the varsity.

Talking to TOI, DIG Aligarh Akash Kulhary said that the varsity has not given any such complaint till date. He said that it was wrong to say that the police had refused to accept the complaint, as without investigations they cannot refuse or accept any application. He refused to comment further on the issue.

However, registrar of the university, Abdul Hamid, claimed that the cops refused to receive their application “verbally”. He said that no one can force them to accept or reject the application in writing.

According to a senior police officer, if the university claims that police had rejected their application verbally then they could have sent it by a registered post. However, university officials did not comment on this and said that they will discuss about it. So far, they have not decided anything in this regard.

Police said that no separate FIR would be registered even if they receive the application, since a FIR has already been registered in this matter, so it will be only forwarded to the investigation team.

A senior administrative official in the university claimed that police is diverting the issue, as they don’t want any case against security personnel.

Earlier, on Tuesday, varsity VC Tariq Mansoor had clarified that the university administration had given permission to police to “only restore normalcy and restore public order and to clear the main road” and that they were “not supposed to enter any residential hostel”. He had added that evidence brought to the knowledge of the university administration suggests that the “police personnel might have crossed their mandate by entering the Morrison Court hostel premises”.

Title: Delhi: Manish Sisodia targets BJP on education budget
Content:
Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia speaks at a press conference in New Delhi on Tuesday (ANI Photo)

NEW DELHI: Continuing to highlight the AAP government ’s work in the education sector, deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia said on Wednesday that while the education budget had been reduced in the BJP-ruled states, it had been increased three times in Delhi in the past five years.“The AAP government is the only government in Asia with the highest allocation for education. The decreasing education budget by the BJP governments proves that BJP is an anti-education party and wants to ruin the future of the youth,” alleged Sisodia, who is also the education minister of Delhi.“AAP has made a huge effort to raise the standards of Delhi in the domains of finance, delivery and results. The basic principle driving this growth is the investment in education,” said Sisodia. “A government that is not willing to invest in education is conspiring to destroy the future of the nation.”Delhi government has kept 26% of its current budget for education, which was only 16.6% in 2013-14, Sisodia said. During the same period, he alleged, Haryana has slashed its allocation from 15.4 % to 13%, and Uttar Pradesh from 16% to 13.4%, while in Congress’ Punjab, it has been cut from 14.2% to 10.3%.Rubbishing the allegations, Delhi BJP spokesperson Harish Khurana said, “AAP is playing with the future of the students for votes. Its education model is fake and based only on propaganda. It has spent only 30% of the budget and 30% of it was misspent. We have sought an inquiry into the expenditure.”
