Title: Nagpur: Police in quest of ‘white Bullet man’ in mayor firing case
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

NAGPUR: Multiple city police teams are on the lookout for a man in a white leather jacket riding a white Bullet in the mayor Sandip Joshi firing case. The man is reportedly one of the two helmet-wearing bike-borne shooters who fired three rounds on Joshi’s car in December last year.

Joshi, who had received two threat letters for his anti-encroachment drive , was with his friend Aditya Thakur in his personal car when he was fired upon near Empress Palace banquet hall on the Outer Ring Road.

City police have questioned notorious goons with firing cases against their names, but have been unable to find any connection.

Cops have also tried to reach out to their inter-state counterparts, including the Chitrakoot-based syndicate which had fired upon hawala traders Lakhotia brothers in 2008. The crime syndicates based at Kanhan, Kamptee, Khaparkheda and such places — who use firearms or deal in them — too have been scrutinized, but there has been no headway.

With cyber experts having to scan through lakhs of mobile phone numbers at critical stretches between different strategic towers, the city police top brass are trying to stress more on criminal intelligence to narrow their focus on suspects who prefer leather jackets and Bullet bikes — especially white ones.

It is learnt that the ‘ white Bullet man ’ was captured on CCTV cameras at two different places where the threat letters to Joshi were posted. The police have passed on the 'white Bullet and leather jacket' theory to their crime information network, along with the video footage to some key contacts.

The police are yet to figure out why the sharp shooters used helmets to hide their identities. "Why did they wear helmets at a place where there is no CCTV coverage? Does that mean that the shooters were worried that Joshi or Thakur might identify them, or was it done for the purpose of dramatization?” pondered a cop.

In a recent interview, Joshi said that he would demand a CID or CBI probe if the case was not solved soon.

Three years ago, architect Eknath Nimgade’s murder case was transferred to CBI, but nothing has come of it till date.

Title: Poverty, fear of society forces Firozabad gang rape survivor to offer her new-born for adoption
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

On Makar Sankranti at around 5.26am, gang rape victim gave birth to baby girl in Firozabad district hospital.

FIROZABAD: A glance out of Firozabad district hospital ’s window sent shivers down the spine of Surya (name changed) who was firmly holding her newborn she can’t call her own outside.

Staring at an uncertain future and an “unsparing” society, the 16-year-old rape survivor has decided to part ways with girl child she just gave birth to. Hired as a contractual teacher at a kindergarten school at a meagre salary of Rs 3,000 a month, she was allegedly gang-raped by her principal and her co-worker - who used to call her ‘beti’- in May last year.

Turning her gaze away from the child, Surya told TOI that she doesn’t have the means and the courage to keep her. “I kept her in my womb for nine months. Though she is my part and I love her, I don’t have the means to take care of her and neither the society will accept us. I have decided to leave my daughter in orphanage,” Surya said.

She has just one hope. “Someday, someone will adopt her and she will get a better life.”

Hidden from the society for the last several months in a small rented room, Surya was admitted to district hospital after the intervention of TOI and child welfare committee (CWC) Firozabad on late Tuesday night.

Hailing from a poor family with no father, the girl was eldest among two siblings and had joined private school to support her family.

“I wanted to become a police officer. But due to financial constraints joined the kindergarten school. I was raped by the school principal and a colleague for several times inside the school basement. They filmed the act and continued to threaten me of dire consequences if I reported the matter,” said the survivor. She added, “Those two men are vultures.”

In the FIR lodged at Shikohabad police station of Firozabad district, the accused were identified as Harveer, 29, the school principal and Rameshwar, 38, the teacher and colleague of the girl. The duo were charged under IPC section 376-D (gang rape), 506 (criminal intimidation) and under POCSO Act. They were arrested and sent to jail.

“Seeing the family’s financial condition, Rameshwar, who used to call my daughter ‘beti’, offered to provide a job of teacher with Rs 3,000 per month in local kindergarten school. My daughter joined the school in September 2017. But, in May 2019, on pretext of giving her advance teacher’s training, he raped her inside school premises. Couple of days later, the school principal Harveer too raped her,” said survivor’s mother.

“It was in September 2019, I came to know about my daughter’s condition after she fainted,” said the 37-year-old woman, with tears rolling down her eyes.

“I was hurt and shocked to see Rameshwar’s wife and Harveer’s mother plead to spare the two accused for money. I don’t understand, how as women, they can be so heartless towards a girl who was victim of brutality,” added the survivor’s mother who runs her family by stitching clothes.

Meanwhile, speaking to TOI, chief medical officer Dr Sadhana Rathore of Firozabad district hospital said, “The baby and the victim are in good health. Our team is providing constant care to the duo. I am also writing to SP Firozabad to provide adequate security cover to the survivor and her child till the court trial in gang-rape is going on.”

Zafar Alam, Firozabad’s child welfare committee member said, “Soon the district administration will deposit Rs 3.5 lakh as compensation amount into the survivor’s bank account, as almost all paper work has been completed. We respect her decision. The gang-rape survivor will file an appeal in court asking to put the baby for adoption via CARA (Central Adoption Resource Authority).”

Taking cognizance of the case, ADG Agra zone Ajay Anand and IG Agra range Satish Ganesh, also extended help to the survivor. “We have asked civil society members to make financial contribution in order to help the victim, as she is from poor background. Every possible help would be provided to the teenager and her child by police,” said ADG Ajay Anand.

Title: Man accused of harassing teen
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 43-year-old man lodged a complaint at Nikol police station, stating at a shop owner, Mukesh Patel, sexually harassed his 15-year-old daughter on Tuesday.

According to the complaint, the complainant lives in Nikol with his son, 20, and daughter, 15. He stated that his daughter studies in Class XI. As Tuesday was a school holiday, his wife told his daughter to take a tiffin box to his vegetable shop.

He stated that after having lunch, he lay down for a while and his daughter sat at the shop counter.

According to the FIR, Mukesh Patel, who owns a shop, came to his shop, and asked his daughter for change. “His daughter gave him the change. Patel then asked her if she uses a mobile phone or a social messaging application and and asked for her mobile number. Patel told her they would communicate on the social messaging app.

“When his daughter said that she doesn’t use a mobile shop, Patel said that a beautiful girl like her should use a mobile. Just then, her father woke up. On seeing this, Patel left. She then told her father what had happened. The father called the police control room and lodged a complaint against Patel,” said a police official.

In a separate incident, a 24-year-old man, Niketan Panchal, lodged a complaint at Krishnagar police station stating that two persons called him to Sadar Chowk. They then asked him how he knows Shivani, and threatened him. As Panchal’s mother and sister arrived there, the two persons, who had come in a car, sped away.

Title: SDA office building in Sambalpur awaits completion
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Sambalpur: Though a target was set to complete construction of the building, which will house the offices of Sambalpur Municipal Corporation (SMC) and Sambalpur Development Authority (SDA), by December last year, the work is far from completion.

The work on the building, which will be a replica of the Hirakud Dam, had started in November 2017. A Sambalpur-based firm is executing the building work. The four-storey building for the two offices is being constructed at an estimated cost of Rs 14.89 crore. A Kolkata-based architectural firm prepared the detailed project report (DPR) and design of the four-storied building. All the required facilities to run the two offices will be available in the composite office building, construction of which is being executed by the SMC itself.

An official of the SMC said the building was completed structurally. However, the finishing work is yet to be carried out.

Enforcement Officer of SMC, Subhankar Mohanty admitted that a target was set to complete the work on the building by December. However, he said, due to fund constraint, the pace of the work had slowed down and as a result the work could not complete before the deadline. However, the problem has been resolved and the work s going on in full swing now. It will take some time for the completion of the work, he said.

At present, the office of the SMC is operating from the building, where the office of the Sambalpur Municipality was running. The Sambalpur municipality was constituted in the year 1867. And the existing office building of the Sambalpur municipality was constructed in the year 1927. However, Sambalpur was accorded corporation status in the year 2014. But the existing building of the Sambalpur municipality does not have sufficient space to accommodate all the sections of the municipal corporation.

Title: Vadodara: 465 birds treated for kite string injuries in two days
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Volunteers attend to injured birds at one of the many camps in Vadodara.

VADODARA: At least 465 birds were injured by kite strings on Uttarayan in the city on Tuesday and Wednesday. The injured birds included some uncommon varieties as well as migratory birds.

The state government has, for the first time, started the Karuna Abhiyan in the city to ensure that injured birds are rescued and treated as part of coordinated efforts. Government veterinary clinics, forest officials and NGOs were actively involved in the entire process.

Forest department officials said that 305 injured birds were brought to the three facilities started at veterinary clinics in the city on Tuesday. On Wednesday, another 160 were brought for treatment till early evening and the numbers are expected to rise till night.

District forest officer Kartik Maharaja said that 38 camps were started at various locations across the city. “This time 200 more volunteers were working in these camps this year compared to last year’s 500,” he said. According to Maharaja, a major change observed this year was people rushing to the camps with injured birds.

Till Tuesday, 445 injured birds were treated under the Karuna Abhiyan camp that started on January 10. The figures for Wednesday, were being collected by volunteers and officials till the night.

A major respite for birds was the low breeze on Tuesday evening ensuring a lesser number of kites in the sky. “The situation, however, changed on Wednesday evening and we will have to wait for the details of injured birds till Thursday,” said Vishal Thakur, a wildlife and animal rescue activist.

Arvind Pawar, another animal rescue activist, too pointed out that the number of birds injured on Wednesday evening may be higher than Tuesday. “My group was operating from six locations and got several calls on Wednesday evening,” he said.

Apart from pigeons and other common birds, Spoon Bill, Northern Shoveler, Common Kestrel and other species were also rescued during the festivities. From January 10 till Tuesday, 71 birds died before they could be treated.

Title: Rohini murder: Kin launch Facebook campaign in search of clues
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: The family members of a sales manager with a paint company , who was shot dead near his apartment in Rohini on January 6, have launched a Facebook campaign asking eyewitnesses to contact them with the clues.

Anil Kumar Duhan, who stayed at an apartment in Rohini with his wife and two daughters, was on his way back home around 8.30pm when the incident took place. He got off at Badli metro station and was walking to his apartment when the killers are suspected to have waylaid him. When he did not return home, the family had started enquiring about him in the locality. Later that night, they received a call from a hospital informing them about Anil’s death.

The autopsy revealed that apart from a gunshot wound, Duhan did not have any indication of a scuffle on his body. “There was a single bullet wound on his temple that was fired from a close range. Someone had noticed him lying on the footpath and informed police about it,” said his brother Sunil.

Police failed to find any eyewitness or a CCTV footage during their probe.

“It is unlikely that my brother would have been murdered due to an enmity,” said Sunil.

Family members say that a day before the incident he had returned with his family to Delhi. “He was on leave for 15 days and was travelling to Chandigarh and Rohtak. If anyone was tracking him, they would not have been aware of his whereabouts,” said a family member.

The family members have urged eyewitnesses to come up with any clue that could help the cops crack the murder mystery.

Meanwhile, cops have detained a few local criminals from the Shahbad Dairy and Samaipur Badli areas. Anil’s mobile phone location is being tracked to get some clues. “We are probing into all possible leads to solve the case. Footage from the CCTV cameras along the road are being scanned,” said a police officer.

Title: Rly job racket that duped more than 1,000 aspirants busted
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bhopal: Bajaria police on Wednesday busted a major fake Railways job racket that was being operated in the city and nabbed two members of the gang, including the kingpin, a terminated policeman, and his nephew. Four members of the gang are still at large.

Police said that the accused duped more than 1,000 job aspirants on the pretext of jobs for the post of assistant station master at Rs25 lakh per candidate and ticket collector at Rs15 lakh per candidate. The accused were running the racket since the past 17-18 years and defrauded job aspirants to the tune of Rs80 to Rs90 crore.

The accused were operating a parallel fake railway training centre near Bhusawal railway junction in Maharashtra at a rented accommodation where they provided training to the selected candidates and even paid them monthly stipends in their bank accounts during the training period.

Police seized more than 20,000 fake railway documents, including application forms, appointment letters, training call letters, character certificates, medical certificates, along with forged seals and other documents from their possession.

The accused gang members led a luxurious life and maintained high-end SUVs. They loaned the fraud money at high interest rates and earned further illegal profits. They operated in Uttar Pradesh also and have two cases registered against them in Jalaun district of the state.

DIG Irshad Wali said that the arrested accused were identified as Sudhir Dohre, the kingpin of the racket and his nephew Rajesh Dohre, both residents of Bhopal. Sudhir was appointed as constable in Sehore police in 1997 and was transferred to GRP, Bhopal. In 2009 he was terminated for his involvement in a similar fraud case. The absconding members of the gang are identified as Santosh Guha, history-sheeter Amit alias Pintu Markandeya, Santosh Halwai, Dilip Kumar — all resident of Bhopal and Manik Mathe, a resident of Mumbai.

DIG Wali said that the gang was busted on the basis of a complaint filed by victim Gopal Singh Thakur, (33), a resident of Krishna Nagar in Bajaria area.

Gopal in his complaint stated that he ran a readymade garment shop in his native town Piparia in Hoshangabad district, while his father worked at the Railway Coach Factory in Bhopal. He said that he came in contact with his father’s colleague Santosh Guha, who introduced him to kingpin Sudhir in 2018. Sudhir lured Gopal into his trap by promising to get him TC job in the Railways on payment of Rs15 lakh.

Gopal told TOI that he fell into the trap and on October 10, 2018, accused Sudhir provided him postal order, railway question booklet and answer-sheet which he filled and returned.

Four days later Sudhir gave him call letter and a roll number form on which he took his thumb impression. A month later Sudhir took the first instalment of Rs5 lakh from Gopal and next month gave him a training letter after taking Rs3 lakh.

Gopal said that in January 2019, Sudhir sent him for training to Bhusawal, where 14 more candidates took training with him. In the meanwhile, Sudhir took Rs4.5 lakh from Gopal’s family in Bhopal. The remaining payment of Rs2.5 lakh was to be paid after joining the job.

Gopal said that he stayed at the training centre in Bhusawal for two months and got stipend in his bank account. Before the training completion, Sudhir asked all the trainees to leave. When he and other candidates were at the railway station, they were detained by police and released later. When Gopal reached Bhopal, he came to know that Sudhir duped two more relatives using the same modus operandi to the tune of Rs5 lakh.

DIG Wali said that preliminary investigations suggest that the gang had contacts with local police in Bhusawal. The volume of candidates duped by the gang is very high and the fraud may run into crores. Investigations are underway and the number of accused may increase.

Title: Four fatal accidents reported in city around Uttarayan
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: The city has reported four fatal accidents during Uttarayan festivity on Monday and Tuesday which include two cases on the SP Ring road.

Two motorcycle-borne men, in a hurry to drink on the festival of Uttarayan had rammed into another motorcycle-borne man in which the unknown man, aged around 25, died on Tuesday in Gatrad village on SP Ring Road. The FIR registered with I division traffic police states that the duo who rammed their motorcycle were carrying liquor.

The accused was identified as Prashant Mishra, a resident of Vastral, and the pillion rider was identified as Shailendrasingh Parihar, resident of Amraiwadi.

“As it was Uttarayan festival today, we had gone to Kubernagar and bough some liquor bottles and began driving towards our home from the route of Naroda Patiya.

From there we went towards Mishra’s home in Vastral. At that time, Mishra rammed into another motorcycle-borne man near Gatrad as he was driving in a hurry. In the accident, the motor-cycle borne man died and Mishra suffered severe injuries,” said Parihar in the FIR.

In another fatal accident, a policeman, Mukesh Rathod, 39, a resident of Himmatnagar, was hit by an unidentified car on Tuesday evening when he was riding his motorcycle near Dehgam Circle on SP Ring Road. He died on the spot.

In Krishnanagar, a 48-year-old man, Ghanshyam Vaghela, resident of Naroda, was hit by a speeding car when he was riding his bicycle towards his workplace at kidney hospital in Civil hospital in the Asarwa area of city on Tuesday morning.

On Monday night, a 32-year-old man, Bhavin Patel, resident of Nikol, died when a speeding private bus hit him when he was riding his motorcycle near Thakkarbapanagar overbridge.

Title: Bylaw breather for 1,500 rooftop restaurants in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

JAIPUR: To give a fresh lease of life to rooftop restaurants, the urban housing and development (UDH) and local self government (LSG) have issued notifications for framing bylaws to obtain No Objection Certificate (NoC) for these establishments.

The town planners claimed that Rajasthan will be the first state to frame such bylaws. This will give a breather to more than 1,500 rooftop owners here, many of which are illegal.

The notification said most of these rooftops restaurants were not duly approved by the authorities and thus functioning illegally compromising the security of tourists and residents. “ Taking into account, the safety of citizens as well tourists and enhance the financial strength of local bodies, in exercise of the power conferred under the Section 338 of the Rajasthan Municipal Act, 2009, the state government notifies the bylwas,” reads the notification.

As per rules, maximum 25% of roof area will be allowed to be covered by removable temporary structure materials including steel and aluminium framing. No wooden framing material or combustive material will be allowed for construction. The remaining 75% area will be kept open for sitting space. It will be mandatory for the owners to comply fire safety norms and procure NOC from the council of architecture (COA) registered Architect and fire department.

“A rooftop restaurant should have minimum two exit gates, along with escape route in case of emergency,” said a senior town planner

The department has directed to construct an overhead water tank exclusively for firefighting of suitable capacity. “No cooking will be allowed using an LPG stove, coal or an open flame. Storage and use of any kind of inflammable products is also not allowed except liquor (with permission from excise department). Hookahs, fire shows will not permitted in such establishments. Cooking using LPG, coal or open flame may be carried out in the lower floor,” the notification said.

Title: Meerut: Two bike-borne men throw acid on girl, 10
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

MEERUT: A 10-year-old girl was attacked with acid by two youths over family enmity. The incident occurred in a Hapur locality at the time when the girl was out of her house. “I was out of my house when Sajid and Salman came on a bike and threw acid bottle on me that hit me on my feet.”

SP Hapur Sanjiv Suman said, “Soon after the incident, police rushed to the spot and took the girl for first aid. Injuries are minor in nature, mainly concentrated around feet. Preliminary investigation reveals that the girl’s family had an ongoing tiff with their neighbours and the two youths from the opposing family were the culprit. Efforts are on to nab them.”

Mother of the girl alleged that the youths had harassed her daughter a few days ago. “I was not at home when Sajid and Salman tried to drag her into their home. But timely intervention of neighbours saved her. Now they have attacked her.”

Title: Two yrs on, 105-km state highway stretch awaits national tag
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Koraput: The 105-km stretch of the state highway (SH) 39, which passes through Nabarangpur district, is yet to be declared a national highway (NH) even though a notification in this regard was released two years ago.

According to a notification issued by the ministry of road transport and highways on December 5, 2018, the stretch from Papdahandi to Likima in the district was to be declared NH-130 CD — a part of NH-30 that connects Sitarganj in Uttarakhand with Ibrahimpatnam in Andhra Pradesh.

Sources said the authorities concerned was yet to hand over the road widening work to the NH authorities for its development. The stretch is under the control of the state public works department (PWD).

“Being a tribal belt, the move will boost the economy of the region and expedite development activities. However, it is unfortunate to see that even after two years of issuing a notification, the state government has not taken any step to convert the stretch into an NH,” Nikunja Patnaik, a Nabarangpur resident, said.

As per the notification, NH-130 CD (214 km) will start from Kurud in Chhattisgarh (North) and pass through Likima, Kundei, Hatabharandi, Raighar, Beheda, Umerkote, Dhodra, Dhamanaguda, Dabugaon before connecting Papdahandi (South). Once the stretch is converted in to an NH, work to make it 10 m wide will start.

When contacted, officials of the Nabarangpur PWD division said the notification was yet to be implemented and refused to cite a reason behind the delay.

Superintending engineer of Jeypore PWD circle, Arun Kumar Sahoo, said, “I came across the notification and wrote to the regional officer of the NH department in Bhubaneswar to take over the road.” All required formalities would be completed before handing over the road to the NH authorities, he added.

Title: Jaipur: Nine years on, multi-level parking lot to be inaugurated today
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

The parking lot at C-Scheme can accommodate 400 cars

JAIPUR: The multi-level parking project in C-scheme, Ashok Marg area , which started nearly nine year ago, will be inaugurated on Thursday.

The project, which will accommodate 400 cars, will be opened by urban development and housing (UDH) department minister Shanti Dhariwal. The parking is expected to provide relief to number of office-goers as there is no space in the area.

An official source at the JMC said, construction of the multi-level parking project started about nine years ago on public private and partnership mode. The contractor was given rights to construct a commercial space on government land in exchange.

“The project was embroiled in controversy after the contractor moved an application to raise the height of building (commercial space) from 15 metre to 22 metre. However, objections were raised by the department for the same. The project was delayed for this reason,” sources said.

Parking has been a major issue in the fast-growing Jaipur as the number of registered vehicles increases by 12% annually. “Vehicles parked on roads not only obstruct traffic, lack of parking space also creates a difficulty for the visitors at the major markets. The parking will resolve the problem in the area,” sources said.

Title: Meerut: Seven anti-CAA protesters get bail in Bijnor, none in Meerut, Firozabad
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

MEERUT: Seven out of 149 people who had been arrested after December 20 violence during anti-CAA protest were granted bail recently. Superintendent of Bijnor jail, Shailendra Pratap Singh, said: “In all, 149 protesters were lodged in Bijnor soon after violent protests. Out of them, seven have got bail from local court and were released as IPC Section 307 (attempt to murder) was not slapped on them.”

On the other hand, none of the arrested accused have been granted bail in Meerut. Meerut police had released 16 detainees after investigations as they were found to be innocent. “We filed cases only after fool-proof evidence and that is why no bail has been given to any of the 45 persons arrested so far. However, we released 16 detainees from police stations only who were found to be innocent and their names were removed from FIRs”, said SSP Meerut Ajay Sahni.

Similarly Firozabad, where seven protesters were killed during anti-CAA violence, no bail has been granted so far.

According to police sources, as many as 47 cases at Nagar-Kotwali and Civilians police stations were registered in which more than 250 people were named while thousands of unnamed booked under various sections after violence erupted after Friday Namaz on December 20 in Muzaffarnagar.

In Muzaffarnagar, police had arrested more than 80 people so far in the matter. Police gave clean chit to 8 under CrPC sec 169 (Release of accused when evidence deficient) and 15 were given bail from a local court.

Police sources said over a dozen protesters were detained on December 20 in Nagina. They were set free days after protest when their parents claimed that their children were minor. They had produced documents showing their age.

Title: James Bond producer says 007 can never be a woman!
Content: Rhea Chakraborty will be taking action against Sushant Singh Rajput’s family for making false statements before all the investigating authorities and the Supreme Court. Her lawyer Satish Manshinde says, “The prescription and the chats of the two sisters of the actor clearly indicates that the family was aware of the actor's mental health."

Title: Delhi: Ajay Maken unlikely to contest election
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ajay Maken

NEW DELHI: Former Union minister Ajay Maken is unlikely to contest the upcoming Delhi assembly election ,which is expected to see several old-timers with some young faces challenging the incumbent AAP and BJP.

Sources said Maken, a two-term MP from New Delhi constituency and a minister in Manmohan Singh’s cabinet, has “indicated” his unwillingness to enter the fray to the central leadership.

Interim Congress president Sonia Gandhi met four leaders — Maken, Jai Prakash Agarwal, Arvinder Singh Lovely and Rajesh Lilothia who contested the last Lok Sabha election — along with former MLA Naseeb Singh at her residence on Monday and asked them to contest.

Sources claimed that while the other four agreed, Maken expressed his “reservations” on contesting. “He clearly told Sonia that he was not keen to contest. While leaving the meeting room, she reconfirmed that Maken will not be contesting this time,” said a source privy to the development. Maken could not be contacted for comments as he was travelling. The former Union minister had contested the last assembly polls from Sadar Bazar assembly segment and lost by over 50,000 votes. He also lost the 2014 and 2019 Lok Sabha polls from New Delhi constituency.

The other party leaders who attended the January 13 meeting at Gandhi’s residence have agreed to “follow” the instructions of the Congress president. While Agarwal, who was Congress MP from Chandni Chowk may contest from his traditional seat, Lovely may fight from Gandhi Nagar. Though Lilothia expressed his desire to challenge chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on New Delhi seat, sources said he might contest from Patel Nagar. The central election committee of Congress is likely to meet on Thursday to discuss the names of the candidates.

Title: Meerut: ‘Cops killed my brother in 1987, I settled score by shooting at them’
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Police have recovered weapons used in the firing by Anees also that includes a 0.315 firearm and live bullets



MEERUT: A 48-year-old anti-CAA protester arrested in Meerut on Tuesday for allegedly shooting at cops, said that his brother had been killed in police action during 1987 riots in the city and since then he had developed hatred against men in khaki.

“December 20 protest against CAA and NRC gave me an opportunity to settle the score,” Anees alias Khalifa reportedly told police on Wednesday. He was identified from camera and CCTV footage as he was firing at the police force during the protest.

He was arrested following a tip-off. Police have recovered weapons used in the firing by Anees also that includes a 0.315 firearm and live bullets.

Anees also revealed that he had joined Popular Front of India (PFI) a few years ago. “In all, three accused were arrested on Tuesday evening who were involved in shooting at police during anti-CAA violence on December 20,” SSP Ajay Sahni told TOI.

“During questioning, Anees revealed his brother Raees Ahmad was killed during 1987 riots and family could find the body only two days later. Ever since Anees says he developed hatred towards police and that is why he fired at police during the recent violence,” Sahni said.

In all, 2 dozen FIRs were filed by police after the violence against 180 named and 5000 unnamed protestors in Meerut. Police identified 178 rioters through CCTV and pictures. Anees carried a reward of Rs 20,000. “As of now, 45 persons have been arrested,” he said

Another person Anas was also spotted firing at police in the CCTV footage and has already been arrested. In the violence that took place at eight places in Meerut, six protesters were killed while 10 people, including five policemen, received bullet injuries.

According to UP Police, 288 police personnel were injured of which 61 sustained bullet injuries in state-wide protests on December 20.

Title: Missing from home, married couple found hanging from tree in Amroha
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

BIJNOR: Missing from their home since Tuesday evening, a married couple was found hanging from a tree in Amroha late at night. Police said the cause of their deaths is yet to be ascertained. The cops have set up a probe and sent their bodies for postmortem.

The young couple has been identified as Mool Chand (25) and Satta Devi (22). Their bodies were found at Mool Chand’s farm when their family came looking for them. The incident occurred at Latera village under Gajraula police station area in Amroha. According to police, there was an ongoing tiff between the couple and some members of their family for past few months.

The couple’s family told police that Mool Chand looked visibly upset for some months. Also, his wife delivered a baby two years ago. But, the baby did not survive. This time around, Satta Devi was reportedly eight months pregnant.

Amroha superintendent of police, Vipin Tada, said, “The married couple left their house on Tuesday evening and did not return home. Family members got worried and launched a search. At 10:30pm, they found their bodies hanging from a tree in a field. The cause of their deaths is not known. The bodies have been sent to a district hospital for autopsy. Probe is on.”

Title: Jaipur: For Mahatma Gandhi, India was his family, says grandson
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Governor Kalraj Mishra during the function in the city on Wednesday

JAIPUR: Author and historian Rajmohan Gandhi , who is the grandson of Mahatma Gandhi , said the Father of the Nation was always against the division of India.

While delivering the keynote address on ‘Understanding Gandhi’ on the 150th Birth Anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi on the Founders’ Day of a private hotel group here, he said, “His efforts to prevent the Partition were incomparable to any other. He always tried to spread happiness and eradicate hatred.”

“In this mission, he visited villages in various parts of the country to spread the message of friendship and unity. Gandhi left behind the power of Satyagraha, taught people to think of the poor when in conflict and made people realise that not only should India be free, every Indian should also be free. He taught people to be fearless, brave and educated them about the true meaning of ‘Ahimsa’ (non-violence),” said the former West Bengal governor.

He said there was some truth to the statement that Gandhiji did not devote as much time to his own family. This was perhaps because he adopted all of India as his family. But Gandhiji loved his family and his grandchildren very much.

“As the ‘Father of the Nation’, he considered all children of the country his own and had to sacrifice spending time with his own family. As his family, we also realised that although Gandhi is in our blood, his soul lives in all children of the nation,” he added.

Governor Kalraj Mishra said Gandhi taught us that we are not lesser than anyone else and giving inferiority complex any space in our minds was a crime. He forced the decolonisation of a huge empire through the power of Satyagraha and Ahimsa.

Mishra said, “Satyagraha is not for the weak, it is for the brave . Gandhi has always instilled Swabhlamban (self-reliance) among the youth. This was a combination of Swabhiman (self-respect), Swadeshi (indigenous) and Gram Swaraj.”

Bapu taught us the sins of our society - politics without principles, business without ethics, deeds without character and science without humanity, Mishra said.

Title: Chennai cop killers: Rajasthan keeps watch
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Rajasthan police have issued an alert about the possible presence of three persons in the state who are absconding after killing a sub-inspector in Chennai’s Kanyakumari on January 8.

Police said the three accused, after the murder of SI Wilson, have likely fled to North India. They are Abdul Shamim (29), Taufeeq Yusuf (27) and Sayad Ali (30). The accused are armed and are said to be affiliated to terrorist outfits and there are chances they might have been involved in terrorist operations.

According to the alert, anyone who spots any of the accused anywhere can contact the police on landline number 0141-2601583 and mobile number +91-9001999070.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Two detained in double murder case
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

BIJNOR: A day after two missing brothers – aged 23 and 16 years – were found murdered, police have detained two men for interrogation on Wednesday.

What initially looked like gun shots were found to be injuries due to repeated stabbing with sharp-edged weapons in the postmortem report.

According to sources, two men — Ankit and his friend Salman — were picked up by police on Wednesday in connection with the murders. One of them is a relative of the girl who had earlier filed a harassment case against one of the brothers. Police said that the accused have confessed to the crime.

City superintendent of police Lakshmi Nivas Mishra said, “We have detained two persons in connection with the double murder case at Baankpur village. The deceased were identified as Shubham and Ashish. The former had two cases against him including one related to harassment.”

“We have detained two persons — Ankit and Salman. They have confessed to the crime. The cause of murder is yet to be ascertained. We suspect that more people are involved. The interrogation is going on as they are changing their statements again and again,” he added.

Title: Ban soon on RSS shakhas on govt premises: Madhya Pradesh minister
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Animal husbandry minister Lakhan Singh Yadav

BHOPAL: Animal husbandry minister Lakhan Singh Yadav on Wednesday called RSS a “dangerous organization”, triggering protest from BJP.

Responding to questions from mediapersons in Kanhar village of Morena, Yadav said: “The Congress manifesto said RSS activities would be prohibited in government premises. An order in this regard will be issued soon.”

“RSS is a dangerous organization that creates chaos in the country and spreads misinformation,” the minister said, adding: “By attending RSS shakhas , government employees stop working for the government. We are monitoring their activities and will ban government employees from attending RSS shakhas.”

The Congress government had banned RSS activities on government premises in Madhya Pradesh in 1981. The ban was revived in 2000 by then chief minister Digvijaya Singh, and it continued under BJP chief ministers Uma Bharti and Babulal Gaur, before then CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan lifted it in 2006.

Reacting sharply to Yadav’s remarks, BJP said RSS is a patriotic, disciplined and cultural organisation. “Congress has a tendency to oppose RSS for political benefit. Those who do not think good about India are afraid of RSS. But, Congress always gives political patronage to those who talk ill of the country,” said BJP state spokesperson Rajneesh Agrawal.

Title: Gang stealing copper in industrial areas busted
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Vadodara: A gang stealing copper and spare parts from companies in Vadodara district and Halol was nabbed by Vadodara rural police on Monday.

The local crime branch (LCB) of Vadodara rural police had received information that the gang members and a scrap dealer were going to exchange money for a stock of copper which they had already sold to him. Based on the tip-off, LCB sleuths kept a watch near Jarod referral chowkdi and arrested seven members of the gang.

The accused identified as Ramesh alias Rustam Parmar, Kishan Parmar, Ashok Parmar, Sunil Chawda, Badal Parmar, Shailesh Gohil and Abdul Gaffar Makrani had stolen 1,836 kilograms of copper from Finalco India’s factory in Waghodiya on January 9. Four more members of the gang – Pruthvirajsinh Parmar, Yuvraj Parmar, Hitesh Parmar and Pappu – were also later arrested.

Police also arrested Jagdishchandra Khatik and Naresh Trivedi, two scrap dealers from Vadodara city, for buying the stolen copper from the gang.

During interrogation of the gang members, police also learnt that they had also stolen 500 kilograms of copper rolls from a company in Halol in the first week of January.

They also admitted to stealing spare parts from a company in Savli taluka’s Samlaya during the same period. Another theft of machine spare parts from a company in Manjusar GIDC in Savli from a year back also came to light during investigation.

Police said that all accused were handed over to Waghodiya police and later their custody will be given to Bhadarva police station and Halol police station police in Panchmahal.

Title: Extra classes, mock tests help students get ready for boards
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bhubaneswar: With Class X and XII board exams hardly a month away, schools in the city are busy conducting doubt clearing sessions and taking extra classes for students. WhatsApp groups, house visits, mentorship and mock tests are being taken by city schools to ready students for the board examinations.

However, teachers and students feel they don’t get adequate time as the examination has been pre-poned this year. The board examinations are starting from February 15 instead of the usual March first week.

“Though courses have already been completed, revisions, doubt-clearing and practice of sample question papers require more time. If students do not get adequate time for practicing then their confidence level will get affected,” said Prajna Paramita Mishra, a teacher in a city school .

Besides by conducting the practical board examinations in January instead of February has again reduced the preparation time for students which otherwise would have been used for revision classes.

Teachers in DAV Public School, Chandrasekharpur, said apart from doubt clearing sessions they are conducting very similar tests and making them practice as many question banks.

“Apart from CBSE sample papers, our teachers have also prepared question banks for students to practice. The tests are highly beneficial for slow learners. Teachers have been asked to WhatsApp groups and to address doubts of students immediately. Besides, there is zero mark test where scoring will be done in minus and the highest mark is zero,” said Debendra Pati, senior teacher of the school.

Due to shortage of time many schools are also conducting extra classes during Saturdays. “The board examinations have been preponed by almost 15 days but revisions have to be done within the time. Teachers are asking us to come to school on Saturdays and holidays too. There are also model examinations which we have to attend before the board examinations,” said Rakesh Pani, student of Class X.

“We have assigned 10 students under one mentor or teacher, who will look after the doubts and revisions of those students. Besides there are regular practice and mock tests going on for students besides counselling sessions to reduce their stress and boost their confidence level before the examinations,” said Sarat Kar, spokesperson of SAI International School.

Title: Muzaffarnagar madrassa students get bail as police drop serious charges
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Weeks after a 72-year-old teacher was brutally thrashed allegedly by police during December 20 anti-CAA protest , all students studying at his madrassa-cum-orphanage named Sadat Hostel in Muzaffarnagar -- and arrested on charges of violence, have been freed. Four other persons arrested from the hostel campus are yet to be released, the madrassa management said.

Maulana Asad Raza Hussaini, along with more than 45 others were detained by police from Sadat Hostel after the violence on December 20. Fourteen students and four others were sent to jail while the maulana and other students were released on the same day, hostel sources said.

Maulana was allegedly thrashed brutally by police and pictures showing him badly bruised flashed across media, putting Muzaffarnagar police on the back foot. His son, Mohammad Hussaini, who is a key member of the hostel management committee, told TOI that all students of the hostel had been released.

“Police arrested 14 students from Sadat hostel. Out of them, four were released by police used Section 169 (release of accused when evidence is deficient) of the CRPC, while 10 other students were granted bail by the local court after police dropped all serious sections against them except Section 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant),” he said.

One of the students who has been granted bail is Mohammad Ali, a resident of Kargil. Ladakh MP Jamyang Tsering Namgyal wrote about him to Muzaffanagar MLA Sanjiv Balyan, requesting him to intervene and ensure the release of the youth.

Police arrested more than 80 people after the violence in the city. In all, 47 FIRs were registered at two police stations for violence, arson, vandalism, and murder of a youth Noor Mohammad during the clashes between police and protesters on December 20.

Title: Traders protest against Amazon, Flipkart on Wednesday
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The traders from the district protested against the “unethical and unfair business practices” of e-commerce firms Amazon and Flipkart on Wednesday.

They held dharna against the functioning of these companies at Bindu Chowk.

This was the nation-wide protest organised by the Confederation of All India Traders ( CAIT).

Sanjay Shete, president of Kolhapur Chamber of Commerce, the organisation that led the protest in Kolhapur, said, “Central government in January 2019 had passed a rule that had prohibited these companies from granting a discount to only some sellers. These companies followed the rule until the completion of the general elections. But during the festive seasons including Dasara and Diwali, they violated these rules by granting huge discounts to some sellers.”

“Apart from this, these companies have affected the local retail business in cities, towns and villages. It has affected local businesspersons involved in trading of mobile phones, garments, shoes and electronic goods,” he said.

These companies have abused the government’s foreign direct investment (FDI) policy.

“These companies have earned huge profit through record sales during festivals and providing offers but have always claimed that their business is at loss. This is to cheat the government and not pay the tax. Government is losing tax which could have been recovered if the consumers purchased from local retailers,” he said.

“There are more than 2,800 shops rented by the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation to various traders for their small and retail businesses. These all are affected directly or indirectly due to these e-commerce companies,” he said.

“There are more than 2.5 lakh small and retail businesses in Kolhapur district that are affected due to these companies. The diversion of consumers to e-commerce sites will again increase their loss which will ultimately slow down the economy,” he said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Ticketless karate players thrash TTE in train near Amla station
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

BHOPAL: A train ticket examiner (TTE) on duty on Patliputra Express was thrashed by a group of 8 youths who were a part of college karate team from Danapur in Bihar near Amla railway station in Betul district.

GRP have arrested 8 accused who were produced before court on Wednesday. Court sent all of them to jail.

They allegedly thrashed the TTE Lokendra Babase when he asked for tickets, said sources. Only two-three of them had reservation while all others were travelling without reservation.

A few were without tickets, added sources.

When the dispute broke out, they started thrashing Babase and threatened to throw him out of the train, said sources.

Railway police was informed and GRP and RPF personnel caught four of the accused at Betul and rescued Lokendra Babase at around 4 pm on Tuesday. Babase was sent to hosptial for treatment, the other accused managed to hide themselves, but they too were caught and arrested at Itarsi railway station, police said.

“Eight accused identified as Shivam Rai, Rahul Singh, Rajesh Rai, Rajnish Yadav, Bablu, Amarjeet, Shiksharounak Singh, Vikash all residents of Danapur and students of DS College in Danapur, Patna, Bihar were produced before court and which sent them to jail on Wednesday,” Amla GRP police station in-charge, Hemraj Kumre told TOI. He added, “All are aged between 18 and 22 and had gone to participate in a karate competition at Chennai. The incident took place while they were returning to Patna”.

“Lokendra Babase has sustained injuries and is out of danger,” he said.

Title: Nagpur: Kanak Sur Mandir singers recreate magic of Asha’s hits
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Sharmila Charalwar (left) ans Anjali Vaidya enthrall with a duet song at the musical programme organized at Sc... Read More

Nagpur: Keeping its tradition, musical organization Kanak Sur Mandir (KSM) came up with a new concept presenting the hits of Asha Bhosle at an event titled ‘Yehi Woh Jagah Hai’ at Scientific Society Hall on Monday.

The list of 24 songs comprised Hindi and Marathi numbers of Asha Bhosle that were sung by the female artistes of KSM. The programme was conceptualized and directed by founder of the group Datta Harkare.

The programme commenced with a duet ‘Mann kyoon beheka’ voiced by Anuja Kedar and Leena Sonekar. The audience applauded with joy to the reminiscing performance of the duo.

Sharmila Charalwar presented ‘Sajna hai mujhe sajna ke liye’ followed by ‘Woh haseen dard dedo’ by Surekha Jichkar that was a treat to the ears.

‘Nigahen milane ko’ was sung by Kanaka Gadkari with precision. Anjali Vaidya’s rendition of ‘Aagey bhi jaane na tu’ had a soothing effect on the audience. Vaidya and Charalwar entertained the music lovers with popular song ‘Kajra mohobbat wala’ that was well received.

Hindi hits like ‘Do lafzon ki hain dil ki kahani’, ‘Jab chali thandi hawa’, Yeh mera dil’ and ‘Paan khaye saiyan hamaro’, and Marathi songs like ‘ Sharad sundar chanderi rati’, ‘Hi vaat dur jaate’, ‘Reshmachya reghani’, ‘Ekach ya janmi’ and others received applause from the gathering.

Other singers who mesmerized with their melodious voice were Rita Soni, Meera Garde, Shamla Tamaskar, Smita Saoji, Neena Varma, Soudamini Halde, Snehal Khandagale and Reena Sonekar.

Title: Gujarat: On Uttarayan, Muslim performs gau seva as homage to Brahmin friend
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bashir Jhankhra grows fodder in three bighas of the total six bighas land that he possesses.

SAVARKUNDLA (AMRELI): At a time when self-styled gau rakshaks are unleashing fear, a group of Muslim friends in Savarkundla not only set a example of communal amity but also immortalized their friendship with a Hindu by following the tradition of feeding cows on the pious day of Makar Sankranti.

On January 14, Bashir Jhankhra and his friends went around the town and fed nearly 650kg fodder to cows as a homage to his Brahmin friend, Nilesh Mehta, who died of cardiac arrest a fortnight ago.

“Nilesh was like my brother. As he was a Brahmin, the priests who performed his last rites told me that if I wanted to pay tribute to him, ‘gau seva’ (service to the cows) was the best way,” said Bashir who lives in Maninagar locality in the town.

Jhankhra grows fodder in three bighas of the total six bighas land that he possesses. Had he sold the 650kg of grass in the market, he would have easily earned anything around Rs 25,000. But he was not lured by money. Such was his bonding with Nilesh that Jhankhra even refused help from his farm labourers and harvested the entire grass all by himself. He was assisted by his friends – Junaid Jhankhra, Arif Sheikh, Idris Sheikh, Mohammed Hanif and Imtiyaz Pathan – in this activity.

Jhankhra’s farm is located exactly opposed the local municipality office where Nilesh worked as a temporary staffer and that’s how their friendship blossomed.

“I was helped by five of my friends in cutting the 650kg of grass from my farm. And what can be the best occasion but Makar Sankranti to feed the cows in my locality fresh fodder on the day,” said Jhankhara.

Parag Trivedi, vice-president of Amreli District Bramha Samaj, said, “We salute Jhankhara for the commendable way in which he paid tributes to a friend. He has truly produced an example of communal harmony.”

“We joined Bashir in feeding cows as we believe all religions and their cultures should be respected,” added Mehboob Qadri, his friend.

Jhankhra doesn’t support animal slaughter and said that if the cow has been given the status of the mother in Hindu culture, other communities can at least desist from it causing any harm.

Title: Nagpur: Read English for accurate drafting said Judge
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image


NAGPUR: The easiest way to perceive new words, correlate them in a grammatically correct structure and expand vocabulary is to religiously read a good English newspaper right from the top left column on the first page to the bottom right column on the last page, said high court judge RV Ghuge, on Wednesday. He said use of English is inevitable in legal field and lawyers need to make efforts for improving their presentation in this language. Otherwise, they would be restricted to using colloquial parlance, he added. He was delivering a lecture on ‘Importance of language and pleadings for lawyers’ organized by Study Circle of High Court Bar Association (HCBA) at HC auditorium, Civil Lines. Present at the lecture were HCBA president Gauri Venkatraman, vice-president PB Patil and secretary PS Khubalkar. Ghuge gave general guidelines pertaining to legal language one must incorporate while writing prayers and synopsis. “Ultimately, it is about a person’s skill when it comes to drafting prayers. I tried to evolve myself in this area by ensuring that the synopsis does not exceed in length, is crisp for the judges to understand without them having to shuffle through countless pages,” he said. Speaking about the synopsis, Ghuge said, “It has become an integral aspect as you cannot expect the judge to read several files before he gives his statement. It is humanly impossible. If you prepare the synopsis well, we get the picture of what you wish to say in the matter.” Other essential steps that Ghuge mentioned were to write short sentences and paragraphs, and knowing when to change paragraphs. He said, “The skill of pleading should be such that the judge does not call the lawyer to understand facts. You should aspire to reach this level of drafting.” Ghuge said, “The respect shown to the court in the context of conduct is pleasing to witness as far as the Nagpur bar is concerned. The earlier members of the bar have enabled it to mature to such a level. It is on the national map because of CJI Sharad Bobade and Uday Lalit and Bhushan Gavai serving as Supreme Court judges. This stature was not achieved by fluke. It has been earned by Nagpur bar. I hope that Aurangabad bar prospers in the same manner.”

Title: Two families clash during kite flying
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Vadodara: Two families clashed in Tandalja on Tuesday afternoon following arguments over flying kites. Three persons were injured in the melee as the two groups attacked each other with brick and wooden sticks.

According to Momin Khan Pathan, his neighbour Sadiq and his brother Imran Ghanchi were hurling abuses at Pathan’s daughter and son-in-law. Pathan told police that the Ghanchi brothers used foul language over kite wars with his son-in-law Navrez and daughter Tabassum.

When Pathan confronted Sadiq for using abusive language, the duo got into a verbal altercation. When Tabassum came to her father’s rescue, Imran threw a brick from the terrace which hit her on the head leading to serious injuries. When Pathan objected, Sadiq hit him on his left arm with a wooden stick.

Police said that Imran also joined the brawl and started to hit Pathan. When Navrez was about to hit Sadiq with a cricket stump, the latter’s pregnant wife Anisha stood in front of her husband. Instead of hitting Sadiq, the stump hit Anisha injuring her too. The fight stopped after locals intervened.

Later, Pathan, Tabassum and Anisha were taken to GMERS Medical College and Hospital, Gotri. Anisha was declared safe and discharged by evening. Pathan’s left arm was fractured and Tabassum’s head injury had to needed treatment.

Pathan and Anisha registered separate offences of assault and causing grievous hurt at JP Road police station.

Police booked Sadiq, Imran, Pathan and Navrez.

Title: Man held for carrying live cartridges at Jodhpur airport
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

JODHPUR: The police on Tuesday arrested a passenger who was found carrying two live cartridges in his luggage during security check at Jodhpur Civil Airport. He was produced in the court on Wednesday which sent him to judicial custody. The passenger was to board a SpiceJet flight to Pune.

According to SHO (Ratanada) Zulfikar Khan, the passenger has been identified as Durg Singh who hails from Nagaur. He has been working in a CNG gas agency in Pune for the past few years. We arrested Singh since he had no arm licence and produced him in the court which sent him to custody, he said.

Title: Shakambhari sees good revenue post-takeover of SPS
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kolkata: Buoyed by the acquisition of Elegant steel, Shakambhari Group is eyeing a topline of Rs 4,000 crore by 2020-21. It is hopeful to achieve Rs 3,000-crore mark itself in the current fiscal (2019-20).

Shakambhari acquired SPS Steel Rolling Mills that sells steel under Elegant brand through NCLT last year.

Following the takeover, the turnover of SPS also may surge 100% to Rs 900 crore in 2019-20 from Rs 480 crore, said Ankit Mittal, vice-president of Shakambhari Group.

“We aspire to achieve a turnover of Rs 1,500 crore by 2019-20 for SPS Steels,” he added.

Mittal pointed out that it is aiming to grab 15-17% market share in West Bengal from the current level of 8-9%. “TMT market is growing day by day and we are very conscious about quality.” he added. The group is now selling items like sponge iron, TMT bars, binding wire, HB wire, coil, Ms Billets etc.

“Currently, we are only exporting our products to Nepal. We have plans to expand and take over small units. We have received around 300 tonne turnover from Nepal. Sponge iron and billets are being exported mainly,” said Mittal.

Commenting further on future plans, Deepak Kumar Agarwal, CMD, Shakambhari Group, said, “We are planning to make Elegant Steel a pan-India brand though we have already started to penetrate in Jharkhand, Bihar, and Odisha markets. This has resulted in the increase of employment about 20%.”

The company is focusing on the modernization of its plant.

Title: Jaipur: Campaigning for first phase of panchayat elections ends
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

First phase of panchayat elections will be held on January 17

JAIPUR: As the campaigning for the first phase of panchayat elections ended on Wednesday, the fate of 17,242 candidates for the post of sarpanch and 42,704 candidates for the post of ward panch will be decided on Friday. Thirty six sarpanches and 11,035 ward panches have been elected unopposed after the withdrawal of candidature for the first phase of elections to 2726 gram panchayats in the state, scheduled to be held on January 17.

Meanwhile, for the second phase of panchayat elections, 609 candidates will be contesting for the post of Sarpanch in Jaipur. While 319 candidates have been elected unopposed, 1,644 candidates will be contesting for the post of ward panch in the district.

Of the total, 439 candidates are from Govindgarh panchayat samiti of Jaipur and 170 are from Sanganer panchayat samiti of the district.

Among the ward panch candidates, 1122 are from Govindgarh panchayat samiti of Jaipur and 522 are from Sanganer panchayat samiti of the district.

The state election commission (SEC) on Sunday had released the list of 32 observors for the first and third phase of panchayat elections.

Meanwhile, additional District Magistrate (ADM-IV) Ashok Kumar on Wednesday issued directions to ensure environment friendly conditions for persons with disabilities (PwDS) by constructing ramps for their convenience in all government offices and public places.

Title: Nagpur: ‘Ambedkar’s Buddhism pragmatic means to develop personality’
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Scott Stroud was delivering the second lecture as part of Dr Nitin Raut international lecture series on ‘Pragm... Read More

NAGPUR: Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar liked the relation of individual to social structure, but not the passivity of realizing one’s self through their role in an existing society. On similar lines, philosopher John Dewey asserted that one can grow in a society as part of it and not independently, said professor Scott Stroud, director of media ethics, Centre for Media Engagement, University of Texas, on Tuesday.

He was delivering the second lecture as part of Dr Nitin Raut international lecture series on ‘Pragmatism, personality and Ambedkar’s emphasis on conversion to Buddhism’. The lecture was organized by Nagpur University at Convocation Hall. Present at the programme were vice-chancellor SP Kane and officiating pro-VC Vinayak Deshpande.

Speaking about Dewey, Stroud said, “He is known as a philosopher of democracy and education in the American context. He might be the best known philosopher over the course of America’s short history. He is an important figure for India because of his writings about democracy and his struggles in America.”

Stroud said Ambedkar was a diligent student of Dewey while studying at Columbia University from 1913 to 1916. He said, “I believe one cannot understand Ambedkar’s pragmatism without talking about Dewey. At the same time, one cannot comprehend the strengths and weaknesses of Dewey’s thoughts without seeing how Ambedkar shaped those ideas uniquely in the Indian context.”

“You can be influenced by people in a way that does not entail you to replicate them. When Dewey died, Ambedkar said that he owed all of his intellectual life to Dewey,” he said.

“Ambedkar’s key concepts in pragmatism like caste as a habit and religion as a means was inculcated through Dewey’s philosophy,” he said.

Stroud said, “My thesis highlighted that Ambedkar’s Buddhism serves as a pragmatic means to develop each individual’s personality. Ambedkar put forth the concept of conversion as a group and individual means for freedom. He addressed how conversion can function as an intelligent means for emancipation.”

On the first day of the lecture series on Monday, Stroud said, “America is dealing with same issues regarding democracy in India, and we need to understand and make others also know how to get along with one another in society.” He was speaking on ‘Teaching of Lord Buddha’.

He spoke about Ambedkar’s concern that “The moment we stop talking and thinking about issues like democracy and what Buddhism taught us about equality and pragmatism, we tend to stop caring about them and they don’t really matter us”.

Stroud said he researched many articles, books and papers to understand Buddhism and how it is connected to American pragmatism and how Dewey influenced Ambedkar.

With inputs from Rushabh Rathod

Title: Karnataka gang travels 1,700 km to rob Kolkata jewellery stores
Content:
Representative image

Police have busted a gang of conmen, who had travelled around 1,700 km to the city all the way from Bidar in

Karnataka

and targeted jewellery stores in Bowbazar, Entally and Beliaghata

KOLKATA: Police have busted a gang of conmen, who had travelled around 1,700 km to the city— all the way from Bidar in Karnataka—and targeted jewellery stores in Bowbazar, Entally and Beliaghata. According to the cops, while one of them, Amzad Hussain, was arrested, three others were identified.“The Entally police anti-crime teams were on their rounds around 8.30pm on Tuesday, when they noticed three men roaming around suspiciously in the Sealdah station VIP parking area. As the cops tried to approach them, they began running. Three of them managed to give them a slip but Hussain was intercepted. We found gold chains in his possession and he did not have any satisfactory explanation for it. Suspecting they had been stolen, we cross-checked and found a link,” said Ajoy Prasad, DC (eastern suburban division). The chains were seized and the accused was arrested from the spot, booked under IPC sections 413 (habitually dealing in stolen property) and 414 (assisting in concealment of stolen property).Police said the gang would visit Kolkata for a few weeks, when they would first carry out a recce of jewellery shops and then, strike. The gang would reportedly keep moving from one Kolkata destination to another to evade suspicion. “Snatchers and pickpockets from Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand and Karnataka have made Kolkata their hunting ground. During their stay, this gang, like the others, had also rented accommodations away from the city to dodge police attention,” said a detective department officer.While Entally police station cops have alerted the OC watch section, detective department officers are likely to question him.The police pointed out that tracking kepmars was difficult as they kept shifting their places of operation. After a couple of operations here, they move to Mumbai or Delhi and may resurface here after about six months, police said, adding that two months ago, a conman from Maharashtra, Gulam Hussain Mallick Irani, who had accosted a man carrying Rs 1 lakh from a Gariahat-based bank branch and tricked him into giving him away Rs 36,000. He was subsequently arrested. “Kepmars are smooth operators. They strike up conversations with their targets and win their confidence by offering help. Some vendors or customers, whom they target, do not always keep a sharp eye out, especially when three to four men operate in tandem. Within seconds, the new-found ‘friends’ melt in the crowd with the stolen items,” an officer said.Read this report in Bengali

Title: Police yet to arrest man after killing pregnant wife
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The Karveer police are yet to trace the husband responsible for the murder of his pregnant wife in a private hotel in Wadange village on Tuesday.

Police have booked her husband under section 302 of IPC and have launched a search operation to find his whereabouts.

The victim identified as Sarika Vittal Mahanoor was found lying dead at her residence in a private hotel. The couple was married on June 12, 2019, and her husband was working as a cook in the same hotel. The couple was also residing in one of the hotel rooms.

Prashant Amrutkar, deputy superintendent of Karveer the division said, “We have launched a search operation to find out where the accused is absconding. Several teams have been formed that have been deployed to various places where the accused is likely to hide. We are also communicating with the accused’s family members and relatives to find out if he has contacted them since the incident.”

“We have received the post-mortem report from the Chhatrapati Pramila Raje (CPR) a civil hospital that has confirmed the death of the woman due to strangulation,” he said.

According to police officials, as per the complaint lodged by the victim’s family members since marriage, Sarika’s husband was suspecting her character and used to beat her. He was also a habitual drinker and used to consume liquor regularly. These issues strained their relations and her husband allegedly strangulated her to death.

Title: Jaipur: Board exams month away, but teachers busy with elections
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The annual board exams is barely a month away but teachers of government schools are engaged in election duties leaving students to their fate. Currently, there are around 50,000 government teachers on poll duty working 24 hours to prepare voters’ lists and attending training camps. This, however, is against the orders of the 2007 Supreme Court that clearly states that government teachers must not be put on election duty during working hours.

Rajasthan government teachers, however, have been hired for poll duty since the last two years for state assembly and urban body elections.

Harendra Singh (name changed), a government teacher appointed for election duty, said it gets tough for the students preparing for board exams. “We have been busy in panchayat elections since September, 2019. In December, schools were closed due to winter vacation and now we are on election duty. There was no time to finish the syllabus. Teachers are always soft target for the government and students’ suffer due to this,” Harendra said.

A senior election commission officer said they have to use the state machinery to conduct elections. “We try to appoint teachers to work after school timings but conducting elections is a huge task and teachers have to be given duties. They are not appointed outside their tehsil or areas they have been working so that they can balance timing with school,” the officer said.

Vipin Sharma, general secretary of the Rajasthan Primary and Secondary Teachers’ Association, said the government always promises not to send teachers for election duty, but in the end nothing is followed.

Title: Fast track court must hear case: Members
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

SLUG: Pandharpur murder

Kolhapur: The supporters and members of Karadkar Mutt have demanded that Ujwal Nikam should be appointed as special public prosecutor and the case in connection with the murder of Mutt in-charge Jaywant Hindurao Pisal be heard in a fast track court.

Pisal, 34, resident of Lavan Machi in Sangli district, was allegedly killed in the mutt premises located at Anilnagar area of Pandharpur on January 7. The case has been registered with Pandharpur police station. The police arrested Bajirao Jagtap (34, resident of Karad in Satara district, a senior member of the Mutt and former in-charge of the Mutt.

Pisal’s supporters had gathered in Kolhapur to draw attention of people to this matter. Ghansham Abasaheb Nandgaonkar, one of the supporter of Pisal, said, “We appreciate the work done by the Pandharpur police by arresting Jagtap immediately and investigating done so far in connection with the case. Now, we want steps to be be taken to ensure that the suspects are brought to justice as early as possible.”

“For this, we want the government to appoint special public prosecutor Ujwal Nikam in this case and run the trial in a fast track court,” he said.

Members of the mutt said they would soon be meeting ministers and government officials concerned to put forward their demands. “We also want the police to arrest the other suspects in the case. We appeal to all the warkaris to weed out such criminal mindset before entering into the mutt at Pandharpur and ensure that no such activities happen again in future,” he said.

Title: Injured pigeon saved from Sursagar
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kahar with the rescued pigeon

Vadodara: Love for birds led this Barodian to risk own safety after he jumped into the Sursagar lake to save a pigeon injured by a kite string on Uttarayan on Tuesday.

Satish Manga Kahar (43) and his daughter Asha Kahar had gone to Sursagar to witness kite flying festivities in the old city. However, they came to know about a pigeon that had fallen in the pond. Satish did not waste any time and plunged into the water to save the bird.

“I was there with my daughter when the pigeon fell in the pond. I heard policemen were looking for a boat to go into the pond and bring it out. This would be a wastage of precious time during which the bird may drown or die,” said Satish, a resident of Kakasahebno Tekro in Dandiabazaar.

Satish decided to jump into the pond immediately. “Cops asked me if I was able to swim. I told them not to worry about me, but for the bird,” he said. The entire incident was recorded on mobile cameras by people present there. Satish said that later people cheered him for his efforts and even clicked selfies with him and the pigeon.

A member of the Kahar community, Satish is in the business of fishing in Mahi river. “I know swimming and so brought out the pigeon easily,” he said.

Title: Bhopal: Fraudsters use cop’s ID to finance 4 two-wheelers
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

BHOPAL: Police busted a major racket of identity thieves and fraudsters who stole identities of people and purchased new vehicles on loan through forged documents. The racket was unearthed after a cop who had lost his wallet received a loan recovery notice for non-payment of EMIs of four two-wheelers.

The constable had lost his wallet and ATM card in 2018. Fraudsters found the wallet and used the constable’s documents to get four two-wheeler vehicles financed from various automobile showrooms in the city.

Hanumanganj police on Tuesday after investigating the constable’s complaint filed in October 2019, registered a case on charges of fraud against four accused and arrested one of them. Police suspects that the accused were involved in several similar frauds and are on the lookout for the three others.

Investigation officer Satyendra Choubey said that complainant constable Santosh Verma, 25, a resident of Teela Kheri village in Khajuri, is presently posted in Police Lines Raisen. He told police that on August 17, 2018, he lost his wallet containing his aadhar card, driving licence, PAN card and photographs along with two ATM cards at a market in Raisen. He had lodged a written complaint in this regard with Kotwali police station in Raisen.

The accused got hold of the wallet and used his documents to finance four two-wheeler vehicles from different automobile showrooms in Bhopal . The first vehicle was financed from an automobile showroom located on Berasia Road merely 10 days after the cop lost his wallet.

Choubey said that Verma was unaware that his documents were being used by fraudsters to finance vehicles. Six months later, in 2019 he came to know about the fraud when he started receiving recovery notices. He ran from pillar to post to file a complaint and even reported the matter to CM helpline, but nothing moved. Later, on October 10, 2019 he filed a written complaint with Hanumanganj police on which police conducted investigations and registered a case on Tuesday.

Choubey said during investigations police found that accused Rahil Khan and Khalid Khanfound Verma’s documents and used them to open a fake bank account in his name.

Title: Nagpur:‘Dandi March’ by doctors for law against mob violence
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Alleging that central government has withdrawn proposed law for protection of medicos, doctors attached to Indian Medical Association (IMA) have decided to “replicate” Mahatma Gandhi’s iconic Dandi March .

Thousands of doctors are expected to participate in the march to be taken out from Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat. This march will start on March 12 — the date on which Mahatma Gandhi had started Dandi March from the same ashram in 1930. However, unlike 384km march by the Mahatma, the doctors’ rally will be a symbolic 4km walk around Sabarmati Ashram.

IMA Maharashtra unit president Dr Avinash Bhondwe told TOI that Union home minister Amit Shah has withdrawn Health Care Service Persons and Health Care Service Institutions (Prevention of Violence and Damage to Property) Bill 2019, which was to be tabled in Parliament.

“The draft of this act was finalized by ministry of health and family welfare. Even the government had agreed that such law was necessary. But, recently, we have been told by home ministry sources that the proposed bill has been withdrawn,” said Dr Bhondwe. “The home ministry said such a law for a particular profession cannot be passed by the Centre,” said the IMA unit president.

“Medical profession and health care services are indeed unique and are comparable to no other professions. Any violence on doctors is indirect violence on patients. The home ministry should reconsider its stand,” he added.

Apart from the central law for prevention of violence, doctors are demanding that only MBBS qualified doctors should be allowed to provide health services in both villages and cities and government should not allow medicos from other streams to head any health centre.

The doctors also have reservations against several provisions in the new National Medical Council (NMC) Act like exit exam after MBBS course and provision that allows non-doctor health care professionals (ANMs, pharmacists etc) to prescribe medicines in some cases.

“IMA Maharashtra has 210 branches, with more than 43,500 members. They will be contacted and sensitized about the March. We also have network of undergraduate medical students and postgraduate students as youth wings of IMA. The students will also be made aware about the injustice. Various NGOs, clubs and associations will also be told about the March,” he said.
