With SC, ST and OBCs, government should also include all categories comprising open/general category for data collection,” states a memorandum SMSN submitted to Nagpur district collector Ravindra Thakre.

They also sought that the data collection should be more comprehensive and must include a precise assessment of present social, economic, cultural and educational status of all categories with a regular phase-wise, timely review mechanism in place.

Title: Ahmedabad: Man beaten for objecting to tree felling
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

A 30-year-old man from Sarkhej on Tuesday filed a complaint with police alleging that his neighbour and two of... Read More

AHMEDABAD: A 30-year-old man from Sarkhej on Tuesday filed a complaint with police alleging that his neighbour and two of his family members assaulted him as the complainant objected to them cutting trees in the housing society.

In his FIR with the Sarkhej police, Faruq Mansuri, 30, a taxi driver and a resident of Bilal Park Society in Sarkhej, said that he had seen his neighbour Altaf Mansuri cutting trees in the society.

“I told him not to cut the threes as they are needed, Altaf got angry at me and began abusing me. I responded and an argument ensued over the issue,” said Faruq in the complaint.

To avoid a fight with Altaf, Faruq did argue more and left the place. Later, he went to drive his taxi. When Faruq returned to his home at around 7pm on Tuesday, Altaf, his wife and their son rushed to their home and began arguing about why he had stopped them from cutting the trees.

As Faruq tried to tell them about the values of trees, Altaf and his family members began abusing him again. When Faruq’s wife intervened, Altaf’s wife hit her and as Faruq tried to rescue his wife, he was assaulted by Altaf and his son.

Altaf’s son also damaged Faruq’s motorcycle. A neighbour called the cops and a team of Sarkhej police reached theh spot and registered Faruq’s complaint.

Sarkhej police filed a complaint of assault, use of abusive words, criminal intimidation and abetment.

Title: Cyber cell issues advisory after two fraud cases in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image


JAIPUR: The IAS officer was duped of approximately Rs 2.5 lakh, though the police managed to recover most of the amount. In the second case, an official of the secretariat was duped of Rs 50,000, which is yet to be recovered. Both the incidents happened on January 12. In both the cases, a person had messaged asking the fraud victims to update their Paytm KYC details and make an online transaction of Rs 1. The accused had already hacked the victims’ phone and used it to take the One Time Password to withdraw money from their bank accounts. The advisory said that no information regarding bank accounts should be shared over phone even if the caller knows the name as well as other details of the person who is being called. Also while shopping online, no advance amount should be paid and in case if this is done, then the shopper should take a photo id of the person who is being paid. Also cases have been reported when the conmen have pretended to be a defence personnel and people should be cautious of such people without confirming their identity. While selling on sites like OLX, Quicker and others, people also have to be careful as in many instances the conmen pretend to be buyers and claim that they will transfer the money in the seller’s account but instead money is withdrawn using various methods of hacking if account details are shared. The advisory also says that a person should always use ATM card alone without taking help from strangers in the booth. Also ATM machines in isolated locations should be avoided as these are easy target for fraudsters who put schemer machines on these ATMs. Unconfirmed and dubious SMSs and links should also not be forwarded. Apart from these the advisory says that one must not search for customer care numbers online as they can be of the fraudsters who ask to download particular apps which helps them in hacking the targets bank account or e-wallets. Cyber police has advised to refrain from falling into the trap of winning online lotteries and to be extremely cautious if someone calls asking for payment for approving a bank loan or for jobs. One time passwords must not be shared.

Title: 108 couples to worship Mhadei water to create awareness
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Work of water diversion from the Mhadei to Karnataka in connivance with the Centre has already begun

PANAJI: Work of water diversion from the Mhadei to Karnataka in connivance with the Centre has already begun, yet the ruling in Goa, including chief minister Pramod Sawant, continue to pay lip-service with rhetoric like not a drop of Mhadei water will be diverted, Goa Suraksha Manch president Subhash Velingkar said. Only two years are left for the state assembly elections and the issue will spell doom for the ruling in Goa, he said.

To create awareness about the water diversion issue, 108 couples will worship a pot full of water collected from all nine tributaries of Mhadei river, at Shree Saptakoteshwar temple in Narve on February 9, he said. The programme was initiated on the occasion of Makar Sankranti on Wednesday, Velingkar said.

“This programme has been taken up under the organisation Bharat Mata Ki Jai and we have called it Mhadeimata Poojan Abhiyan. The programme began informally at Shree Sateri Mandir in Surla, Sattari on the occasion of Makar Sankranti. The programme will be held in 15 villages one by one, where water from the nine tributaries will be collected locally and worshipped in each of the local temples. Finally, the pot full of water from all these programmes will be worshipped at Shree Saptakoteshwar temple by 108 couples,” said Velingkar, adding that 105 organisations, including GSM, will be participating in the programme.

Altogether, 1500 men and women will be part of the Mhadeimata Pooja Abhiyan and take an oath to ‘free Mhadei’, Velingkar said.

“The water collected will go to all 12 talukas and it will be worshipped at each place. Devotion forms an important part of life in Goa and therefore we decided to create awareness about the Mhadei water diversion issue through this route. Meeting of workers of all the participating organisations will also be held to mobilise them for Mhadeimata Poojan Abhiyan, on January 20 in Swami Vivekanand hall in Porvorim and on January 21 at Lingayat hall in Margao,” he said.

Velingkar also appealed to all opposition political parties in Goa to shed their party affiliations and come together to fight for the lifeline of Goa, Mhadei, on a common platform. “If that happens, it can shake this government out of its complacence,” he said.

Title: With BSY facing financial crisis, policy paralysis hurting K’taka
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bengaluru: Last year’s floods, which ravaged 22 districts, have proved a massive stumbling block for BS Yediyurappa’s administration since it has laid bare the state exchequer. This is reflected in the fact that the CM is unable to announce fresh policies or envisage populist schemes.

While he inherited the populist Rs 42,000 crore farm loan waiver scheme from the previous coalition government, Yediyurappa further reduced room to manoeuvre by announcing an additional Rs 4,000 for each beneficiary farmer under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Yojana and Rs 5 lakh for reconstruction of each house destroyed by the floods. Incidentally, those are the only “magnanimous” announcements by the CM in the last six months.

Finance department officials say the enhanced compensation and the farm loan waiver have taken a serious toll on the fiscal situation in Karnataka, which is also facing an economic slowdown.

“We admit the initial few months have been quite slow. However, over the past couple of months, we have been doing a decent job on disbursing relief for flood victims,” said law minister JC Madhuswamy, confirming the lacklustre start to Yediyurappa’s fourth stint at the helm.

However, finance department officials suggest the worst is yet to come.

“With our own revenue collection at 70% and with the economy showing no sign of picking up pace in the fourth quarter, allocating funds for the 2020-21 budget will be a tough ask,” said one official. “If central funds do not amount to at least 70% of what was promised, we are likely to see a serious financial crisis.”

Yediyurappa admitted as much during the fiasco at the Davanagere Panchamasali Mutt on Tuesday. “Everybody knows the toll which the floods extracted. If I admit there is a financial crisis then it will be headlines in every newspaper. Please understand my position and support me,” Yediyurappa said at the function.

Added to the fiscal crisis, the political predicament also appears to be taking a toll on Yediyurappa and governance. With lack of support from the central leadership, his hands have been tied for even the simplest of decisions like expanding his cabinet.

Party sources say the cadre is unhappy, thanks to the delay in expanding the cabinet and appointing presidents to boards and corporations.

“The writing on the wall suggests further delays. Despite threats from new legislators and our own party functionaries, the CM is unable to expand his cabinet without the central leadership’s assent. So where is the question of appointments to boards and corporations which we cadre have been eagerly waiting for?” said one party functionary.

Title: Chinese manja vigilante thrashed
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 36-year-old man from Sarkhej on Tuesday filed a complaint with police alleging that he was beaten up by four men on Monday, when he objected to them selling Chinese manja.

In his FIR, Mohammed Firoz Shaikh, who works for a private security agency, said that he had learned from his friends that a man named Zaheer Dalal was selling Chinese manja. “I went to meet Dalal about this tried to persuade him not to sell Chinese manja as it could end up killing human beings,” Shaikh stated in the FIR.

Shaikh alleged that Dalal did not like the advice and began abusing Shaikh. As Shaikh remonstrated, Dalal and three of his family members assaulted him and one of them slashed Shaikh on his biceps.

Dalal also filed a complaint alleging that Shaikh was no activist but rather wanted Chinese manja from Dalal.

Dalal alleged that Shaikh and three others had come to his shop on Monday night asking for Chinese manja from him. “As I told him that I do not sell Chinese manja and could give some other good quality manja, Shaikh began alleging that I sell Chinese manja. When I told him not make baseless allegations, he began beating me,” said Dalal.

Dalal alleged that Shaikh and his three aides attacked him and his family members with swords and iron rods. Sarkhej police also registered an FIR for assault, criminal intimidation and abetment against Shaikh and three others.

Title: Nagpur: High Court to start final hearing of irrigation scam PILs from Feb 13
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Irrigation scam

NAGPUR: The Nagpur bench of Bombay high court would be commencing final hearing of multi-crore irrigation scam cases from February 13.

On Wednesday, a division bench comprising Justice Sunil Shukre and Justice Milind Jadhav informed the respective counsels for petitioners and respondents that all their contentions and applications would be heard regularly from February 13.

Earlier, Janmanch counsel Firdos Mirza argued on a new application filed by him demanding institution of probe under sitting/retired judge from the Supreme Court or high court under the Commission of Enquiries Act, 1952. He explained the circumstances behind the demand to handover the probe from state’s Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) to the judge.

Justifying the NGO’s prayer, Mirza stated with change of guard in the state, it’s pertinent to witness change in the agency as those made respondent in the PILs were occupying top positions in the government and there was every possibility of manipulation.

Opposing the demand, senior counsels — PK Dhakephalkar and Anil Sakhare — appearing for deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar and Engineers Welfare Association, respectively, contended that investigating agency couldn’t be changed at this stage. According to them, the probe has already progressed significantly and many FIRs were lodged by the ACB and charge sheets also filed in some cases.

Responding to the arguments, Mirza said people wouldn’t get justice unless an independent inquiry is conducted into the entire scam.

Both senior counsels, however, demanded rejection of the applications filed by the petitioners — Janmanch and social worker Atul Jagtap through counsel Shridhar Purohit.

The judges, however, clarified that they would be considering both applications by the petitioners. They asked the respondents to file their reply on merits of both the applications which would be heard with all five PILs — first by Janmanch (PIL No. 12/2016) and four others by Jagtap (PILs No. 141, 142, 172 & 173/2016) — from February 13 onwards.

Earlier on Tuesday, Ajit Pawar broke his silence by filing an affidavit wherein he opposed the petitioners’ demand to handover the probe into Rs70,000 crore scam case to either Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) or Enforcement Directorate (ED). Demanding dismissal of both applications by imposing pecuniary costs on the petitioners, the deputy CM granted a “clean chit” to himself by refuting all allegations against him.

Janmanch, in its latest application, contended that since Pawar is in influential position as deputy CM, it doesn’t trust the investigating agency (ACB) anymore, as it’s directly functioning under the state government. The NGO, through its adviser Sharad Patil, accused ACB of making all out efforts to save the Baramati MLA by “creating incorrect records and misleading the judiciary”.

Janmanch said in the changed political scenario where Pawar is playing a major role in the government, it doesn’t have faith in ACB or CBI which is in direct control under the state or central governments, respectively.

Title: Gujarat high court dismisses plea for compensation for 1984 riots
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Gujarat high court

AHMEDABAD: A division bench of the Gujarat high court has dismissed an appeal filed by a member of the Sikh community seeking compensation for the damages sustained by the community in Ahmedabad during the riots that followed the assassination of the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

Sardar Jagjitsingh Khanuja filed the appeal in October last year after a single judge had rejected his petition for compensation for 60 Sikh families in Gujarat. The division bench last week said that the collector had then submitted a detailed report after examining the complaint of losses suffered during the riots. The report did not indicate “any loss having been suffered by the appellants”. Moreover, there is a long lapse of time, almost 30 years, by now and there are no factual details provided to justify a claim in such a situation, when the questions of fact were highly disputed and require a threadbare examination, the HC said.

In 2015, Khanuja had approached the HC seeking directions to the Ahmedabad district collector to compensate members of the Sikh community for the losses sustained during the 1984 violence. The HC was not convinced with an FIR and few statements to substantiate the claim of damages and loss of the properties.

The single judge as well as the division bench noted that a PIL was also filed in 2012 with similar prayers, but it was not entertained. Moreover, the district collector’s report also did not indicate that there was any loss recorded during the riots. This led the HC to raise question on veracity of claims. Moreover, the HC said that the cause for 60 families was espoused by a few “non-suited” persons.

Title: Margao civic body divided over Shigmo route
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Margao: Two years after shifting the Shigmo parade to the Colva circle-Ravindra Bhavan route, Margao Municipal Council (MMC) opposition councillors during Wednesday’s meeting demanded that it be shifted back to the earlier route within the town, from Holy Spirit Church square to MMC square.

However, with chairperson Pooja Naik stoutly rejecting the demand, opposition councillors threatened to have their way thereby indicating that a showdown with the ruling councillors over the issue was on the cards.

“The route has been approved by traffic police and the district collector. It has been made into a permanent venue for holding Carnival and Shigmo parades. We can’t change the route now,” Naik said.

Later speaking to reporters, Opposition councillors adopted a defiant stand. “This year the Carnival and Shigmo parades will be held on the streets of Margao. We will make it happen,” BJP councillor Ketan Kurtarkar said.

The face off between ruling and councillors over the parade route signifies a turf war. The parade route was shifted to the present route by then deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai. With Sardesai out of the cabinet now and Margao MLA Digambar Kamat not on cosy terms with the Fatorda MLA, the BJP intends to regain lost ground by relocating the parade venue to the traditional route.

The controversy over MMC’s jaunt to Mt Abu, Rajasthan, came to the fore at the meeting, with opposition councillors questioning Naik’s decision to cancel the study tour bowing to objections from certain quarters. After a fiery discussion, Naik said those willing to go to would be permitted to do so, but stressed that she along with the other 10 Fatorda councillors wouldn’t participate in the tour.

Title: MSEDCL proposes moderate hike in power tariff
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Nagpur: State discom MSEDCL has proposed a moderate hike in power tariff for 2020-21. This time, it has proposed a slight increase in energy charges for domestic consumers, but fixed charges will depend on your consumption now.

There is some relief for consumers as the wheeling charges have been reduced. The higher-end consumers have been spared sharp hikes as MSEDCL fears that they may switch over to solar.

MSEDCL has filed a tariff petition for the next five years. Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission (MERC) will fix the tariff based on objections and suggestions given by consumers. The consumers can submit the same to MERC by February 4. The first public hearing will be held in Pune on February 6 and final one in Nashik on February 15.

The Nagpur hearing will be on February 11. The copy of detailed petition can be obtained from the local chief engineer’s office by paying the stipulated charges.

Currently, the fixed charges were Rs90 per month for domestic consumers irrespective of the consumption. MSEDCL has proposed to levy it depending on your consumption. If your consumption is up to 100 units, it will be Rs100, if it is between 101 and 500 units, it will be Rs110, and if it’s above 500 units, then it will be Rs120 per month.

The wheeling charges have been reduced from Rs1.21 per unit to Rs1.15 per unit. As for energy charges, there is no hike for below poverty line (BPL) consumers and modest hike for domestic consumers.

MSEDCL has sharply reduced the fixed charges for small commercial establishments. Currently, it is Rs391 per month. For connections having load up to 20 KVA, it will now be Rs207 per month. However, it has been increased for loads more than this.

The variable charges for small commercial establishments has also been reduced for high consumption. At present for loads up to 20 KVA, the tariff is Rs6.10 per unit up to 200 units, and Rs9.25 per unit above that. Now, a flat tariff of Rs7.90 per unit has been proposed. There is a 2% increase for consumers having load between 20 KVA and 50 KVA and no increase for those having load more than 50 KVA.

As usual, industries will bear the brunt of MSEDCL’s tariff hikes. An increase of 10% has been proposed for high tension (HT) industrial consumers in Rs/KVA/month tariff. There is, however, negligible increase in variable charges.

The proposed hike for metered agricultural consumers is 5%. The tariff for public services (government institutions) having load up to 20 KVA is flat at Rs3.70 per unit while that for non-government institutions is Rs5.80 per unit. There is a hike of 4-6% for loads above this. The electrical vehicle charging stations’ tariff has been increased from Rs4.72 per unit to Rs5 per unit.

Title: Jaipur: Accused husband sent to custody for double murder
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

JAIPUR: The accused husband in Pratap Nagar double murder case was sent to judicial custody, while the killer’s police remand was extended by two days on Wednesday.

The two had been in police custody since their arrest on January 10 and police had been continuously questioning them to unfold the sequence of events in the gruesome murders.

Hired killer Saurabh Chaudhary’s police remand was extended till January 17, while the accused husband and the mastermind of the double murders, Rohit Tiwari, was sent to judicial custody. Saurabh on January 7 brutally murdered Shweta Tiwari and her infant son Shreyam. While Shweta’s body was found in her flat, the child’s body was found in a forest close to the residential complex where the family resided.

Cops have been working to collect substantial evidence against the accused and have constituted a special team to form the charge sheet. Rahul Jain, DCP East said, “A team has been formed to carefully draft the charge-sheet in the case. It will be headed by an additional SP rank officer and the team will work to ensure that it is a foolproof charge-sheet.”

Title: Jaipur: Education minister Govind Singh Dotasra’s email account hacked, complaint lodged
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representational image

JAIPUR: State education minister Govind Singh Dotasra ’s email account was allegedly hacked and a mail was sent from it early on Wednesday. The minister took to Twitter to share this information and posted a screenshot of the sent mail. He asked the recipients of the mail to delete it.

In the tweet, the minister said, “Today morning at 3.50am, my email account was hacked and a mail was sent to everyone in my contact list. I would request everyone to delete the mail. A complaint in this regard has been lodged with cyber security department. Inconvenience is regretted.”

Dotasra also shared a screenshot of the sent mail but link for the same could not be opened when TOI tried to access it.

The complaint addressed to the cyber cops said that the email account was used by the minister for important government works and there are high chances that the unidentified accused can the account for causing harm because of which it is crucial that the accused be found. “It is a cause of concern that people are hacking accounts and we were advised to not open the email that was sent from my account as it might corrupt more data on the system. This is the reason I tweeted so people become aware of this. We changed the password so that the account can be used again. It is difficult to understand the purpose behind this hacking”, added the minister.

Cyber police confirming the incident said that they will serve a legal notice to Google so as to find the source from where the hacking was done and further investigation is underway

According to cyber experts, hacking accounts and creating fake accounts of dignitaries and further demanding money from their friends via message chats is one of the most common ways of online fraud. Experts said that the fraudsters use hit and trial method to target people as the mobile numbers and email ids of dignitaries are easily available on various platforms.

Title: No permanent site given to beach cleaning agency: Tourism director
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Colva: Tourism director Menino D’Souza said on Wednesday that the newly appointed beach cleaning agency Karnataka Commercial and Industrial Corporation (KCIC), will not be allotted a permanent transfer station to collect wet waste gathered from beach shacks in South Goa before sending it to the treatment plant.

“They have been allotted several spots to temporarily store the wet waste, which is collected from beach shacks from Cavelossim to Arossim, before sending it for treatment,” D’Souza said.

Waste is collected from 96 shacks allotted by the tourism department, besides private shacks.

A month ago, TOI had reported that children’s park at Colva had turned into a garbage transfer station. At the time, KCIC’s Goa head Parveen Farooqui had said that this was a temporary arrangement and that they were in the process of getting a transfer station from the tourism department. After this, she had said, they would shift the unit to Benaulim.

Justifying the temporary transfer stations, the authorities said that the wet waste that arrives at the transfer station is not unloaded on the ground. It is directly moved to a larger vehicle for transfer to the treatment plant.

Since the report, however, the agency had stopped using the children’s park, which fronts the iconic Colva beach, as a temporary transfer station. It now only keeps bins there. A hotelier in the vicinity on condition of anonymity said the entire area was stinking of decomposed food.

Asked what would happen once Colva beach is developed under the central scheme, the director said the transfer station would be moved as these are temporary measures.

Title: Kerala governor refuses to sign ordinance on local bodies
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Arif Mohammad Khan

Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala governor Arif Mohammad Khan has reportedly refused to sign the ordinance approved by the state cabinet to increase the number of members in local bodies which is likely to delay the delimitation process. The governor has informally communicated to minister for LSG A C Moideen that the government may bring the matter for a debate in the assembly and get it passed with the consent of the opposition.

Earlier opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala had sent letters to governor expressing reservations regarding the ordinance to increase the number of members in local bodies. The governor forwarded the letters to the state government for response and for each letter a detailed report was submitted by the state government.

In an informal meeting with the governor on Wednesday, the minister is learnt to have brought up the matter and in response governor has communicated that the matter may be settled between UDF and LDF in the assembly and then it be brought to him.

LSG minister will hold a meeting with chief minister in the next two days to resolve the issue.

Title: Ahmedabad records over 150 Uttarayan-related injuries
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: For Jay Parmar, 30, a resident of Asarwa, a trip to his brother’s residence to celebrate Uttarayan proved to be near-fatal when his throat was slit by a glass-laced manja coated thread on Tuesday. Parmar received 15 stitches as the front and side of his throat were cut.

He was among the 24 persons who were admitted to the Civil Hospital on the day of Uttarayan due to injuries caused by kite threads — either manja or nylon thread, popularly known as ‘Chinese manja.’

Dr M F Shaikh, head of the plastic surgery department at Civil Hospital, said the department received a total of 41 cases of Uttarayan-related injuries including 24 by kite threads. “Out of the total, 21 were superficial and three were deep. Among overall injured, 31 were males, nine children and one female,” he said. “Others sustained injuries due to fall from height.”

While LG Hospital recorded 35-odd cases of Uttarayan-related emergencies, Sola Civil Hospital received 12 cases, said senior hospital authorities.

EMRI 108 data revealed that 72 persons were taken to various hospitals in Ahmedabad on Tuesday due to manja-related injuries whereas 87 were shifted due to injuries from falls.

“For Gujarat, the figures were 200 and 304 respectively. The incidents continued on Wednesday as well — popularly identified as ‘Vasi Uttarayan’ - where 79 in Gujarat including 33 from Ahmedabad sustained injuries from kite threads,” said a senior EMRI official.

Officials added that in many instances, the victims received injuries near their eyes, below their chins, on their ears and noses, or on their cheeks and lips. A few of the incidents involved falls from moving vehicles. Thus, the victims also sustained fractures or muscle injuries.

Jashvant Prajapati , COO of EMRI Gujarat, said that compared to 2019, the year recorded 14% rise in emergencies on Uttarayan in Gujarat whereas the figure was 24% for Ahmedabad.

Title: Government relaxes norms for three plazas in Rajasthan
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

FASTag norms for 65 toll plazas, including three in Rajasthan, with high cash transactions have been relaxed

JAIPUR: To facilitate smooth flow of traffic at the toll plazas in the national highways, FASTag norms for 65 toll plazas, including three in Rajasthan, with high cash transactions have been relaxed to allow them to convert up to 25 per cent of "FASTag lane of fee plaza" into hybrid lanes for 30 days, the Centre said in a statement on Wednesday.

With FASTag toll collection at 68.63% in Rajasthan, the number of vehicles (the ones that use national highways) with FASTag has touched 59.92% in the state. Among the three plazas in Rajasthan include Negadiya plaza in Udaipur, Gagal in Ajmer and Kishangarh in Jaipur. The move, a road ministry statement said, is temporary for 30 days and has been done on the request of National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) so that the citizens are not put to any inconvenience. As per NHAI chairman SS Sandhu, Jodhpur toll plaza in Rajasthan has outperformed others in implementation of FASTags with around 91 per cent of toll collection taking place via FASTags.

Among the plazas, Banthadi plaza in Ajmer (19.79%), Rajora Khurd plaza in Dausa (20.47%), Nimbiyo ki Dhani plaza in Barmer (21.66%) and Nimbasar in Barmer (22.79%) have lowest FASTag coverage. Toll plazas with highest FASTag coverage in Rajasthan are Raipur in Jodhpur (76.21%), Daulatpur in Jaipur (75.96%) and Biramani in Jodhpur (75%).

Title: One dies in truck accident at Kundaim
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ponda: A pedestrian was killed and several roadside shops damaged at Kundaim on Wednesday after an interstate truck driver lost control of the vehicle. The truck had arrived from Kolhapur, Maharastra, and was proceeding towards Panaji.

Ponda police said truck driver Vivek Gaikwad from Kolhapur lost control of the vehicle on the descending road at Manaswada, Kundaim, 12km from Ponda. Manovikas Das, 25, a migrant worker, who was crossing the road was hit by the truck. After hitting him the truck continued to damage shops alongside the road.

A severely injured Das was rushed to Ponda sub-district hospital, but he died while being shifting to Goa Medical College and Hospital. Gaikwad was arrested and an offence registered against him at Ponda police station.

Title: Carlos asks for written nods for flagpost
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Vasco: Railway officials, who met Vasco MLA Carlos Almeida on Wednesday in connection with the stalled work of installing a flagpost outside the railway station, were told to get all the required permissions in writing.

The South Western Railway had commenced work on erecting the flagpost on Tuesday after the MMC chairperson gave his verbal consent.

A railway official said it was a wasted trip for their technical team, which arrived from Pune on Wednesday for a day, to see the work through. “We only need two hours to complete the work. Now it doesn’t look like the flagpost will be installed in time for the January 26 celebration,” officials said.

A decision will now be taken by the Mormugao Municipal Council when it meets on January 22. Meanwhile, the pole is proving to be an obstruction outside the station.

Title: Jaipur: Kingpin held after one year for murdering cop’s mom-in-law
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Accused Sultan Padri in police custody on Wednesday

JAIPUR: City police have arrested the prime accused in the murder of a 75-year-old mother-in-law of a senior police officer.

She was brutally murdered by a gang of three masked and armed robbers at her Mansarovar residence in September 2018. The accused is said to be a member of the Padri gang. The elderly lady was thrashed by the three hardcore criminals when she resisted the robbery bid. Sharp injuries on her head and neck, along with profuse bleeding, had led to her death.

While cops had arrested five members of the gang previously, 23-year-old Sultan Padri was the kingpin and the main accused in the elderly woman’s murder.

Anand Shrivastav, Commissioner of Police, Jaipur, said, “Sultan had absconded after the murder and we had been looking for him since 2018. While other members of the Padri gang had been arrested, Sultan was the main accused and a team was constituted to trace him. A reward of Rs 25,000 was also announced on his arrest.”

Cops arrested Sultan from Madhya Pradesh’s Ratlam after receiving information about his location. He is also involved in robbery cases in Jhunjhunu district.

Three robbers, clad in underclothes and vests, attempted to rob two houses on the intervening nights of September 14-15, 2018, before finally breaking into the house of victim Pushpa Bisaria. The senior citizen lived in the house with her grandson while her son-in-law, additional SP (SOG) Sanjiv Bhatnagar, stayed next door. The victim’s ears and nose had sustained injuries after the robbers snatched her gold earrings and nose ring.

The gang had tied up her grandson Shaurya Vardhan Bisaria, whose parents live in Delhi, to a chair in his room. Shaurya has been living with his grandmother for the past four months, since the death of his grandfather. The incident came to light when Shaurya, who managed to free himself, informed Bhatnagar and his family.

Title: Will win Margao, Fatorda seats in 2022 elections: BJP
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

BJP state president Sadanand Tanavade

MARGAO: BJP state president Sadanand Tanavade on Wednesday said the party would win both—Fatorda and Margao—assembly seats which are currently with the opposition in the 2022 assembly elections.

“We will definitely win Fatorda constituency. Margao too will be in our kitty, and we will start working towards that soon,” Tanavade told reporters during his first visit to the party’s South Goa office in Margao after taking over the reins of the party earlier this week.

Squashing speculations about Margao MLA Digambar Kamat joining BJP, Tanavade said, “It’s a misfortune of Congress that its president has no trust in his own MLA.” He was alluding to the recent statement by state Congress president Girish Chodankar to the effect that BJP was attempting to induct Kamat into the saffron party.

“This isn’t an issue in the party. There hasn’t been a discussion regarding any such thing in the party. We have 27 MLAs, we are safe and enjoy a comfortable majority; we don’t need to induct anybody,” Tanavade said.

Referring to Kamat’s ongoing door-to-door campaign, Tanavade said, “He has become insecure, and therefore he is going door-to-door. He is in confusion.”

He added that the party’s aim would be to come to power on its own strength with absolute majority in the 2022 polls. Asked about the party’s preparation for the zilla panchayat elections which are likely to be held in March, Tanavade said that while BJP would win the ZP polls, the party wouldn’t turn it into a “prestige” issue.

“Our aim is to win the 2022 assembly elections,” he said.

Replying to a query, Tanavade said a mechanism would soon be put in place to ensure that all ministers and officers interact with party workers at BJP offices.

NRI commissioner Narendra Sawaikar and BJP general secretary Damodar Naik were also present.

Title: DM orders inquiry after woman was allegedly roughed up during Sampurn Samadhan Divas
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bareilly: District magistrate (DM) Nitish Kumar has set up an inquiry in the matter of a woman, who was allegedly roughed up by police during Sampurn Samadhan Divas organised at Meerganj subdivision on Tuesday. The DM said he has asked the additional district magistrate (ADM) V K Singh to investigate the police role in the matter and report to him.

On Tuesday, one Soni Devi had reportedly created a ruckus at the hall. She subsequently got injured after being dragged outside by cops. According to officials, she had repeatedly made false complaints in the past, and had again reached the tehsil hall on Tuesday with a complaint.

However, Devi alleged that a lekhpal was demanding bribe for measuring the piece of land allotted to her by district administration. The drama over her manhandling continued for half an hour and was videographed by people who had gathered there on cell phones, which later went viral.

While reacting to the incident, the DM on Wednesday said, “I’d heard that this woman has created nuisance on several occasions before even taking charge in the district. My predecessor had to call up police to control her when she had once created a ruckus at the collectorate. I’ve asked the ADM (executive) to examine the matter and report to me.”

The DM said Devi was allotted a small piece of land for few years. After the lease period expired, she was allotted two more land parcels, bigger in size, in the same village.

According to sources in the administration, years ago, plots of around 2.5 bigha size were allotted for 5 years to eligible SC people. Devi had got a plot then. After the lease expired, a fresh allotment took place.

“This time, Devi was allotted 6 bighas, for good, as well as another one acre plot for tree plantation near the river. We learnt she now wants that 2.5 bigha plot too, whose lease has expired,” DM said.

On asking why her nose was bleeding after the police action, the DM said, “It was a minor accident. Senior officers were present there and she was immediately provided first aid.”

Title: Uttarakhand: Villager claims he has ‘khukri’, sword gifted by Corbett; admin to verify
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Prakash Bora is the descendant of Dungar Singh, who helped Jim Corbett hunt the man-eater of Champawat

PITHORAGARH: A resident of Gaudi village in Champawat district of Kumaon, Prakash Bora, has claimed to have found a ‘ khukri ’ (carved knife) and sword given by famous hunter and environmentalist Jim Corbett to his ancestor Dungar Singh who had helped Corbett pin down the location of a fearsome man-eater tigress on the Champawat-Gaudi road in 1907. Corbett also mentioned Dungar Singh in his book ‘Man-eaters of Kumaon’ in which he described the hunt for the tigress who had killed an estimated 436 people in the region. This was apparently the first man-eater killed by Corbett. The ‘khukri’ and sword were discovered by Bora’s family last week in the godown of their home.

Taking note of the villager’s claims, the Champawat district administration said that they will have the ‘khukri’ and sword examined and also carbon-dated, if possible, to determine their antiquity. “If it is indeed found to have a Corbett connection, we will highlight this in the Corbett circuit of Kumaon being planned for tourists,” said a district official.

Speaking to TOI, Bora said that his ancestor, Dungar Singh died almost 30 years ago. “Occasionally, some people, mostly tourists, used to come to our house asking about him and his association with Corbett since they had read his name being mentioned by Corbett in his book. They also used to ask us if Corbett had given anything to him for his help in tracking the man-eater since the hunter was known to gift things to his associates,” Bora said.

Although the family knew that Dungar Singh had been given a ‘khukri’ and sword by Corbett, they were not sure where these items were kept. However, last week, both the items were discovered in a godown under a pile of wood. “We have informed government officials regarding the find,” Bora said.

Lata Bisht, district tourism officer, Champawat, told TOI that the items can be a big attraction for tourists in the region. “We are planning to develop a ‘Corbett circuit’ in Champawat and have identified four places where he tracked and subsequently killed the man-eater tigress of Champawat. These items can add to the things that tourists can see,” Bisht said.

Title: Rat in ICU, Rajasthan minister summons officer
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Nagar MLA Wajib Ali inspected the Bharatpur Hospital on behalf of to... Read More JAIPUR: Close on the heels of deaths of over 100 children at J K Lon Hospital in Kota, rats found in intensive care unit (ICU) of Bharatpur’s government hospital. Besides, dogs were found roaming in the wards. Taking the matter seriously, tourism minister and Deeg-Kumher MLA Vishvendra Singh summoned chief medical and health officer (CMHO) of Bharatpur over unhygienic condition of the hospital. “I am astonished on seeing the photographs of a rat in the ICU and stray animals on the beds of Bharatpur’s main hospital. A ministerial colleague is the MLA from the area and I thought all was under control. Anyway, I have summoned CMHO, Bharatpur to meet me in Jaipur,” Singh tweeted on Wednesday. Moreover, Singh has decided to bring the facilities in the hospital back on tracks. “I will be inspecting all hospitals in Bharatpur city over the coming weekend,” he tweeted. Moreover, he has decided to rope in Nagar MLA Wajib Ali to help in monitoring the healthcare for better services of the patients. “I am asking responsible colleague @aliwajib to visit the hospital and take account of the situation in order to pass interim orders for upkeep of standards, hygiene and patient comfort,” he tweeted.

Title: Maharashtra plans Kochi model to raze huge illegal buildings
Content:
File photo of apartment demolished through controlled implosion in Maradu

The Maharashtra government plans to replicate the Kochi model to pull down the illegal structures by roping in demolition expert S B Sarwate

PUNE: The Maharashtra government plans to replicate the Kochi model to pull down the illegal structures by roping in demolition expert S B Sarwate, a senior official in the urban development department said on Wednesday.The official told TOI that talks were on both at the local- and state-level to use Sarwate’s expertise to demolish the structures through controlled implosion (see box), for which the administrative nod is in place.The Kerala government had roped in Sarwate (70), a mining engineer and demolition expert from Indore holding the Guinness world record for imploding the maximum number of buildings in India, to help it guide the demolition of the Maradu apartments in Kochi. The Supreme Court had ordered the demolition of the apartment buildings — Jains Coral Cove, H2O Holy Faith, Golden Kayaloram and the twin towers of Alfa Serene — as they violated the Coastal Regulation Zone norms and were located dangerously close to the Vembanad Lake.“The demolition was done without any damage to any nearby structure. It was a humungous task, as it required a lot of follow-ups and there were five buildings,” Kochi sub-collector S Snehil Kumar Singh told TOI.Sarwate told TOI over phone that the Kochi demolition method could be used to bring down huge illegal structures in Maharashtra too. “The demolition in Kochi required over 400kg of explosives. It was done to perfection without affecting any structure in the 100m radius. The method has been used for some structures in Navi Mumbai and Nagpur,” he said.A Maharashtra revenue official said a municipal corporation can take a call on using the technology to raze structures identified for demolition.

Title: Maharashtra: Six more arrests in tiger poaching case
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

With the arrests, the number of accused has now risen to eight in connection with the tiger poaching

CHANDRAPUR: Six more arrests have been made in connection with the tiger poaching in South Bramhapuri range.

With the arrests, the number of accused has now risen to eight. Foresters have seized 13 nails and three canines of tiger from the accused.

Mutilated carcass of a full grown tiger was found in compartment No. 1179 of South Bramhapuri range on January 11. Body parts including head, all paws and tail of the tiger were missing.

The foresters have obtained custody remand of the six accused. Sources informed that based on the information revealed by first two accused Bajirao Mashakhetri and Rakesh Zade, the officials had arrested Yashwant Bobate on Sunday. He was sent in custody till January 20, on production before a court on Monday.

Five more accused were picked up from Mudjha village — Narayan Nagpure, Bandu Pal, Dadaji Naghade, Charandas Hulke and Yashwant Chimurkar on Tuesday night. All were presented before the JMFC court in Bramhapuri on Wednesday and were sent in forest custody remand (FCR) till January 17.

Forest officials claimed that they have recovered 13 nails out of total 18 and three canines out of the four from the accused. The accused claimed to have burned five nails and a broken canine.

Title: Nirbhaya case convicts unlikely to hang on Jan 22
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

NEW DELHI: The scheduled hanging of the four Nirbhaya convicts on January 22 is set to be postponed, with the AAP government on Wednesday informing the high court that state’s jail rules make it mandatory they await outcome of a mercy plea filed by a death row convict.

The government told a bench of Justices Manmohan and Sangita Dhingra Sehgal that the date fixed by the trial court for executing the convicts is now only “academic” as the rules further specify that 14 days’ time must be given to the condemned man to “make peace with God” once the President rejects mercy petition and all remedies under law are exhausted.

All four convicts — Mukesh, Vinay, Akshay and Pawan — are currently on death row after a trial court issued the black warrant on January 7, fixing 7 am of January 22 to execute them.

Opposing Mukesh’s plea that HC stay his impending execution, the prison authorities submitted the petition is “premature” since the jail manual prohibits carrying out capital punishment awarded to more than one person in a case, even if only one of them moves a mercy plea. Hanging can be done only once the mercy plea of all convicts in the case is decided, standing counsel Rahul Mehra told the bench.

“Then your rule is bad if you cannot take action till all the co-convicts have moved a mercy plea. It seems there has been non-application of mind (while framing the rules). Every mercy plea is on different grounds, you can’t allow them to frustrate the judicial finding which has attained finality,” an irked bench responded. Only Mukesh has moved a plea seeking mercy before the President. It, however, refused to tinker with the January 7 order and said it was without any error, declining the prayer of Mukesh that the death warrant should be set aside as being un-executable as he has moved a mercy plea before the President.

The HC pointed out that there is no error in the trial court’s decision as on that date, none of the convicts had moved a curative petition or a mercy plea. It left it to Mukesh’s counsel, senior advocate Rebecca John and advocate Vrinda Grover , to approach the trial court if he wants the date of execution to be set aside based on a subsequent event — moving of the mercy plea. The HC took a dim view that despite the Supreme Court dismissing Mukesh’s appeal, review and curative petition and confirming death sentence, his lawyers moved the high court against a death warrant that is only taking the SC’s ruling to a logical end.

Taking a cue from HC’s observations, the lawyers didn’t press the plea and instead approached the trial court on Wednesday evening. The hearing also saw the HC tick off the jail administration and the Delhi government for delay on their part. The bench highlighted that even though the SC’s final verdict came on May 5, 2017, the jail authorities acted a year later in October, when they informed Mukesh he has seven days time to file a mercy plea.

“Put your house in order. It is in disarray. The problem is people will lose confidence in the system. Things are not moving in the right direction. The system is capable of being exploited and we see a stratagem to exploit the system, which is oblivious about it,” the court observed.

Mehra agreed that the system was being exploited by the convicts to “frustrate” and “defeat” the process of law but hinted that delay happened at the end of the court too when it came to issuing the death warrant. He said the rules say if by noon of January 21, no decision is taken on the mercy plea, the prison administration will have to move the sessions court for a fresh death warrant.

Title: Vikram Gokhale supports CAA, remembers Lagoo
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

National award-winning actor Vikram Gokhale

PUNE: National award-winning actor Vikram Gokhale on Wednesday said he supported the Prime Minister for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.

The veteran actor interacted with reporters during the Pune International Film Festival (PIFF). The festival honoured him last week with a Distinguished Award for his work in film, television and theatre.

“I am pro-CAA. I support (Prime Minister) Narendra Modi on this issue. All infiltrators, who are exploiting the taxes paid by the people of India, are being encouraged and provoked by the Leftists,” Gokhale said during the interaction.

Gokhale’s answers to the press were no-holds barred. “I have read Vinayak Damodar Savarkar’s works, his books. People, who haven’t read Savarkar’s works or understood it will not understand him ever. People criticize Savarkar for apologizing to the British, but he did that to come out of prison and aid in the Independence movement. What is the need to consider people like Savarkar and Mahatma Gandhi as gods? They were humans and they had their flaws,” he said, in response to a question.

While speaking about the release of a book that dubbed Modi as a modern day Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, as well as the NCP chief Sharad Pawar’s comments on Ramdas Swami and his role in the rise of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, he said, “I didn’t hear what Pawar said. I consider him to be one of the few visionaries within the NCP, as well as in Indian politics. The book wasn’t the right move. I don’t know who wrote the book, but he should have had better sense. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj cannot be compared with anyone,” he said.

The festival this year was dedicated to the actor and thespian Shreeram Lagoo, who passed away in December 2019. In a chat with festival director Jabbar Patel, who has also been his colleague, Gokhale spoke of Lagoo as a mentor, colleague and friend.

“He saw me performing on stage once. He mentioned it to Shantabai Jog (senior actor) that I wasn’t simply “acting”, but I was natural and spontaneous. That was one of the biggest compliments I have ever received,” he reminisced, adding that a list of the greatest ever actors would be incomplete without Lagoo’s name.

Toughest role

“I would say that over all of the roles I have played on stage, film, or television, the toughest role I have ever played is in the play Barrister, by Jaywant Dalvi. The role I played was very tough and complex. I also liked the role I played in Jabbar Patel’s Mukta, which also had actors like Dr Lagoo himself, as well as Reema Lagoo and Sonali Kulkarni.”

Title: 100 birds dead 1,500 injured during Uttarayan
Content: Ahmedabad: While Uttarayan means festivities for most of us, it spells havoc for birds who often get injured by the glass-coated thread used to fly kites. According to state government estimates, some 1,500 birds were injured in Ahmedabad over the two days of Makar Sankranti festivities – January 14 and 15 whereas, at least 100 birds were reported dead.Jay Bhatia, round forester, state forest department, said, “Most birds received for treatment were critically injured with their wings cut or with critical cuts on their bodies. We attended to some 2,000 cases of bird injuries in all from January 10-15, which are the days when maximum kites are flown.”The state government has been running its campaign, Karuna Abhiyan, as part of its initiative to treat injured birds.Ahmedabad-based NGO, Jivdaya Charitable Trust (JCT), also reported more than 800 cases of injured birds. “We received some 378 injured birds on Uttarayan alone and several others on Vasi Uttarayan i.e. on Wednesday. Most birds included pigeons followed by kites and eagles, who either had severe cuts on their wings or feet,” said Gira Shah, trustee, JCT.Other birds that were brought in included sparrows, parrots, ibises, owls, parakeets, peahen, green bee eaters, and comb ducks. According to Jivdaya, the Day 2 toll was 511 till 10pm.Nilay Patel, who is also a part of JCT said that more than 70 doctors were stationed at JCT campus including four from Australia since January 13. “The survival rate this time is more than 85%. Whenever a bird is brought in, it is registered along with the contact of the person who got the bird. They are covered with loosened old socks, given fluids and then treated,” said Patel.Most birds are confined to cages till they fully recover and then released in their natural habitats.There were several independent initiatives undertaken to save birds. For instance, a group of volunteers who call themselves ‘Ahmed Shah Army’ facilitated transporting birds from the location where they were injured to hospitals. “We had collaborated with JCT as well as Karuna Abhiyan to help transport birds based on calls they received. We were a group of eight volunteers who worked over these two days in areas around Sarkhej, Juhapura and even Dholka road,” said Gulmoin Khokhar, convener of the group.

Title: Jaipur: Ayurveda unit found making allopathic medicines illegally
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: In a raid, sleuths of crime branch unearthed an ayurveda medicine facility which was illegally manufacturing allopathic drugs at a residential area in Jawahar Nagar on Tuesday. The facility was running without any licence.

Additional director general of police (crime) B L Soni said one Jaiveer Yadav, who is representative of a Pune-based pharma company, had complained to the crime branch special team in-charge Jitendra Gangwani that there is a firm in Jawahar Nagar which is producing liver tonics and some medicines which are useful for woman health using his firm’s name. Acting on the complaint, the state crime branch team conducted raid at the house, he said. Soni said that they have registered an FIR at Jawahar Nagar police station against the accused Narendra Sukhani, after conducting raid at his house, found that he was using machines and illegally producing allopathic medicines .

In the initial investigation, the police claimed that they have found that he was supplying the allopathic medicines to his client in Agra. While checking the records of the firm, they have found that the accused firm had supplied 2000 bottles of liver tonics to Agra. The police have seized bill book and stock register. The police are questioning the accused firm owner Narendra Sukhani and his partner Ravindra Pratap Singh.

The police have registered a case under section 419, 420, 464, 468 and 120 B under IPC and section 33 E(C) of Drug and Cosmetic Act 1940. Soni said that they have detained one Arvind Sharma, a resident of Agra on the basis of statement of Ravindra Pratap Singh for allegedly selling the allopathic medicines produced in Jaipur from his chemist shop in Agra.

Title: Pune: Prelims, followed by board exams keep schools busy
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Most schools in the city have completed teaching the Class X syllabus but have an additional task ahead.

Schools have planned more than one set of prelims and remedial classes for the next two months. Special sessions to counsel parents of the Class X students are underway as are ways to familiarize students to take the examinations with a clear head and patience,

Principals said they were worried about the decreasing ability of students to sit for three-hour examinations and the impatience while attempting English and social studies papers.

Principal Teresa David of Laxmanrao Apte Prashala and Junior College affiliated to Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education said, “Over the years, we have noticed our students losing patience to take three-hour examinations. It is worse while they are attempting subjective papers like language and social studies.”

The fear of mathematics remains. “We are organizing special classes for mathematics and we are counselling parents to ensure that students attend them,” she added.

Principal C V Madhavi of DAV school (affiliated to Central Board of Secondary Education) also spoke about the growing restlessness among students.

“We would be conducting three prelims to familiarize our students with the setting of the board examination. Besides, we would be having a one-to-one session with their parents,” she said.

The school started extra classes in August.“We identified students who were weak in some subjects and topics where they scored less and followed it up with extra classes,” Madhavi said.

Sujata Mallick Kumar, principal of St Mary's School spoke about extreme competitiveness among parents as one of the reasons for making board examinations a bogey for their wards. “We are counselling students regularly,” she said.

Mallick said they were also inculcating time management skills in students. “ Restlessness among the younger generation is evident and we are doing everything to address it,” she added.

Title: Govt slammed for no Opinion Poll Day
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Margao: Slamming the BJP-led government for failing to hold a state function to mark Opinion Poll Day on January 16, Fatorda MLA Vijai Sardesai on Wednesday said that the government’s aversion to commemorate the historic movement reeked of a “pro-mergerist” mentality which, he said, strikes at the core of Goa’s “asmitai” (identity).

Speaking at an event “The Opinion Poll - A Reconnect” held outside Ravindra Bhavan, Margao, he said, “Today it is Muslims who are suffering because of CAA. Tomorrow it may be the minority status which may be threatened. Catholics should be vigilant. BJP says you require a strong leadership. Strong leadership means removal of minority status. This is their hidden agenda which could prove costly for Goans. Goa’s asmitai is actually a shield against all these divisive elements and divisive laws.

Title: Jaipur: Two kite-related deaths, over 250 injured in last two days
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

A man injured by a kite string in city

JAIPUR: Two persons died and more than 250 persons suffered injuries in kite-related accidents in the city in the past two days.

One 50-year-old Kamal Kundani had died on Tuesday afternoon, while one 26-year-old Saurabh, who fell from the rooftop of a hotel in Jalupura died while undergoing treatment at Sawai Man Singh hospital late on Tuesday night.

According to the reports, more than 250 persons suffered major and minor injuries due to kite-flying-related accidents. Makar Sankranti was celebrated on Tuesday but on Wednesday, classrooms in schools remained almost vacant as children spent their time at rooftops flying kites.

However, motorbike riders kept pouring in at city hospitals with injuries due to snapped kite strings.

“Cases of kite-related accidents kept coming in on Wednesday, but not in the numbers which were reported on Tuesday. At least 10 such cases were brought to the hospital but no one was seriously injured,” said an official at Institute of Traumatology and Orthopaedics of Sawai Man Singh hospital.

The doctors looked busy in giving stitches to the injured persons coming to the hospital in the past two days of the kite-flying festival.

Children also suffered serious injuries. A seven-year-old Chetan fell from rooftop, while 15-year-old Zainab suffered injury on her neck. A 17-year-old Mahtuba’s nose suffered injury, while 31-year-old Vikki, 41-year-old Lokesh, 30-year-old Gajendra and 16-year-old Aslam fell from the rooftop.

Title: Rajasthan: Two more test positive for swine flu
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

Two more persons were tested positive for swine flu in the state, one each in Jaipur and Kota, on Wednesday. So far, three persons have been diagnosed with the disease in the first 15 days of 2020. Two of the three cases have been found in Jaipur and one in Kota. A woman, resident of Ghantaghar area of Kota, was found infected with the virus.

Title: Sarpanch’s spouse hacked to death
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A youth allegedly hacked to death the husband of Songaon sarpanch in Baramati on Wednesday afternoon.

A group of people set about five shanties belonging to the suspect and his relatives on fire. Police have detained the suspect. Narayan Shirgaonkar , sub-divisional police officer (Baramati division), said, the suspect, under the influence of alcohol, was harassing the devotees. The sarpanch’s husband Yuvraj Thorat reprimanded him. The youth assaulted him with sharp weapons and fled.

Title: CAA a dangerous law: Tushar Gandhi in Alwar
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

A satyagrahi will have to stand alone, says Tushar

ALWAR: BJP is misusing the words of Bapu for its public awareness campaign on Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ), alleged Mahatma Gandhi’s great-grandson Tushar Gandhi on Wednesday

“CAA is the most dangerous law of independent India and the first which attempts to divide the country. This law is contrary to the Constitution,” he said, calling on the youth to come forward in the fight against CAA. Tushar was speaking at the headquarters of the NGO Tarun Bharat Sangh at Bhimakpura, headed by water man and Magsaysay award winner Dr Rajendra Singh.

Tushar was speaking at the headquarters of the NGO Tarun Bharat Sangh at Bhimakpura after honouring 150 people working in the field of environment on the occasion of the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma.

How can those who killed Gandhji understand him, he asked, attacking the Centre and alleging that BJP was misusing Gandhi's name.

"After Partition, Gandhiji had said that if any person was suffering in Pakistan, whether Muslim or from other religion, they too can come to India. But BJP has been using these words selectively and dividing the country," he said.

Speaking to journalists, Tushar said that after the enactment of this law, the nation itself has no meaning. "Nation does not consist of just land mass. There should be unity, equality and justice in the nation. But the way the NDA government is functioning, there is danger on all three counts," he said.

He advised citizens to adopt satyagraha and devise a systematic resistance movement. "A satyagrahi will have to stand alone; his inspiration can be anyone. The nation which Mahatma Gandhi had envisioned has to be saved," he said.

Arun Gandhi, grandson of Gandhi, said the atmosphere prevailing in the country was worrisome and hoped that it would return to the old soon.

On the question of the ongoing protests to save the Constitution, he said that if Gandhi was alive, he would have been a worried man. "He would have been concerned about the current situation," he said, adding that Indian polity was going through a stage similar to the one under British rule.

“The country will have to be saved. Bapu had the dream of equal economic development for everyone. But now the poor are becoming poorer and the rich becoming richer,” he said.

Title: ‘Manjhas’ play havoc with Jaipur power supply
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Power supply to major parts of the city snapped on Wednesday after Chinese ‘manjha’ played havoc with the power distribution system.

Sources in Jaipur discom said power supply from the 220kV Nala power house was disrupted, resulting in power outage and preventing supply of power from feeders to major parts of the city in the afternoon.

The old city and neighbouring areas were the most affected.

Supply from the power house was hit at about 2.40pm for about 90 minutes, the time which the agency took to restore supply from Nala, said an official.

All feeders from the power house were affected. Some feeders were supplied power from alternative sources. In some places, local disturbances also resulted in supply disruption.

Most of the disruptions occurred due to Chinese ‘manjha’, which have metallic and plastic coating, that got entangled in power lines, resulting in short circuits and supply failure.

Incidentally, the Chinese ‘manjha’ has been banned in the state. But the administration failed to enforce the ban effectively.

Title: Bombay high court directs Maharashtra to identify, list wetlands in two weeks
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Bombay high court

MUMBAI: The Bombay high court on Wednesday gave the state government two weeks to prepare and submit brief documents identifying wetlands in Maharashtra.

“Complete the job,” said a bench of Justices Shahrukh Kathawalla and Burgess Colabawalla, which did not accede to a request by Anil Digikar, principal secretary, environment department, to allow a month’s time to complete the task.

The court heard a public interest litigation filed in 2013 by NGO Vanshakti to preserve wetlands and was miffed that despite the high court’s earlier orders and even reminders by Digikar to district collectors and divisional commissioners, there was no progress.

The judges asked Digikar what action he proposed against erring officials. “They are not bothered about the court’s orders or your directions...And if you take it lightly, they will not obey you,” said Justice Kathawalla. Digikar told the court that he had informed chief secretary Ajay Mehta, who, in turn, has directed all district collectors to finish the work of preparing the brief documents of wetlands as soon as possible.

But when Digikar asked for month’s time, the bench said it must be completed within 15 days.

The brief document provides characteristics and features of a particular wetland . Wetlands include marshy areas, estuaries, creeks, tanks, ponds, reservoirs, lakes and other water bodies.

Government pleader Priyabhushan Kakade submitted the state’s affidavit in which it has stated that other than Nagpur and Parbhani, even Nandurbar has no wetlands.

The NGO’s advocate Zaman Ali countered it is incorrect that these three places have no wetlands.

Ali said the national wetland atlas of Maharashtra shows Nagpur has 1,054 wetlands, Parbhani has 276 and Nandurkar 735, respectively. He said the national wetland atlas of Maharashtra was prepared by the State Application Centre, which is at Ahmedabad in Gujarat and is the research wing of the Indian Space Research Organisation.

The bench sought the information to be given in writing and posted the next hearing to January 29 for an update.

Title: Man narrowly avoids accident, slashed by motorcyclist
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 41-year-old businessman from Krishnanagar, riding a motorcycle, braked suddenly to avoid some dangling manja on Naroda Road and this almost led to an accident with another motorcycle. The two riders got into a fight and the businessman was slashed on his neck.

In his FIR at Krishnanagar police station, Ashok Karguwal, a resident of Saijpur-Bogha, states that the incident occurred on Wednesday afternoon when he was headed to Saijpur Tower from Krishnanagar. He was about to get tangled in some manja and thus braked suddenly. A man on the motorcycle behind him, almost rammed into Karguwal’s motorcycle, said the FIR.

When Karguwal told the man to drive properly, the man got angry and began abusing him. When Karguwal remonstrated, the man threatened him and slapped him two to three times.

“The man threatened me , pulled out a knife and slashed me from my throat to my temple,” said Karguwal in FIR.

People soon gathered around and the there and the man rode away on his motorcycle. Karguwal was rushed to a private hospital and needed 14 stitches on the gash.

Karguwal alleged that the man had tried to kill him, by slashing his neck, in his FIR.

Krishnanagar police registered a complaint of attempted murder, using abusive language and charges under the Gujarat Police Act. Cops are scouring CCTV footage as part of their investigation.

Title: Pakistan-born Nita became Indian in September, will fight local polls from Tonk in January
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Nita Kanwar moved to Jodhpur from Pakistan's Sindh province in 2001

JAIPUR: In November 2001, she had migrated to Jodhpur from Sindh in Pakistan nurturing hopes for a better education and finding a perfect match. Eighteen years later, educated and confident, Nita Kanwar (36) received her Indian citizenship in September 2019.

And now, she will contest for the post of sarpanch in the local elections, to be held on January 17, from Natwara gram panchayat in Tonk district.

This has come at a time when there have been widespread protests across the country against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR).

Nita’s father-in-law Thakur Laxman Karan, who has been sarpanch thrice in Natwara, is her inspiration and guiding her to contest the panchayat polls from the village. Karan was also the district Youth Congress president earlier.

“I was granted citizenship at the Tonk collector office in September last year. It took me at least three years to complete the process of citizenship. My father-in-law is guiding me in the panchayat election,” said Nita, who has a daughter and son.

Nita and her elder sister Anjana Sodha (who also got Indian citizenship) migrated from Sindh’s Mirpur-Khas 19 years back.

She completed her BA degree from the Sophia College, Ajmer, in 2005, and later got married to Punya Pratap Singh, who runs a travel firm in Tonk, in 2011. Her sister also got married and settled in Jodhpur.

Since Sindh is pre-dominated by Rajput Sodhas, who cannot marry another Sodha as per tradition, the sisters had decided to migrate to Jodhpur to find a match from the Rajput community here. “Initially, I stayed with my aunt in Jodhpur before moving to Ajmer for graduation. Till Class XII, I had studied in Sindh," she added.

“I am contesting from a general seat, which is reserved for women. I want to work towards promoting gender equality, women’s empowerment, providing good education and proper medical facilities for the girl child and helping them find employment. I am getting a lot of support from my family members and villagers,” Nita told TOI.

While Nita’s father Swaroop Singh and brother Rajawant Singh Sodha still live in the Sindh province and continue doing agriculture, her mother Mohan Kanwar lives in Jodhpur.

Read this report in Bengali

Title: Uttarayan spirit not gone with the wind
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: Terraces swept clean. Sweets, savouries, cold drinks, music, kites, thread, glares, and masks all in place. The city was set for a perfect Uttarayan. But for kitists, a lot depends on Uttarayan and Vasi Uttarayan, constantly changing wind speeds and direction. On Tuesday and Wednesday, the wind direction constantly changed and at times there was no wind, leaving kitists disappointed. Only in the evenings did many get to enjoy the festivities.

Akash Solanki, a resident of Jivraj Park, said: “Flying kites is my favourite part of the festival and even though the winds were fluctuating from morning till afternoon, I stayed put on the terrace.” Solanki went on to say: “It was tiring but fun. But come evening, the spirits were instantly up as the wind was good.”

The wind does not matter, said Kushal Dani, a 23-year-old resident of Vejalpur. “ I love flying kites and try to ensure that I make the most of the festival,” Dani said. “This is the only day when I meet family and friends and spend the day on the terrace.”

Others, however, chose not to work too hard trying to fly kites and decided to gorge on festive delicacies. “Generally, we get to the terrace as early as 8am but because the wind was weak in the morning, there was no point going to the terrace,” said Shreyanshi Shah, a resident of Paldi. “Thus, we decided to devour scrumptious Uttarayan food.”

“We went to a friend’s place in the pol but the winds were a disappointment in the morning. The arms got a good exercise. But the evening was fun as we not only flew kites but also tukkals once it got dark.” Tasmay Dholakia, Satellite resident

“Enjoying music and the atmosphere in the company of friends on the terrace evokes the Uttarayan spirit in me. Even though the winds were not favourable, we enjoyed to the fullest.” Payal Shah, Nehrunagar resident

Title: Pune: Three petrol pump attendants, handler held for stealing card data and siphoning off money
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Three attendants of a petrol pump in Pune Camp and their handler were arrested on Tuesday for installing skimming sensors on debit/credit card readers and using the data to siphon off money from the accounts of the card holders.

The cyber crime branch of the Pune police, who made the arrests, said the loss to customers may run into lakhs of rupees.

The crime involves skimming of card details, noting down PIN numbers and selling the data to two Delhi-based men who cloned the cards and swiped them to transfer money into their accounts.

A team headed by assistant commissioner of police (crime) Shivaji Pawar and police inspector Jayram Paygude arrested Mithun Ali, Noel Shaikh, Saimuddin Ali and Zulfikar Ahmed, all residents of Malda in West Bengal, after receiving as many as 60 complaints of the same nature in the last two weeks.

Seven cellphones, 20 fake debit cards, 12 original debit cards, ID cards, Aadhaar cards and Rs 1,230 in cash have been recovered from them.

Citizens had complained that their cards were used to withdraw money from their bank accounts without their knowledge. The investigating team found that all the complainants had used their cards at the same petrol pump. They then focused their investigation on the attendants employed at the fuel station.

They found that Mithun, Noel, and Saimuddin had started working at the petrol pump three months ago and were from the same village. All three used a skimming machine to steal data from the cards that customers used at their petrol pump to pay for the fuel, the police said.

The three would peek into the machine while customers were keying in the PIN and note it down. They would sell the data to Zulfikar, who in turn, sold it to two Delhi-based men who paid all four between Rs 20,000 and Rs 30,000.

The Delhi duo would make duplicate cards and transfer the money to their own accounts, the police added.

Title: Ragpicker run over by AMC truck at Pirana
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 15-year-old boy from Dahod, who had come to the city a montha go to earn a livelihood by ragpicking, was crushed by a truck contracted by the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) when he was picking rags at the Pirana dump on Wednesday.

A complaint filed with K division traffic police said that the incident occurred at around 7.30am on Wednesday.

Police said that they have seized the truck and driver is still absconding.

According to the FIR, “He was picking through the waste with his elder brother, uncle and aunt. A garbage truck, going in reverse, crushed him.”

The deceased’s uncle said, “His parents were not able to properly feed the four-member family at Jhalod in Dahod district, as they are farm labourers. They recently sent their son to rag pick so he could make some money. For around a month, he was working with me at the Pirana dump yard.”

The investigating officer, sub-inspector of K division traffic police, B B Vaghela, said they have questioned the contractor about the driver’s whereabouts. “It seems that the truck driver did not see the boy, who was carrying a large plastic bag to put whatever he salvaged in plastic, and reversed the truck. The right rear wheel crushed him,” said Vaghela.

Police have registered a complaint of negligent driving causing death and began an investigation into the case.

Earlier, a 15-year youth from Dahod had come to Ahmedabad and worked at Pirana for three months to pay his fees. There are 1,000-odd labourers working at the top of the Pirana mound, salvaging things to be recycled or reused. Most make between Rs 10,000 and Rs 12,000 a month. Some are here with their families, including little children.

This business activity at Pirana is, however, illegal. Only 60 women have been authorized by SEWA, an NGO, to salvage plastic or paper from teh garbage. With corporation officials refusing to speak about this business at Pirana, there has been a long-standing turf war between SEWA women and other ragpickers.

Officials said that most rag-pickers know about dumptruck movements, but this 15-year may not have been aware ran behind it as it reached the top to empty its load.

Title: H1N1 deaths: Gujarat most vulnerable
Content: Ahmedabad: Gujarat is India’s most vulnerable state when it comes to swine flu deaths. Delhi is the most vulnerable in terms of morbidity or susceptibility to swine flu cases. Public health specialists conducted a detailed study of swine flu cases and deaths registered between 2010 and 2017 and adjusted these figures against the respective state’s population to arrive at ranks for morbidity and mortality.Gujarat, with 1,651 swine flu deaths in the period, and Delhi, with 11,703 cases, were deemed to be the most vulnerable. The study was carried out by experts of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR); Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, the US; and a paediatric consultant from Kolkata. The experts studied 1.14 lakh swine flu cases which ended in 8,543 deaths.A senior official of the health department said that the Saurashtra region (especially Bhuj and Rajkot) and Ahmedabad in central Gujarat acted as pacemakers for the flu during each outbreak. “A total of 1,322 positive H1N1 cases were reported in Ahmedabad city till April 1 in 2019 . Also, 28 people had died of the flu in the first three months. This was a four-year high,” said the senior health official. In 2015, the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) had reported 2,131 cases in the first three months.
