Title: Helmet rally for women marks road safety week in Chandigarh
Content:
Chandigarh traffic police organised a road show of women two-wheeler riders wearing helmets on 31st National R... Read More

A police official makes a point on wearing helmets

By: Shubham SharmaCHANDIGARH: UT traffic police organised a road show of women two-wheeler riders wearing helmets on the occasion of the 31st National Road Safety Week at the Children Traffic Park (CTP), Sector 23, on Wednesday. The rally was flagged off by newly elected mayor Rajbala Malik at the park. Around 250 women two-wheeler riders, including women constables, college students and other women residents, participated in the rally.The rally started from the CTP, passed through 23/24 light point to Panjab University gate no. 2 and then to the PGI chowk, further going to PGGC, Sector 11 and GCG-11, Government Multi Specialty Hospital-16 chowk, DAV College, Sector 10, Sectors 9/10 light point to Matka chowk, 16/17 light point and finally ending at the cricket stadium roundabout.Pallavi Jain, a participant of the rally, said that generally women do not wear helmets while driving two-wheelers, but in most of the fatal accidents women have died due to head injuries while driving two-wheelers without wearing helmets. The main motive of this rally is to sensitize women riders to wear protective headgear while driving two-wheelers.Police officials said, "Every year, the UT police celebrate National Road Safety Week and organise several programmes on road safety and impart awareness about traffic rules among city residents. The traffic police is striving hard to bring down the numbers of fatalities in the city and the cops have succeeded in doing so. The area of concern is to bring down women casualties on roads in the city and habit of wearing helmets among women two-wheelers riders can help a lot."Police department also distributed head gears among women participants of the helmet awareness rally.

Title: Filling station staffer pours petrol on teacher, booked
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: Police on Tuesday booked an employee of a filling station for pouring petrol on a schoolteacher in Jodhewal.

Sonia Kataria, 30, a resident of Ghati Ravidas in Daresi, said in her police complaint, “I had gone to a filling station on Kailash Road on January 8 to get my two-wheeler refuelled. While fuelling my vehicle tank, an employee deliberately poured petrol on me to harass me. When I objected to it, he poured more petrol me.”

As the fuel caused irritation in her eyes and on skin, she cried for help. “But other employees started laughing at me. I even called up the filling station owner to lodge a complaint, but he did not come to the spot,” Kataria, a computer teacher, added.

Jodhewal police station assistant sub-inspector Nirvail Singh said, “A case has been registered under sections 285 (negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter), 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others) of the IPC against the employee — Mohit Rana. He will be arrested soon.”

Title: Fastag 25% lanes in 8 toll plazas in Punjab, Haryana to collect cash
Content:
There are nine toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana.

CHANDIGARH: Considering high cash transaction at four toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana, the Union ministry of road transport and highways has granted 30-day exemption to these toll plazas to convert a maximum of 25% Fastag lanes into hybrid lanes to collect cash from vehicles. There are nine toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana.Toll plazas exempted in Haryana are at Chandimandir, Gharonda, Panipat, and Shambhu and those in Punjab are at Dapar, Ladowal, Berhampur and Dhareri Jattan. The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has identified a total of 65 toll plazas across the country with high cash transactions and has given them an exemption of 30 days more. In other non-exempted toll plazas, just a single lane on each side would continue to be cash lane.In an another important decision, the NHAI has also decided that various concessions, like in case of villages close to toll plazas or vehicles returning within 24 hours, would only be offered to vehicles with FasTags. The NHAI’s national electronic toll collection (FasTag) programme has achieved around 58% target in Punjab and Haryana.NHAI regional project director K L Sachdeva informed TOI that on an average 500 FasTags are being sold from each toll plaza in Punjab on a daily basis. He said that around 40,000 vehicles pass through Dappar toll plaza on daily and around 55% of them now have FasTags. “I would also request those vehicle owners who have purchased FasTags, to ensure that their prepaid wallet linked to FasTag has enough money so that they are not stuck at the toll plazas and cause inconvenience to others,” said Sachdeva.The letter issued by the Union ministry on January 14 reads, “Depending on the traffic pile up at these 65 fee plazas, not more than 25% ‘FasTag lane of Fee Plaza’ may be temporarily converted to hybrid lanes. This is to be considered and decided on a case-to-case basis not below the level of the regional officer concerned.”At least 75% of lanes at these 65 toll plazas would remain operational as FasTag lanes in order to incentivize vehicles carrying FasTag. The Union ministry has directed the NHAI to take necessary measures within 30 days to ensure smooth flow of traffic through toll plazas and ensure declaring all lanes as FasTag lanes.

Title: Himachal Pradesh, airport authority sign MoU for Mandi international airport project
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Greenfield airport in Nagchala will be a JVC between AAI (51%) & govt (49%)

SHIMLA: The project to construct first international level airport of Himachal Pradesh in Mandi district took another step towards reality with the state government signing a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Airports Authority of India (AAI) at New Delhi on Wednesday.

The development of Greenfield airport at Nagchala in Mandi will be through a joint venture company (JVC) wherein AAI will hold 51% equity and the remaining 49% equity will be held by the state government or its designated agency.

Tourism and civil aviation director Yunus on behalf of Himachal Pradesh government and H S Balhara, executive director, planning, signed the agreement on behalf of AAI in the presence of AAI chairman Arvind Singh.

The JVC will undertake the functions of design, finance, construction, completion of airport project for commercial civil aviation operation and maintenance, besides operation and management of the airport. The state government will acquire and transfer the required land for the airport project to JVC.

Since coming to power, chief minister Jai Ram Thakur-led government has given a special impetus to establish the airport of international standards in the state to facilitate high-end tourists. For this ambitious project, 3,490 bighas of land has already been identified at Nagchala.

Of the total land required for the project, only 330 bighas is government land while remaining 3,160 bighas is private land. the proposed airport will have a 2,100-m runway.

OLS survey for the proposed site for international level airport has been completed and Union ministry of civil aviation has given in principal approval for its construction. Jai Ram Thakur had recently said the state government would have to bear the cost of land acquisition and it had taken up the matter with the finance commission.

Construction of Greenfield airport would not only boost high-end tourism in the state, but would also be of great strategic importance from defence point of view as Himachal Pradesh shares its boundary with China.

Title: City pitches in for road safety awareness
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: A traffic awareness programme has been started by the Ludhiana Police under the 31st Road Safety Week . Traffic Police announced that no challans would be issued in this week of the road safety drive, and only awareness would be raised at various areas in the city. The drive was inaugurated by police commissioner Rakesh Aggarwal.

To educate residents about traffic rules, a special drive was organised at Kissan Mela on the fourth day of the Road Safety Week. The awareness rally was flagged off by Bharat Bhushan Ashu, Punjab Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs minister. Approximately, 4,000 people took part in the rally. NGOs, municipal corporation councillors as well as social organizations have been roped in, and residents are being educated about traffic rules.

Deputy commissioner Pradeep Kumar Agrawal, police commissioner Rakesh Kumar Agrawal, noted actors Nirmal Rishi and Jaswinder Bhalla, municipal councillors Mamta Ashu and Sunny Bhalla, singer Sukhwinder Sukhi, and several senior officials of the district administration were present on the occasion. The cabinet minister also administered an oath to city residents to follow all traffic rules, and help police make Ludhiana free from traffic jams and accidents.

Continuing to create awareness, Ludhiana Police on the 5th Day of the Road Safety Week arranged a special awareness seminar at KVM School, and at Guru Nanak Khalsa College for Women, Ghumar Mandi. Following the seminar, a rally was organised to create awareness among the public with regard to helmets. About 150 girls from the college participated in the drive, along with traffic police on their bikes and scooters. The drive started from Khalsa College in Ghumar Mandi to Fountain Chowk, proceeding towards Mall Road, onward to Bharat Nagar Chowk, then to Bhai Wala Chowk, Aarti Chowk, and then via Ghumar Mandi, the drive ended at Khalsa College itself. The students held placards in their hands, and also raised slogans to create awareness.

Speaking about the drive, ACP Traffic Gurdev Singh said, “We are so happy to see the response of the public during these drives. It gives us a ray of hope, and we could see that now residents of Ludhiana want some kind of change, and are ready to help police in their efforts. People actively participated and pledged to help police make Ludhiana free of traffic jams and accidents. I am personally happy to see this kind of attitude from the public. It gives us strength and power after receiving such a response. We will try our best to make the best out of this safety week, and to connect more and more people to this awareness drive.”

Police chief Rakesh Aggarwal said, “The theme of the 31st Road Safety Week is ‘Sadak Suraksha, Jeevan Raksha’. Under this, we are taking steps to create awareness among the public. Today (Wednesday), we carried out a helmet awareness drive. The purpose of the helmet rally was to catch the attention of the public and disseminate the message of importance of helmets for bike-riders.”

Title: Massive arrangements planned for TET
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: The Punjab School Education Board (PSEB) secretary and director-general of School Education, Punjab Mohd Tayyab took stock of preparations for Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) going to be held at district headquarters of the state on January 19, and has put the whole administrative machinery to work for conduct of the test. Board secretary Mohd Tayyab disclosed that unprecedented security arrangements were being made for the state-level test, which includes geared up the state police force also.

He advised candidates to go through instructions regarding the test carefully, as there were various features which may look new, and are compulsory to be used during the test. “No candidate shall be allowed to take his own pen or pencil to the examination hall, and they will be provided a blue ballpoint pen with the OMR (Optical Mark Recognition) sheet itself. There will be no negative marking, but if more than one circle is darkened, it will draw action against the candidate. All candidates, however, will be allowed to take away the last carbon copy of their OMR sheet along after the test is over,” said the secretary.

According to information, police deployment for the test will also be heavy, but restricted to the main gate of examination centres. Even water men will not roam in the centre. Any objectionable item with the candidate or impersonation shall draw severe action like UMC and FIR directly. Phone, Pen, watch etc. will not be allowed. Videography of the examination process is a must, while CDs of the videographed material shall ensure recording of timing of receiving of question papers, opening of question paper box, distribution of question paper etc. Faces of all the candidates and duty staff shall also be videographed.

Title: Rohtak police advisory on cyber frauds
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Rohtak: Concerned over a large number of cyber fraud cases being reported in the district, police here on Wednesday issued an advisory to curb such crimes.

In 2018, 268 fraud cases were registered. This number swelled to 465 in 2019, said police.

Police said fraudsters were now misleading people by creating a website bearing the names of similar major companies. People who shop online remain under their radar. “Fraudsters are now hacking bank accounts through QR codes (quick response codes),” police said.

Explaining the modus operandi, police said to win the trust of people, cyber criminals pretended to be military personnel and put Army photos on their profile.

Once they defraud a customer, the their number in the phone’s blacklist. “They make a whatsApp call instead of a normal call to avoid getting caught,” it added.

These days, said police, such fraudsters were tricking people into divulging their details by way of asking them to complete KYC formalities for PayTM. Police also asked ATM card users to thoroughly check the cash-dispensing machine before using it.

Title: Hailstorm, rain damage wheat on 650 acres in Ladwa villages
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Kurukshetra: Recent hailstorm and rain have damaged wheat crop on 652 acres of land belonging to 306 farmers of 23 villages in Ladwa block of Kurukshetra district, an agriculture department official said on Wednesday.

Kurukshetra deputy director of agriculture (DDA) Pardeep Meel said the worst-affected villages included Niwarsi, Sultanpur, Gudha, Sonti, Halalpur, Dugari, Lohara, Jogi Majra, Dabkhera, Gudhi, Bir-Sonti, Bhallari, Ghrolla, and Bakali.

On Tuesday and Wednesday, farmers of these villages started applying for compensation under the crop insurance scheme. The agriculture department is expecting more applications on Thursday. “As per the report till Wednesday, 306 farmers of Ladwa block applied for compensation,” DDA Meel said.

When asked about the loss to vegetable crops due to hailstorm, he said, “As of now, insurance is available for only the wheat crop. There is severe loss to vegetables, including potato, peas and tomato, but these are not covered under the crop insurance scheme. A different survey would be conducted by the government for that.”

Kurukshetra district revenue officer (DRO) Chandi Ram Chaudhary said they were getting reports of loss to vegetable crops due to hailstorm in Ladwa and details were still being gathered. “After three years, vegetable growers had got a good price for their crops, but they have suffered losses again. Vegetables, flowers, and wheat in Ladwa have been severely damaged due to hailstorm,” Rakesh Bains, spokesperson of Bharatiya Kisan Union (Haryana), said.

Title: SAD urges gov for CBI probe into ‘Rs 4,100-crore power scam’
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Chandigarh: A Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) delegation on Wednesday met Punjab governor V P Singh Badnore and urged him to direct the Congress government to order a CBI probe into alleged nexus between ministers, Congress leaders and officials in allged “Rs 4,100-crore power scam”.

The move comes at a time when the government has finally asked Punjab advocate general to review the power purchase agreements (PPAs) signed during the previous SAD-BJP government. The incumbent Congress has been long been accusing SAD dispensation of signing PPAs that were in favour of the private power generators and harmed the state. Yet, it ordered a review only after facing lot of anger over repeated power tariff hikes.

On Wednesday, the delegation, led by SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal, urged the governor to direct the state government to dismiss all ministers and officials who had dealt with relevant files which had allegedly caused Rs 4,100 crore loss to Punjab. It raised the demand for sealing all relevant files to ensure they were not tampered with. The governor was also requested to ask the state government to pay the additional “power tariff hike due to the scam” from the government treasury, instead of charging people for the same.

Sukhbir claimed that the state government had deliberately lost important cases in the court and tribunal after hefty amount had allegedly been taken by certain persons from private companies. The state government had concealed important information from courts and misrepresented facts to benefit private players, the SAD alleged.

The delegation said in the case of coal washing charges, for which the state was forced to pay Rs 1,400 crore immediately and Rs 1,100 crore soon, the erstwhile SAD-BJP government had clarified to the Rajpura thermal power plant management that the amount was to be arranged by the successful bidder. Once contractual obligations started, the private player started claiming costs of washing coal, which were rejected even at the level of Punjab State Electricity Regulatory Commission (PSERC), and even the Appellate Tribunal for Electricity (APTEL) during the SAD-BJP government.

However, the delegation alleged, after the Congress government came into power, it adopted a dishonest approach in the Supreme Court stating falsely that there was no methodology to measure calorific value of coal at the project site. “This was a blatant lie as para 68 of the Supreme Court judgement of 2017 in Nabha Powers Limited versus PSPCL clearly states that calorific value of coal should have been measured at the project site,” the delegation submitted.

The governor was told that in the case of judgment of an arbitration tribunal related to charges of a coal company, it was revealed during a hearing in the high court that the Congress government did not challenge the award which granted Rs 1,602 crore to a coal company for two-and-a-half years.

The delegation also alleged that electricity consumers had been burdened by an additional Rs 22,000 crore in the last three years of the Congress tenure. Sukhbir later told mediapersons that the party would exercise its option to approach the Punjab and Haryana high court in case it did not get justice in the matter.

Title: Issewal gang rape: 5 witnesses record statement, next hearing on Jan 22
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: Five formal witnesses recorded their statements before the court during the hearing of the Issewal gang rape case in a Ludhiana court on Wednesday. The next date of hearing of the case in the court of additional session Judge Rashmi Sharma is on January 22.

On 9 February last year, a group of men had allegedly gang-raped a 20-year-old student after holding her and her friend hostage when they had gone to Issewal area to celebrate chocolate day. Police had booked 10 unidentified accused in the case and arrested six, including Jagroop Singh, a private vehicle driver of Jaspal Bangar, Ajay of Tibba who originally belonged to Gonda in Uttar Pradesh and works as driver at Petrol pump and four nomads (two from Ludhiana and one from Nawanshahar) and a juvenile from Jammu and Kashmir.

Counsel for complainant Hardayal Singh Grewal said they examined three witnesses with regard to motorcycles used in the crime and an official deposed regarding the ownership of the motorcycle of one of the accused. He added that a mobile SIM card seller also deposed in the court.

The complainant’s counsel said woman constable Sukhpreet Kaur, who took the swab sample of the survivor will be cross examined in the next hearing.

Counsel for one of the accused, Rachpal Singh Mand said the hearing of the case started after lunch and went on for about two hours. He added that all the witnessed examined were formal witnesses.

On October 1 last year, the defence counsels had concluded the cross examination of the survivor. Prosecution had averred that time that she fully supported the case of prosecution. On December 3 last year, the defence counsels had concluded the cross examination of the friend of the survivor.

The case

The test identification parade was done in the presence of judicial magistrate Ankit Airi on February 22, 2019, the survivor had identified all the accused at the Central Jail.

The police had presented chargesheet against the accused in the court of Airi on April 4.

The copy of challan assessed by TOI had suggested that only six accused are found to be involved in the case according to DNA sample reports, call mapping records of talks between the accused, mould from the crime spot and evidence on the record. All six have been arrested.

It had, however, added that if more persons are found to be involved in the case, it will produce supplementary challan into the matter. The police have added more sections including 354 B (assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty), 379 B (snatching), 364 A (kidnapping for ransom, etc) and 397 (robbery, or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt) of IPC, were added in the FIR on March 25, 2019.

Title: Brace up for wet weather again from today
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: Residents continued to enjoy the mild warmth of the sun on Wednesday, which brought in a certain pleasantness in the city. However, there is bad news in store for residents as the meteorological department has predicted rainfall activity in the city in the next three days.

Even as the sun was around for most part of the day before the sky turned cloudy in the evening, it failed to push the maximum temperature much higher, which was recorded at 15.4 degrees Celsius (three degrees below normal, and 0.7 degrees less than on Tuesday). However, the minimum temperature on Wednesday was recorded on the higher side at 6.6 degrees Celsius (a degree above normal, and 0.8 degrees more than on Tuesday).

Meanwhile, fog that appeared in the city on Wednesday morning did bring down visibility to 300 metres at 8.30am, which increased slightly to 400 metres at 11.30am. By 2.30pm visibility jumped to 1,000 metres, and further to 1,200 metres at 5.30pm.

As residents had barely started rejoicing in the pleasant weather after the recent rains, the Met department threw a wet blanket on their plans. A department official at Chandigarh said that for three consecutive days from Thursday, the weather forecast is ‘generally cloudy sky with a few spells of rain or thundershowers’. He added that the day temperature is expected to fall in the next three days, but the night temperature might rise. The maximum temperature is expected to fall to 14 degrees until Saturday, while the night temperature might rise to 9 degrees by the same day.

Title: Cops go hi tech in issuing challan, violators remain indifferent
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Harleen Walia

In a bid to smoothen the process of traffic violations while the city police has introduced e challaning system and is even sending the copy of challan to the violators through speed post, a large number of violators continue to remain indifferent in paying the fine for challans.

As per the data available with the police, only 23% of total 3,404 challans issued till December 2019, have been paid by the violators to the Police. The city police collected Rs. 2.71 lakhs till the month of December from 775 violators, while the fine for the remaining 2,629 challans is yet to be paid by the violators.

Senior police officials said out of these 2,629 challans, as many as 518 have come back to cops for various reasons, the primary being the incorrect address or change in the address of the violator. In such cases, challans are distributed to the zonal-level police personnel who then traces the violator and delivers these challans.

When contacted ACP Gurdev Singh said, “The number of people paying their challan is quite low, despite the simplification of the process of payment in a violator can make the payment in an easy way.

“Every effort to make this process public/user friendly has been made and violators can even pay through payment gateway using debit and credit cards. They they don’t need to stand in long queues in order to pay the challan. Ludhiana is the only city in Punjab with this advanced facilities to the violators. After a challan is issued to violators, they are given a time frame of a month to pay the fine and if they still fail to do so, the challan is sent to the court for judicial proceedings. After that, depending upon the orders the violators are ssued summons. If fine is not deposited, first bailable warrants are issues and and then non bailable warrants are issued to the violators.”

While senior police officials claimed that the facility was rare in Ludhiana and will go a long way in smoothening the process of challaning besides, curbing corruption to a great extent, some locals felt that there was need to spread awareness about it amongst the residents.

Some locals also felt that the system would help curbing the corruption and manage system with less manpower.

Amanpreet Kaur, a resident of Preet Nagar said, “This initiative is quite appreciable. People used to take the traffic rules quite lightly. Many thoughts they could get away by paying small amount, but with the advanced system, people will now have to follow the traffic rules or have to pay higher fines. So, this system will definitely help curb the corruption.”

Kamaljot Singh, a resident of Tharike however said due to lack of awareness the the advanced system may make things more complicated and lead to waste of funds.

Pay Rs 50 as postal charges with challan

In a meeting which was held with District Road Safety Committee, under the Chairmanship of the Deputy Commissioner Pradeep Kumar Agrawal, the traffic police raised the issue of postal charges which were incurred by the police to send the e-challans to the violator of traffic via speed post. In order to solve this issue, Deputy Commissioner directed that the postal charges are now to be paid by the defaulter. So, a violator is now supposed to pay Rs.50 as postal charges along with the amount of fine.

Title: Indian Army holds mini-marathon in city
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: On the occasion of 72nd Army Day, a mini-marathon was organised in the city by the Indian Army. More than 100 army personnel and more than 600 city residents participated in this mini marathon, which started from Guru Nanak Stadium here at 6.30am and passed through Durga Mata Mandir, Bharat Nagar Chowk, Bhaiwala Chowk, Aarti Chowk, Ghumar Mandi, Fountain Chowk, before culminating again at Guru Nanak Stadium.

This mini-marathon was organised by the Vajra Air Defence Brigade deputed at Dholewal Military Complex here. Brigadier Manish Arora, station commander, Dholewal Military Complex, Ludhiana, was the chief guest on the occasion. Addressing the participants, he said, “The main aim of organising this mini-marathon is to inculcate a sense of national integration among fellow countrymen and also encourage them to join the Indian Army. The Indian Army is always there to serve the country as well as countrymen, and we urge the youth to become a part of the Indian Army.”

Brig Arora also informed that boys and girls aged below 15 years and women above 15 years of age participated in the 5km-run, whereas boys aged above 15 years and men participated in the 10km-run. The winners of this mini-marathon were honoured with medals, certificates, and cash prizes.

Meanwhile, in another programme, city-based business association FICO (Federation of Industrial & Commercial Organisation) organised a traffic awareness drive on Tuesday. The association members led by president Gurmeet Kular distributed reflectors to truck drivers and also made them aware about the importance of reflectors and obeying traffic rules.

Speaking on the occasion, Kular said, “As there is a lot of fog these days, there is a high risk of accidents, so in order to reduce the chance of accidents and protect precious lives, we have distributed reflectors among truck and tempo drivers in Focal Point area. We are trying to take up the responsibility of making Ludhiana accident-free by taking up small activities like these to make commuting safer for everyone. In the coming days, we will cover tractors and trolleys as well under this initiative.”

Other businessmen who joined Kular in this initiative included Rajeev Jain, Manjinder Singh Sachdeva, Manjeet Singh Khalsa, Japneet Singh Chhatwal, Gurcharan Singh Mankoo, Valaity Ram, Rajinder Singh Sarhali, Achhru Ram , Sarabjeet Singh Kaka, Paramjeet Singh.

Title: Fog: 2 trucks catch fire after collision
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: Two trucks caught fire after a collision due to dense fog on Ludhiana-Malerkotla road, near Khanna, on Wednesday. Driver of one of the vehicles, Gurjinder Singh of Muktsar, was injured in the accident.

“One of the trucks was going towards Malerkotla from Khanna. Near Fatehpur bus stand on Khanna-Malerkotla road, visibility was poor due to dense fog. As a result, it collided with another truck coming from the opposite direction around 10am,” said a cop of Isru Police Post.

Following the crash, the fuel tank of a truck burst and diesel spilled on to the road. “It triggered a blaze that engulfed both the vehicles. Onlookers rushed to the spot and tried to douse the fire,” the cop added.

An eyewitness said, “A passerby soon called up the fire department.”

In the meantime, an SUV, which was coming from Malerkotla side, suddenly jammed on the brakes on spotting the accident. This took a milk van that was behind it unawares, and it rammed into the SUV.

Khanna fire officer Yashpal Rai said, “Three firemen were sent to the spot along with a fire tender. The blaze was soon brought under control.”

Police said Gurjinder Singh was under treatment at Khanna civil hospital, where his condition was stated to be stable.

The crash led to traffic chaos on the road. Police had to divert the traffic to a Fatehpur village road to clear the logjam.

Title: Fastag 25% lanes in 8 toll plazas in Punjab, Haryana to collect cash
Content:
There are nine toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana.

CHANDIGARH: Considering high cash transaction at four toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana, the Union ministry of road transport and highways has granted 30-day exemption to these toll plazas to convert a maximum of 25% Fastag lanes into hybrid lanes to collect cash from vehicles. There are nine toll plazas each in Punjab and Haryana.Toll plazas exempted in Haryana are at Chandimandir, Gharonda, Panipat, and Shambhu and those in Punjab are at Dapar, Ladowal, Berhampur and Dhareri Jattan. The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has identified a total of 65 toll plazas across the country with high cash transactions and has given them an exemption of 30 days more. In other non-exempted toll plazas, just a single lane on each side would continue to be cash lane.In an another important decision, the NHAI has also decided that various concessions, like in case of villages close to toll plazas or vehicles returning within 24 hours, would only be offered to vehicles with FasTags. The NHAI’s national electronic toll collection (FasTag) programme has achieved around 58% target in Punjab and Haryana.NHAI regional project director K L Sachdeva informed TOI that on an average 500 FasTags are being sold from each toll plaza in Punjab on a daily basis. He said that around 40,000 vehicles pass through Dappar toll plaza on daily and around 55% of them now have FasTags. “I would also request those vehicle owners who have purchased FasTags, to ensure that their prepaid wallet linked to FasTag has enough money so that they are not stuck at the toll plazas and cause inconvenience to others,” said Sachdeva.The letter issued by the Union ministry on January 14 reads, “Depending on the traffic pile up at these 65 fee plazas, not more than 25% ‘FasTag lane of Fee Plaza’ may be temporarily converted to hybrid lanes. This is to be considered and decided on a case-to-case basis not below the level of the regional officer concerned.”At least 75% of lanes at these 65 toll plazas would remain operational as FasTag lanes in order to incentivize vehicles carrying FasTag. The Union ministry has directed the NHAI to take necessary measures within 30 days to ensure smooth flow of traffic through toll plazas and ensure declaring all lanes as FasTag lanes.

Title: Acute staff crunch bogs civic body down
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: The announcement of property tax inspectors and clerks that they would observe three-day mass leave can be seen as an alarm for the civic body, which is facing acute staff shortage. This has been affecting not only public dealing at the offices, but also the field works. Just as the property tax inspectors did, there is a danger that other branch employees can also dissent, making it difficult for the civic body to do its work.

Against sanctioned posts of 124 inspectors/senior assistants, only 37 are filled while 87 posts are lying vacant. Similarly 423 posts are sanctioned for clerks, but only 168 are filled and 255 posts are vacant.

The civic authorities claimed that they have taken up the issue of staff crunch several times with local bodies minister Brahm Mohindra and other seniors but it is not getting resolved. There are many branches in Ludhiana civic body where not even a single vacancy has been filled and additional charge has been given to the existing staff for handling the work.

The worst affected is building branch where the post of senior town planner is vacant, against six posts of assistant town planners not (ATP) even a single ATP is available. The head draftsman has been given the charge of ATPs of four zones.

There is already problem of illegal buildings and encroachments in city and enforcement is not possible without required staff in the civic body. There is no executive engineer in electricity branch, no executive engineer in computer branch, no junior engineer in light branch or workshop.

Requesting anonymity, one of the civic officials claimed that there is serious problem of staff crunch as city has grown tremendously. But instead of increasing the number of regular employees, the MC is opting for contractual staff, who are not competent enough to handle the job. He said one employee has been given several jobs at a time, which he alleges, is affecting the mental health of the employees.

When contacted, mayor Balkar Sandhu said the matter of staff crunch has been raised several times with senior authorities in Chandigarh and fresh recruitment has to be done at state government level. He said he has called up the employees union members for discussing the issues, which are troubling them so those can be taken to the right platform.

4 secretaries against sanctioned 2 posts

Where in other wings there is scarcity of staff against sanctioned strength, of two posts four secretaries are working at the moment. The officials, however, claimed two of these four are drawing salary against vacant posts of assistant commissioners.

Executive engineer (light) Balwinder Singh went on medical leave

The excess burden of work on civic officials had started coming out with lone XEN (light) Balwinder Singh went on medical leave and applied for premature retirement last year. The officials close to Balwinder Singh claimed that councillors, MLAs and senior officials used to humiliate him in every meeting for non-functional streetlights, especially after the work was handed over to Tata company.

Smart city has no architect to design for industrial town

The city, which was among first 20 to be made smart city, does not have single architect for designing. There is one post of architect and two posts of assistant architects but three of these posts are lying vacant.

Title: Despite mayor’s assurances, property tax staff still on mass leave
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: The property tax inspectors and clerks did not return to their work even on Wednesday despite mayor Balkar Sandhu assuring them on Tuesday evening that he would get their issues resolved. The inspectors and clerks have now approached the union of MC employees to raise their matter with mayor and commissioner. On Thursday, a meeting has been fixed regarding this.

Meanwhile, the rooms where inspectors and clerks do their duty wore a deserted look and visitors were asked to come again another day. Only those who had come to deposit water supply and sewerage bill, were able to get their task done as two employees were made to sit specifically for this.

A union member said the property tax inspectors and clerks were being told to recover water supply and sewerage dues, collect data of properties to match with UID number data by clicking the pictures of properties, issue the blue cards and also perform the duty of block level officer for voter cards process. Property tax inspectors also complained that they were being humiliated by the senior officials and despite doing work they were being targeted, he said adding that they did not get credit of their work. On Thursday, they will meet mayor Sandhu and hopefully, the issues will be resolved, he added.

Meanwhile, mayor Sandhu, said before going on mass leave, the employees should have first come to him. He said without recovering the dues from the public, the employees should not ask for salary from the department.

Nearly 50 property tax collectors/inspectors have gone on mass leave since Tuesday, claiming that they are being overworked and that they were assigned many tasks at a time and it was affecting their personal lives as well.

Title: Peda upgrades bio-CNG plant at Hambran Road
Content:
This story is from January 16, 2020

Ludhiana: To put an end to pollution in Buddha Nullah being contributed by the dairy industry at Hambran Road, the Punjab Energy Development Authority (Peda) has upgraded the bio-CNG plant in the dairy complex. Peda will hand over this plant to private player for operation and maintenance (O&M). Earlier, the plant was not fully functional due to which the cowdung waste was not being utilised properly in the plant and the drain was getting polluted. Peda officials claim the plant is fully operational now.

The 1MW capacity bio-gas plant is running at Haibowal dairy complex in 2.42 acre of land since October 2004 and from 2012 the construction of CNG plant was started. Peda also conducted a trial run of this plant for almost a year. Now, this plant has the capacity to generate 4,000kg of CNG gas in one day and they are producing 42 quintals of organic manure for the fields as well. Almost 160 tonnes of dairy waste is produced in the Hambran Road unit for converting it into manure.

Peda district manager Anupam Nanda said, “We have completed the trial run and its fully operational now. We will hand it over to the private company for further operation.” He said it will help in utilising the waste in proper manner without harming the environment.

Meanwhile, for establishing a second bio-CNG plant at Tajpur Road, Peda has signed an agreement with municipal corporation (MC) and they will be signing the lease agreement with Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) this week. Glada has reserved land for such a plant for long time, now. Total chunk of land available is four acres, but Glada will give 2.5 acres for the plant.

These plants are required to curb the pollution level in Buddha Nullah because the dairy farmers, in the absence of any other source of disposing off the cowdung, were throwing the waste directly into the drain or in the sewage system, choking the system.
